This is her third loan with MFP, she hopes to continue working with much enthusiasm and responsibility to make her payments so that the communal bank continues to work well. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of wholesale cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace más de 8 años tiene una tienda de comestibles en un local que alquila mensualmente, su deseo de generar mayores ingresos la motivaron a implementar esta bodega que en la actualidad tiene una buena cantidad de mercadería, y esto es lo que la ha motivado a seguir adelante, renovando e innovando con los productos que ofrece. Victoria no descansa para atender su bodega, y sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes acuden a ella para comprar los productos de primera necesidad diariamente. Hasta el momento los esfuerzos de su arduo trabajo han dado frutos, por lo que Victoria desea, para el futuro, acrecentar su capital de trabajo. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y está renovando su compromiso de trabajar por el bienestar de su banco comunal. El dinero que Victoria está solicitando será invertido en la compra de más mercadería, en gaseosas, dulces y alimentos envasados.
texts.en:
Victoria, 40, lives with her two children in a rented house. For over eight years she has had a food store in a location that she rents by the month. Her desire to generate greater income motivated her to start this store. The store currently has a good amount of merchandise. This is what has motivated her to get ahead renovating and innovating with the products that she offers. Victoria works tirelessly tending her store. Her neighbors, who are her primary customers, come to her to buy their daily basic needs. Her hard work has paid off. In the future, Victoria wishes to increase her working capital. This is her third loan with MFP. She is renewing her promise to work for the well being of her community bank. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise like soft drinks, sweets, and canned food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has four children. She has received an education through junior high school. Mary works as a trader selling fish at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. She has been doing this work since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of the household.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more fish for smoking and, with the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more fish for smoking

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Miguel esta ubicado en el mercado San Miguel del barrio Guanacaste de la ciudad capital, la cordinadora del grupo es Jesica S. que tiene  35 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene dos empleadas que le ayudan a cocinar y a atender a los clientes que llegan a comer a su local, ella tiene tres hijos y es madre soltera, con las ganancias que le deja su negocio ella les da educacion, vestimenta y alimentacion.
La Sra. Maria V. tiene 68 años de edad quien tiene una venta de frutas y medicinas naturales en el mercado San Miguel, ella es una persona de la tercera edad que ha luchado para poder salir adelante, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos con la cual mantiene su hogar.
la Sra. Virginia R. tiene 61 años de edad quien tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, ella ha luchado tambien por mucho tiempo para poder salir adelante con su familia, actualmente ella le ayuda a sus nietos con la alimentacion. 
este grupo a logrado crecer ya que son bien unidas y se ayudan entre si.
todas ellas necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is located in the San Miguel market in the Guanacaste neighborhood of the capital city. The coordinator of the group, Jesica S., is 35. She sells sweets. She has two employees who help her cook and wait on the customers who come to her place to eat. She has three children, and she is a single mother. With the earnings from her business, she gives her children education, clothing, and food. Maria V., 68, sells fruits and natural medicines in the San Miguel market. She is an elderly person who has fought to be able to get ahead. This is her only source of income to support her household. Virginia R., 61, sells sweets. She, too, has fought for a long time to be able to get ahead with her family. She currently helps feed her grandchildren. This group has been able to grow because they are so united, and they help each other. All of them need a loan to be able to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, juices, soft drinks, tortillas, cheese, cheese products, beef, pork, chicken, cups, paper plates, beans, rice, coffe, natural medicines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine N., 50, is the chairperson of Kasenge group in Mukono. She is a business lady with a stall in Kasenge where she sells fresh fruits and vegetables she gets from the Mukono and Nakawa markets every day. She does this because she wants to sell all her produce fresh and this has enabled her to keep her customers to herself.

She also has a business of selling clothes from the same area for ladies, children and men, and this helps bring in an extra income. She is married with six children. Four of the children are in school (candidate classes). She also cares for an orphan. Justine needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sale. She has a dream of owning a boutique in the future.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for sale

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi G. is divorced and has 6 dependents. She received an education through the primary school level. Maame Esi sells banku, a local meal made from maize. It is a very popular food that is eaten by most Ghanaians. Since 1998, she has been preparing this food and selling it at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. Maame Esi is solely responsible for the upkeep of her house. She uses her income to fulfill her responsibilities.

Maame Esi will use the loan to purchase maize for making banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Esi plans to take care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase maize for making banku.

loans.name: Heliodoro Jose

texts.es: Heliodoro José López N. tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Heliodoro tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan por cuenta propia. La actividad económica de Don Heliodoro es una pulpería. Hace más de 30 años que tiene de dedicarse a este negocio. Don Heliodoro inicio este negocio familiar por medio de su Padre, y mas tarde el decide mantener el negocio y decide ofrecer una variedad de productos para que sus clientes siempre se encuentren satisfechos. Los propósitos de Heliodoro son de brindar el mejor servicio de atención a todos sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de golosinas, mecates, bolsos, mochilas, calzado y cuadernos. El deseo de Don Heliodoro es preparar a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Heliodoro José López N. is 55 years old, and is unmarried. Mr. Heliodoro has 2 children who are both self-employed. Mr. Heliodoro works as a store owner. For more than 30 years he has been dedicated to this business. Mr. Heliodoro began the business through his father, later deciding to offer a variety of products and the best service to his customers. The funding will be used for working capital and to purchase candy, rope, bags, backpacks, boots and notebooks. Mr. Heliodoro desires to prepare his children to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Melva De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Melva de los Ángeles U. V. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Melva tiene  4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Melva es venta de queso y crema. Hace más 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Melva utiliza la técnica de llevar los productos y distribuirlos hasta sus viviendas de sus  clientes, y en el trayecto de la semana realiza el cobro de sus productos, la compra del queso es en Managua. Los propósitos de Doña Melva es promover su producto a más clientes. El financiamiento es utilizado para capital de trabajo por lo que la compra de estos productos es por quintal y para encontrar la venta mas accesible viaja a Managua, sauce y otros departamentos. Los deseos de Doña Melva son de ampliar su negocio para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melva de los Ángeles U. V. is 53 years old, and her marital status is married. Doña Melva has 4 children who are all students. Doña Melva's business is selling cheese and cream. She has been in this business for more than 12 years. Doña Melva uses the technique of bringing the products and distributing them to her customers' homes, and during the week she collects the money for her products. The cheese is purchased in Managua. Doña Melva's intention is bring her product to more customers. The financing is used for working capital for which the products are purchased by the quintal, and to make the sale more affordable she travels to Managua, Sauce and other departments. Doña Melva's wish is to expand her business to gain a better quality of live.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C., 24 ans est mariée et membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus et de pâte d’arachide. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Khady C., age 24, is married and has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling cloth and peanut butter. She wants to bolster her business to improve her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and peanut butter

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina S. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Christina is a baker who bakes and sells bread at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. She has operated her business since 1986. Her husband is a trader. Christina uses her income to assist her husband with the upkeep of their house. Christina will use the loan to purchase purchase flour and other ingredients for baking. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to purchase land.

loans.use: Christina will use the loan to purchase purchase flour and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Melba Mercedes

texts.es: Melba Mercedes R. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Melba tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Melba es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Melba inicio este negocio por su Mama, y con el tiempo fue que el negocio le gusto este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Melba son de mejorar cada día la calidad de sus comidas para obtener una variedad de clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevo y cuajada todo esto es para materia prima por lo que tiene que elaborar la comida. El deseo de Doña Melba es tener su negocio de una manera mas estable y la mismo tiempo ayudar a generar fuentes de trabajo ya que necesitaría de un personal que le ayude a elaborar  la  comida.
texts.en:
Melba Mercedes R. is 45 years old and she is married. Melba has two children and they are both studying. Melba's economic activity is the making and selling of food. For more than 14 years, she has been involved in this business: she started this business for her Mother, as it was the type of business that she liked. The aims of Melba are to improve the quality of her meals every day in order to attract a variety of customers. The financing is to add to her work capital for buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, egg and curd as raw ingredients from which she makes her dishes. Melba's wish is to make sure her business is more stable and at the same time to help generate a source of employment as she needs an assistant to help with making the food.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Jacqueline Gutiérrez tiene 44 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos, casada su esposo le ayuda económicamente. El objetivo que ella se ha puesto es brindarle a su familia una estabilidad tanto económica en cual unas de las prioridades es la construcción de su vivienda. Doña Jacqueline de profesión u oficio costurera y agregando la comercialización de productos de cereales y otros productos de alimentación ya que adquiere otros ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida, tiene 11 años de experiencia en el ramo de ofrecerle al cliente su servicio de costura y la iniciación de la elaboración de los cereales naturales. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic adquirió oportunidades para crecer como empresaria. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materia prima de costura y productos como: maíz, cacao, semilla de jícaro, carne de cerdo, etc.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Gutiérrez is 44 years old, she lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has three children, is married and her husband helps her economically. The aim she has is to provide her family with economic stability for which one of the priorities is the construction of their home. Jacqueline is by profession a seamstress and she also sells cereal and other food products in order to have more income with which to improve her quality of life. She has 11 years experience in the field of offering clients a tailoring service and starting the production of cereals. Thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic she has acquired opportunities to grow as a businesswoman. The loan she is asking for it to purchase the raw materials for sewing and products such as maize, coco, pumpkin seeds, pork meat etc.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material and grains such as maize, coco, pumpkin seeds in order to make cereals

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
La señora Dulia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, Vive en el Barrio Alto la Florida,  ella posee estudios de segundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años. La señora Dulia se dedica a compra y venta de frutas, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2200.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar más frutas como plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas, etc., para luego venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto.

Su sueño es poner una gran tienda donde tambien pueda ofrecer abarrotes, ya que nos indica que la venta esta algo baja.
 
Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha el cumplimiento de sus compañeras y la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dulia is a member of the Yunga Uyo community bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one son. She lives in the Alto la Florida neighborhood. She completed high school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years. Dulia buys and sells fruit. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wants a loan for 2,200 PEN to buy more fruit like bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, grapes, etc. She will sell them at the 15th of August market. Her dream is to have a big store where she could also sell groceries. Sales are down a bit. She really likes the fulfillment of working with her colleagues and the way that Manuela Ramos works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, grapes

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna B., 59 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés. Elle veut renforcer son commerce et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maimouna B., age 59, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling dyed cloth. She wants to bolster her business and to support her husband with covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell dyed fabrics

loans.name: Carmen Esther

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II”, de la provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos a su cargo, ella posee estudios superiores incompletos. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, a fin de comprar mas abarrotes y ofrecerlos en su tienda. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero podrá adquirir mas mercadería (fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite) y de esta manera seguir creciendo como empresaria; su mayor deseo es darle una profesión a sus hijos.

Lo gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y las charlas que recibe, ya que la ayuda a mejorar sus conocimientos y su desempeño en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Aswancaris II community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 32, a single mother, and has two children to care for. She went to college, but did not finish. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She buys and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy more groceries for her store. She currently wants a loan for an additional 1,500 PEN to get more merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar, oil). This way she will continue growing as a businesswoman. Her biggest desire is to give her children a profession. She really likes the meetings and talks at her community bank. It helps her to improve her knowledge and her performance in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, soft drinks

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos a su cargo, Vive, En Jr. Núñez Butrino en Azangaro, ella  tienen estudios de 4to de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor (ovinos).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprará mas ganado mayor para mejorarlo y venderlo.
Nos cuenta que su sueño es ser mayorista y así poder vender al por mayor en las ferias de otros lugares, incluso de otros departamentos.
 
Sonia nos dice que está feliz y le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.  Le gusta mucho los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 39, in a common law marriage, and has four children to care for. She lives at Jr. Núñez Butrino in Azangaro. She has a fourth grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She buys and sells small livestock (sheep). Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wants an additional loan for 800 PEN to buy more large livestock to improve and sell. Her dream is to be a wholesaler. That way she would be able to sell wholesale in the fairs in other places including in other departments. Sonia is happy, and she really likes her community bank’s meetings. She likes the sporting events a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and llamas

loans.name: Yessenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Yessenia de los Ángeles R. tiene  26 años de edad, nació en Managua y habita en el barrio la Esperanza, es casada y su marido es auxiliar de limpieza en un supermercado de la capital, tienen tres hijos una  de 5,7, y niño de nueve meses, las metas para su familia es obtener una vivienda digna que le permita dar seguridad a su familia, ella tiene un año laborando en seguridad interna , y su meta personal es adquirir un buen empleo que le permita obtener mejores ingresos y sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana de su hogar y que le permita un margen de ahorro para asegurarle a sus hijos un  futuro mejor. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y construir una pared externa de un cuarto y sala. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Yessenia de los Ángeles R., 26, was born in Managua. She lives in the Esperanza neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a cleaning assistant in a supermarket in the capital. They have three children ages five, seven, and nine months. The family goal is to get a decent house that will provide safety for the family. She has worked for a year in internal security. Her personal goal is to get a good job that will give better earnings, meet the daily household needs, and allow for a margin of savings to assure her children of a better future. This loan is to buy construction materials to build an external wall to a bedroom and living room. She gives thanks to the institution for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build an inside wall to a room

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 03 hijos, ella vive en el Sector Wincachani Comunidad de Punta Sahuacasi.  Tiene estudios de 3er grado de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ganado menor (alpacas, llamas).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, este dinero le servirá para comprar mas cabezas de ganado.

Le gustaría  tener un emporio para obtener más ganancias, así con el dinero que obtenga darles educación a sus hijos.

Maria dice que lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas, además del ahorro.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” Communal Bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 44 years old, a single mother with three children. She lives in the Wincachani community of Punta Sahuacasi. She completed 3rd grade of elementary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She sells livestock (alpacas and llamas). Her first loan was for S/ 300.00 nuevos soles. Today she would like a loan for S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy more heads of livestock. She would like to have a general store to increase her earnings and with the money she earns provide an education to her children. Maria says that what she enjoys the most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and talks, in addition to the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpacas and llamas

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande, en la capital de Managua, sus hijos están independientes, su negocio es la elaboración de cosa de horno, herencia de su mama desde hace cuarenta y siete años de experiencia. Desde horas muy temprano se levanta para hacer el proceso de nesquizar el Maiz y preparar el queso. Con este crédito es el séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por que ha podido mantener sus ventas estables, y también ha hecho remodelación del horno y de su vivienda, con este crédito va  a comprar leña, maíz queso y otros productos para hacer las ricas rosquillas y cosa de horno para poder cubrir la demanda de sus ventas. Sus planes es poder ampliar el negocio, y captar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is 48 years old and lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of the capital city Managua. Her children are grown. Her business is baked goods, which she learned from her mother and has been baking for 47 years. In the very early morning hours she gets up to process the corn dough and prepare the cheese. This will be her 7th loan with Afodenic and she is grateful that she has been able to maintain steady sales, and also she has remodeled her oven and home. With this loan she is going to buy firewood, corn, cheese and other products to make delicious pastries and baked goods to meet the demand generated by her sales. Her plans are to be able to expand her business and gain new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, cheese, firewood and other products to make her pastries

loans.name: 20 De Noviembre Group

texts.es: El grupo “20 de Noviembre” esta representado por Eloina Jenny,  es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado de veintiún  personas,  de las cuales 6 son hombres y 15 mujeres todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades, los hombres son transportista,  algunas de las mujeres tienen su venta de abarrotes en sus domicilios, otras se dedican a la venta de productos diversos como empanadas en colegios y plazuelas. La competencia es mínima ya que van donde hay gente que ya conoce sus productos y saben de la calidad que están hechos sus productos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos materiales y para la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajos para realizar un ingreso diario mayor que brinda una mejor calida de vida a sus hogares. La experiencia de los socios respecto a grupos solidaR. es mínima pero saben que se requiere de responsabilidad y honestidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones y poder optar de futuros financiamientos.
texts.en:
The “20th of November” group is represented by Eloina Jenny. This is a new group made up of 21 people, 6 men and 15 women, all of whom have different businesses. The men work in transportation, some of the women sell groceries from their home, others sell a variety of products such as baked turnovers in the schools and plazas. Their competition is low as they go where the people are familiar with their products and know the quality of their products. The financing is to buy consumable materials and to repair the equipment used in their work in order to earn a greater daily income and provide a better quality of life in their families. The experience of the members in such a group is minimum but they know that they need to demonstrate responsibility and honesty in order to meet their obligations and be able to access future loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eger Oswaldo

texts.es: El señor Eger Oswaldo M. tiene 31 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Hialeah con dos hijos que su esposa dio, ambos jóvenes estudian, el es cocinero de un restaurante desde hace tres años, anteriormente era mesero con su buen comportamiento lo ascendieron en la cocina. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto y reparación del techo de su vivienda, da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzado que han sido de muchos beneficios para su familia. Sus planes es poder llegar hacer supervisor del restaurante para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eger Oswaldo M. is 31 years old and married. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and has two children with his wife. His two children are in school. He has been a cook in a restaurant for three years. Before, he was a waiter, but because of his good performance he was promoted to work in the kitchen. He is in his fourth cycle with Afodenic. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to build a room in his house and repair the roof. He thanks Afodenic for helping him achieve goals that have benefitted his family a lot. His plan is to be able to move up to become supervisor of the restaurant and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room and repair the roof

loans.name: 1ª De Mayo Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Primero D. Mayo" esta representado por la señora Maria Ester, es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado por 14 integrantes, algunas socias ya trabajaron con grupos solidarios con nuestra institución. Una mayoría D. la socias se dedica a la elaboración y distribución D. pan y masitas, otras D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y al servicio D. limpieza y portería. La competencia es dura en el mercado y los miembros del grupo saben que si quieren realizar sus ventas deben esforzarse para tener un buen producto terminado y  buena mercadería para competir en el mercado, es aquí donD. la Institución coadyuva brindándoles capital para poder competir con productos nuevos y variados. Las socias tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios y saben que para obtener un financiamiento deben tener responsabilidad y cumplir con los pagos a tiempo solo así podrán obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Primero D. Mayo" ("First of May") is represented by Maria Ester. It is a new group that is maD. up of 14 members, some of whom already had worked with lending groups with our institution. The majority of the borrowers bake and distribute bread and pastries. Other borrowers sell cosmetic products, clothes, and shoes, and others offer cleaning services or work as caretakers. Competition is tough in the market and the members of the group know that if they want to have good sales they have to work hard for a good finished product and good merchandise. It is in this area that the Institution collaborates with them, providing the capital so that they can compete with new and diverse products. The borrowers have experience working with lending groups and they know that they must be responsible and make their payments on time to obtain loans. Only this way can they increase their income and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa (quinto año). Vive en el Barrio San Andrés Av. Ilo 757.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de 3 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso (snack).
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, podrá comprar pan, cafe, pollo, paltas, galletas, chocolate, azucar y gas.  Ella desea poner una cafetería y construir su casa.
A María le gusta la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros y la puntualidad de las demás socias.  Así mismo refiere que le gusta las reuniones y charlas que recibe.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a partner of Banco Comunal "Las Fronterizas" in the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province in the Puno department. She is 31, in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. She has a high-school education. She lives in Barrio San Andrés, Av. Ilo 757. María has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for USD$100. She sells snack food. With this USD$1000 loan she will be able to buy bread, coffee, chicken, avocados, cookies, chocolate, sugar and gas. She wants to set up a cafeteria and build her house. María likes working with Manuela Ramos because of the savings and the punctuality of the other partners. She also likes the meetings and chats.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread, coffee, chicken, avocados, cookies, chocolate, sugar and gas.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Gifty works as a seamstress at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. Her husband is a trader. Gifty uses her income to assist her husband with the upkeep of their family.

Gifty will use the loan to purchase materials for sewing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty plans to build a house, so she is saving for it.

loans.use: Gifty will use the loan to purchase sewing materials for sewing.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es: El grupo  "Rosas Blancas" inicia su tercer ciclo de trabajo con la institución en este ciclo son solamente 12 socios de los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la venta de ropa usada actividad que requiere constantemente de capital para adquirir la mercadería por fardos que luego sacan a la venta, los otros socios se dedican a la costura de ropa deportiva que acomodan en los colegios y en tiendas deportivas, otras de las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, refrescos, mantas y a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos. En el ámbito del comercio la competencia es dura pero los socios saben como salir adelante gracias a sus años de experiencia y su calidez para atender a sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para el cambio de rubro para los que venden ropa usada y para la compra de insumos y materiales para ayuden a incrementar sus ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.
texts.en:
The “Rosas Blancas” (White Roses) group begins its third cycle working with the institution. In this cycle there are 12 members, the majority of whom sell used clothing. This type of business requires constant capital to acquire merchandise by the bundle to then sell. Other members sew athletic clothing for the schools and sports stores. Other members sell food, beverages, table cloths and cosmetics via catalog. The business competition is fierce but the members know how to be successful thanks to their years of experience taking care of their customers. The financing will be used in each of their areas, buying items for those that sell used clothing and materials and consumables to help increase their sales in order to provide their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vanesa García tiene 32 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposo ayuda al negocio, es la venta de hierro de segunda, desde hace dieciséis años, comenzó reciclando hierro en la calle en  una jabalina, ahora vende hierro y estribos, y tiene dos trabajadores a su cargo, el cual ha podido ir mejorando y incrementado su negocio con los prestamos de Afodenic este es su onceavo crédito el cual va invertir en la compra de sesenta quintales de hierro para cubrir la demanda. Sus planes es poder tener una ferretería en donde pueda ofertar todos los productos.
texts.en:
Señora Karla Vanesa García is 32 years of age and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband helps with the business which is selling scrap iron. It's been 16 years since he started recycling iron in the streets in a "jabalina". Now he sells iron and shapes and has two employees working for him. He has been able to improve and expand his business with the loans fro AFODENIC. This is his eleventh loan which will be used to buy 60 quintals (six tons) of iron in order to keep up with demand. His plans are to be able to have a hardware store where he would be able to offer lots of products.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 tons of iron.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La Sra. Mary L., radica en la localidad D. la Guardia, a 20km. D. la cuidad D. Santa Cruz, en el barrio 3 D. mayo. Su esposo el Sr. Seferino Melgar se dedica a la actividad D. la agricultura en la localidad D. Sombrerito distante a 15 km. D. la Guardia, en la que tiene: plátanos, naranja , mandarina, lima, palta y otros.
Estos productos son comercializados por su esposa la Sra. Mary, en la cuidad D. Santa Cruz zona la Ramada.
Esta Sra. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo, en nuestra institución la cual se siente muy agradecida por brindarle el apoyo para que pueda seguir trabajando a pesar D. su avanzada edad. Lo cual le hace sentir ganas D. seguir aportando su granito D. arena para el desarrollo D. la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mary L. lives in the Guardia area, 20km from the city of Santa Cruz, in the 3 D. Mayo neighborhood. Her husband, Seferino Melgar is involved in agriculture in the Sombrerito area, which is 15km from Guardia. He has bananas, oranges, tangerines, limes, avocados, and other fruits and vegetables. Mary sells these products in the Ramada area of Santa Cruz.

This is Mary's first loan with this institution, and she is very grateful for the support, with which she will be able to continue working despite her age. She would like to continue contributing in a small way to the development of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal fruits

loans.name: Socavon Group

texts.es: El grupo "Socavón" representado por la señora Casilda que va cursando junto a sus 12 miembros su tercer ciclo de trabajo con la institución demostrando honradez y responsabilidad. En este grupo la mayoría de las socias se dedican a la elaboración de productos de repostería como ser pan casero, tortas, empanadas y masitas en general, otras se dedican a la venta de dulces, velas, comida y al servicio de transporte público. Dentro del ámbito comercial existe mucha competencia en especial en los precios ofrecidos a los clientes es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder diversificar sus productos y para la compra de insumos y materiales que ayuden a minimizar costos y producir en mayor cantidad de productos, mejorando sus ingresos que ayuden a brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The "Socavón" ("Tunnel") group is represented by Casilda, who together with her 12 members are on their third loan cycle with Kiva's partner and have demonstrated honor and responsibility. In this group the majority of the members make a living selling baked good such as homemade bread, tortas, empanadas and pastries in general. Others make a living selling candy, candles, food or work in public transportation. In their commercial arena there is a lot of competition in pricing, and it's for this reason they are requesting the loan so they can diversify their products and can purchase ingredients and materials to help minimize their costs and produce larger quantities of their goods. This will improve their income and help them provide a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Dionicia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años.  Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, el cual utilizó como capital para su negocio de abarrotes que tiene en el distrito de desaguadero.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles, podrá ampliar su capital y pretende adquirir más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche, detergentes, también invertirá parte del dinero en su otro negocio (restaurante).  Las ganancias las invertirá en seguir mejorando su negocio y de alguna manera ayudar en la educación de sus hijos; ya tiene casa propia, ahora quiere comprarse su carro.
texts.en:
Dionicia belongs to the Rio Desaguadero community bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 28, married, and has three children. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She used the loan as capital for her grocery business, which is located in the Desaguadero district. With the loan for 3,000 PEN, she will increase her capital and buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and detergents. She will also invest part of the money in her other business (restaurant). She will invest the earnings in continuing to improve her business and, somehow, help with her children’s education. She has her own house; now she would like to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk, and detergents

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Soplin Vargas  Nº 260, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella.

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 400.00 y con el apoyo de su esposo, decidieron implementar su negocio de ventas de repuestos, también se dedican a arreglar motos, nos cuenta Rosita que sus ventas le va muy bien y no se equivocaron en escoger el rubro de ventas de repuestos que lo combinan muy bien con la venta de agua tratada para beber.
En la actualidad continua ejerciendo el mismo negocio, esta ubicado en un ambiente acondicionado en su propia casa, siendo sus principales clientes sus amigos, motocarristas y vecinos. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprara más repuestos de motos, aceites y lubricantes e insumos que le van a permitir atender con calidad y eficiencia a sus clientes. 

Ella y su esposo, toman las decisiones en las compras y  ganancias de su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Rosa Aurora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena is a member of the Abiseo community bank. She lives at Jr. Soplin Vargas Nº 260, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, Martín department. She is 42, married, and she has two dependent children who go to school. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, started with her first loan for 400 PEN and her husband’s help. They decided to start a business of selling replacement parts. They also fix motorcycles. Sales are going very well. They did not make a mistake in choosing to sell replacement parts, which goes very well with selling drinking water. They are still in the same business, which is located in a specially converted space in her home. Her primary customers are her friends, motorcycle drivers, and neighbors. With this loan for 2,000 PEN, she will buy more motorcycle replacement parts, oils, lubricants, and supplies that will allow her to tend to her customers with quality and efficiency. She and her husband make the decisions about purchases and earnings in her business. She feels very confident about offering her products. She is considered to be a fighter who is steadfast and responsible with her payments. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement part to augment her stock

loans.name: Rosalin

texts.es:
Vive en la casa de sus suegros aproximadamente 10 años, con su esposo el Sr. Fernando Melgar y sus tres hijos. El esposo tiene como actividad el transporte urbano de pasajeros en la cuidad de Santa Cruz.
Sus tres hijos actualmente se encuentran estudiando en una escuela fiscal de la Guardia. 
El objetivo como madre de la Sra. Rosalin es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para de esta manera puedan recibir una mejor educación, ya que los ingresos del esposo no son lo suficiente para poder cubrir la colegiatura de sus niños. Se siente agradecida con la institución “es una de las mejores   maneras para poder seguir creciendo económicamente, y poder mejorar tus ingresos”. Comentó…
texts.en:
Rosalin has lived in her in-laws' home for approximately 10 years, with her husband Fernando Melgar and their three children. Her husband works in passenger transport in the city of Santa Cruz. Their three children are currently studying in the local school in Guardia.

Rosalin's goal as a mother is to continue to support her children in their studies so that they can receive a better education, as the income of her spouse is not sufficient to cover the school fees. She is grateful to this institution, which she says is "one of the best ways to be able to keep growing economically and to increase one's income."

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits, which are currently reduced in price

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 45  años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia de su tierra natal. Cada día es una oportunidad para seguir trabajando en sus tareas agrícolas, en especial al cuidado de sus animales, los cuales vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Alejandra tiene principalmente ovejas y vaquillonas, además de sembrar papa y otros productos nativos de su zona. Aunque su labor suele ser dura, para más adelante, su deseo es continuar trabajando para aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene, para obtener mayores ganancias cuando los venda. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de permanecer en su banco comunal para seguir trabajando con su grupo con miras al progreso de todos. El dinero que Alejandra está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono y para el pago del personal que contratará para la próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and children in their own house in the land of their birth. She spends every day doing farm work, in particular, caring for her animals, which she sells at her community’s livestock market. Alejandra mainly raises sheep and heifers, but also grows potatoes and other products that are native to the region. Even though her work tends to be difficult, she wants to continue working in the future so she can increase the number of animals she has and thus obtain greater profits when she sells the animals. This is Alejandra’s fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she wishes to stay in her communal bank and continue working with her group so she can see everyone make progress. The money that Alejandra is asking for will be used to purchase bags of fertilizer and to pay the workers she is going to hire to plant the next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer, and paying her workers

loans.name: Leli

texts.es:
La señora Leli es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene 5 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 135 Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chalona (carne).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar mas chalona.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, este dinero le servirá para poder adquirir mas chalona, carne y quesos, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo es seguir trabajando para poder, en el futuro, vender al por mayor sus producto.
Le gustaría poner un emporio, en el cual vendería carnes y productos afines.
texts.en:
Leli is a member of the “Aswancaris II” community bank in the Azangaro province of the department of Puno. She is 56-years old, divorced, and has five children under her care. She lives on Jr. José Carlos Mariategui street, Nº 135, in the Revolución neighborhood. She has worked with the program of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. She buys and sells meat for a living. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy more meat products. Currently she wishes to take out a loan for 1,000 PEN. This money will allow her to acquire more meat and cheese, and thus continue expanding her business. She hopes to keep working and, in the future, to sell her products wholesale. She would like to set up a store, in which she would sell meat and other related products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat and cheese

loans.name: Las Alegrías Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Alegrías” esta representado por la señora MatilD. y conformado por 13 miembros en su mayoría mujeres las cuales se dedican a actividades D. rubro comercial D. productos como ropa, muebles, cosméticos, comida y algunas se dedican al servicio D. transporte publico, limpieza y D. jardinería. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia por lo que el grupo debe esforzarse para que sus productos sean D. buena calida, es por esta razón que requieren el crédito para la adquisición D. mercadería, materiales e insumos así como herramientas para realizar un trabajo D. calidad y un producto mas competitivo para el M. teniendo mejores ingresos para darle a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a informes crediticios D. las socias  se pueD. verificar que se encuentran con buenos antecedentes ya que se consideran cumplidas y responsables en los pagos D. sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Las Alegrías" group is represented by MatilD. and consists of 13 members, mostly women who work selling products such as clothes, furniture, cosmetics, and food. Some proviD. services such as public transportation, cleaning, and gardening. In the commercial sector there is always competition, so the group needs to work hard to make sure their products are of high quality. This is why they need the loan, to acquire more merchandise, materials and supplies such as tools for high-quality work and a more competitive product. Having better income will make it possible to proviD. their children with better education and a higher quality of life. In regards to the members' credit reports, it can be verified that they have good credit history and are considered punctual and responsible in making loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Todos los días se esfuerza en sus tierras de cultivo verificando si sus plantaciones están creciendo bien, asimismo camina durante horas buscando pastos frescos para sus animales, así ocupa todo su tiempo. Lo que le reconforta es que no lo hace sola, sino que tiene el apoyo y compañía de su esposo y sus hijos. Luego de un mes de crianza, sus animales están listos para la venta, seleccionando a los de mejor peso y tamaño, ya que estos les darán mayores ganancias, con las cuales sostienen los gastos de su familia, mientras se espera el tiempo de la cosecha. Para más adelante, Gladis se proyecta a seguir trabajando para tener mayor cantidad de animales y sembrar mejores calidades de papa. En MFP, se siente muy contenta de formar parte de su grupo, y pesar de las adversidades, ha sido una de las integrantes que ha promovido la superación. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizantes para sembrar en abundancia y que su cosecha será más productiva.
texts.en:
Gladis lives with her husband and children in their own house. Every day she works hard in her fields, checking that her crops are growing well and walking for hours looking for fresh grass for her animals; this takes up all her time. What is comforting to her is that she does not work alone but has the support and companionship of her husband and children. Her animals are ready to be sold after being raised for a month. She selects those with the most weight and size, since these give her greater profits with which to cover the family´s expenses while they wait for the harvest season. In the future, Gladis plans to keep working to have more animals and plant more potatoes. En MFP she is happy to be part of her group and, in spite of adversities, has been one of the members who promotes self-improvement. The money she requests will be invested in purchasing sacks of fertilizers so that she can plant a large quantity and the harvest will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Agustín vive en el barrio villa Paraíso, con su esposa la Sra. Saida Rivera con la cual tienen dos hijos, su actividad principal es el Servicio de mototaxis, en la localidad del Torno, viven en casa alquilada.
El préstamo con el que fue beneficiado fue para la compra de una  motocicleta la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de trabajo.
Esta persona trabaja solamente con nuestra institución, de la cual ellos comentan que se les dio la oportunidad para trabajar con préstamos y de esta manera comprar su motocicleta y línea (25 de Julio “LOS AMIGOS”, y están muy agradecidos con la institución.
texts.en:
Agustín lives in the Villa Paraíso neighborhood with his wife, Saida Rivera, with whom he has two children. Their primary business is a moto-taxi service in the town of Torno. They live in a rented house. The loan will benefit Agustín by allowing him to buy a motorcycle that he can turn into his principal source of work. He works only with our organization, to whom he and his wife say they are very grateful for giving them the opportunity to receive the loans to buy their motorcycle and transporation line (the 25 de Julio "Los Amigos" line).

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Antonia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 5 hijos.  
Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida  Jr. Zepita S/n,  ella tiene estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de productos de la región (papas, chuño, ocas), así como también frutas.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles; este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de productos de la zona (como papa, chuño, ocas, habas) para luego venderlos en el  Mercado 15 de Agosto. Quiere seguir trabajando para construir su casa ya que nos indica que ya adquirió el terreno.
 
La señora Antonia Cristina  nos cuenta que está contenta ya que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y sobre todo los ahorros.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the "Yunga Uyo" communal bank in the district of Yunguyo, Chicuito province, in the department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She lives in the Alto Florida neighborhood, on Jr. Zepeta S/n and she has completed her primary school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 5 years. She buys and sells regional products (potatoes, chuño-a freeze-dried potato product, and oca) as well as fruits. Her first loan was for S/ 300.00 new soles. She would now like an additonal loan for S/. 800.00 new soles. This loan will help her to buy a variety of local products (like potato, chuño, oca and fava beans) to be later sold at the 15 de Agosto market. She would like to keep working so she can build a house and says that she has already bought the land. Antonia Cristina says she is pleased because she likes the meetings of her communal bank and most of all the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, dried potatoes, ocas and fava beans.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 44 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Cada día se levanta para seguir con el cuidado de sus animales y de sus tierras de cultivo, sus hijos la acompañan en algunas ocasiones, cuando tienen tiempos libres luego de sus estudios, pero el que sí trabaja a su lado en estos tiempos, es su esposo, quien la apoya mientras está de vacaciones, ya que labora lejos de casa. El trabajo físico en los campos es dura, más aun por el  clima lluvioso, pese a estas circunstancias su labor no se posterga y sus anhelos de seguir progresando tampoco. Para el futuro, Saturnina está planeando sembrar más extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción. Este es su onceavo préstamo con MFP, donde desea seguir trabajando porque ha encontrado un espacio de amistad entre los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicitara tiene como es para la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y costales para empacar su futura cosecha.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 44 years old and lives with her children and husband in their own house. Every day she rises early to care for her animals and her fields. Her children sometimes accompany her when they have time off from school, but the person who really works by her side is her husband, who helps her when he is on vacation since he works far from home. The physical work in the fields is hard and even more so during rainy weather. In spite of this the work continues, as does her desire to continue improving. In the future Saturnina plans to plant more areas of land to increase her production. This is her eighth loan with MFP, where she hopes to continue working because she has found friendship among the members of her communal bank. The money she requests is to buy fertilizers and sacks for packing up her future harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and sacks.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina tiene 63 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. niña las actividades agrícolas fueron el sostén D. su hogar, y en la actualidad esa experiencia le sirve para continuar con la misma labor. Su cultivo principal es la papa, para ello se levanta muy temprano para verificar que sus cultivos estén bien, sus hijos la apoyan siempre y se siente respaldada por ellos. A pesar D. su edad, Serafina sigue teniendo todas las energías para trabajar, porque el campo la hace sentir viva y activa. Para el futuro desea mejorar su producción para dejares a sus hijos una fuente D. ingresos para su autosostenimiento. Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, Serafina es una D. las que impulsan la unidad D. su grupo, y ahora se compromete a seguir trabajando para que su banco comunal siga unido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos D. abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Serafina is 63 years old and lives with her children in herr own house. Since she was a child, agriculture activities supported her home and it continues that way. Her main crop is potatoes. She arises early to check on her crops; her children always help and she feels supported by them. In spite of her age, Serafina still has a lot of energy because in the fields she feels alive and active. In the future she hopes to improve her production and leave her children with a source of income to support themselves. This is her 12th loan with MFP. Serafina is one of the members who drives her group and now she is committed to keep working so that her communal bank continues to be united. With the loan she requests, she will buy fertilizers for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Dominga Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Dominga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil viuda, tiene 5 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.  La señora Dominga se dedica a la compra-venta de golosinas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar cajas de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, jugos, etc. y así poder surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es poner una tienda grande bien surtida o en todo caso poner una librería.
 
A ella le gusta el ahorro y los encuentros organizados por La institución Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the "Micaela Bastidas" communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a widow and has 5 children. She completed her secondary school education and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 2 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300,00 new soles. Dominga buys and sells sweets. She currently needs a loan for S/. 1000.00 new soles to buy boxes of cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks, juices, etc. so she can restock her business. Her dream is to have large, well-stocked store or at any rate to start a bookshop. She likes saving and she likes the meetings organized by the Manuela Ramos organization.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: C'est un jeune coiffeur de tous sexes. Pour les besoins de son activité, il a loué un magasin qui lui sert d'office de travail. Sa clientéle est principalement constituée de jeunes gens(garçons et filles). En plus de la coiffure et du traitement des cheveux, il expose dans son magasin des produits de beauté pour homme et femme. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permet de payer le loyer de son magasin, d'assurer ses besoins personnels, mais aussi de participer à la vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a young hair stylist serving both males and females. To meet business needs, he leased a store as a business office. His customers are mainly composed of young people (boys and girls). In addition to hair styling and hair treatments, he displays beauty products for men and women in his store. The revenues derived from his business enables him to pay the rent on his store, to cover his personal needs, and also to help support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and products for hairdressing

loans.name: Kantuta Group

texts.es:
Teresa C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal es una Sra. Muy activa, tiene 56 años D. edad, vive en la localidad D. la Guardia barrio San Jorge, en anticrético, se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños, hace mas D. 6 años que viene trabajando con este negocio.
Su esposo el Sr. Ángel Soto se dedica a la albañilería, actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la casa D. una D. sus vecinas.
Miguel I..- es el tesorero  del banco comunal, es viudo tiene 54 años D. edad vive en el Barrio el Carmen, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con sus dos hijos.
Tiene como actividad el Servicio D. transporte D. pasajeros en el centro D. la cuidad, el préstamo que fue solicitado fue para la reparación D. su vehiculo, debido a que estaba empezando a fallar. 
Sandy Ávila.- es la secretaria del banco comunal, es madre soltera D. 32 años D. edad, tiene un pequeño hijo, esta viviendo actualmente en la casa D. sus padres, se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva D. revistas el cual trabajo hace mas D. una año. Se esfuerza en seguir aumentando su capital ya que D. esta manera pueD. mantener a su pequeño hijo, porque el padre D. sus hijo lo abandono cuando estaba embarazada. Pese a contar con este caso no le fue mucho problema para ella, porque es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Teresa C. is the president of the communal bank and is a very active women; she is 56 years old, and lives in La Guardia in the San Jorge neighborhood on anticrético (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). Teresa has dedicated herself to the sale of children’s clothing for over 6 years. Her husband Ángel Soto is a mason, and is currently working at a neighbor’s house. Miguel I. is the treasurer of the communal bank, a widow, 54 years old, and lives in the El Carmen neighborhood; he own his house and lives with his two children. He works in transportation services in the city’s center and is requesting this loan to repair his vehicle, which is beginning to break down. Sandy Ávila is the secretary of the communal bank, a single mother, 32 years old, and has one small child; she is currently living in her parents’ home. For over a year she has dedicated herself to the sale of new clothing from catalogs. She works hard to continue increasing her capital so that she can support her small child because the father abandoned him when she was pregnant. In spite of this she does not see this situation as a problem because she is a hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital.

loans.name: Sivi

texts.es: Sivi tiene 42 años, es soltera, tiene tres hijos; Carlos de 21, Joel de 16 y Ruth de 11, de los cuales sólo vive con los dos últimos, ya que el primero ya se mantiene solo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ropa, aprendió desde muy pequeña este arte de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a este oficio para mantener a su familia. Es así que hoy en día, ella también optó por dedicarse a lo mismo, junto a su hermana y a un par de señoras que la ayudan en su pequeño taller.  Su trabajo comienza cuando le hacen pedidos, entonces Sivi elabora la cantidad solicitada, que usualmente suele ser por cientos, para luego viajar a la ciudad de Tumbes, que es donde ella ofrece su mercadería, y con otra parte su hermana viaja a la frontera con Ecuador para vender en mayor cantidad, ya que ahí hay muy buena demanda de sus prendas. Para el futuro, Sivi espera tener una gran fábrica, donde tenga a muchas personas trabajando y así abastecer grandes pedidos de ropa. Este es el primer préstamo individual de Sivi con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, como lo fue anteriormente con su banco comunal. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar material (telas, cierres, hilos, etc.) y así mejorar la producción de su taller encaminándose a la ampliación.
texts.en:
Sivi is 42 and single. She has three children; Carlos is 21, Joel is16, and Ruth is 11. She only lives with the last two since the first child is independent. For ten years she has been making and selling clothes. She learned to do this from her parents when she was very little. They worked in this business to take care of their family. She has chosen to do the same work together with her sister and a pair of ladies who help her in her small shop. Her work starts when orders are placed. Sivi then makes the ordered number of items, which is usually in the hundreds. She then travels to the city of Tumbes, which is where she sells her merchandise. Her sister travels to the border with Ecuador to sell in larger quantities since there is a big demand there for her clothes. In the future, Sivi hopes to have a big factory with a lot of people working and filling large clothing orders. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual with all of her payments, just like she was in the past with her community bank. She will use the loan to buy material (fabric, zippers, thread, etc.). That way she will improve her shop’s production on her way to expansion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her clothes making shop

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "21 D. enero" están representados por el señor Denar Ronny,  dentro del grupo existen algunos parentescos como la señora Eliana y Eliodora que son hermanas y la señora Giovanna e Isabel que son yerna y suegra respectivamente todas tienen ingresos independiente por lo que no representa un problema para el grupo. Las socias integrantes desempeñan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cosméticos, pan, abarrotes en tiendas D. abarrotes, venta D. comida y a actividades como el servicio D. transporte publico D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma por lo que deben esforzarse mas para poder generar un ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias es por esta razón que requieren del crédito que esta destinado para la compra D. mercadería, materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayudaran al desarrollo D. sus negocios y a generar un mayor ingreso que brinD. a sus hogares una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus pagos y un buen manejo D. los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
Denar Ronny represents the members of the “21 D. enero” group. Some members of the group are related to each other. Eliana and Eliodora are sisters. Giovanna and Isabel are daughter in law and mother in law. They all have independent incomes, so this does not pose a problem for the group. The members are engaged in different activities like selling cosmetics, bread, groceries in grocery stores, meals, and services like public transportation. In regards to the competition, it can be said that they are away of it and should make more efforts to be able to generate enough income to sustain their families. That is why they need a loan to buy merchandise, materials, supplies and tools to help them with the development of their businesses. This will generate more income that will bring their households a better quality of life. The majority of the members are in their second loan cycle with the institution. This demonstrates their responsibility, completion of payments, and good management of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maura Glorinda

texts.es:
La señora Maura es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswankaris II”, de la provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo.  Solo tiene estudios hasta quinto de primaria. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de artículos de ferretería, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró mas productos para su ferretería. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 2,300.00 nuevos soles.  Este préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas mercadería (candados, chuchillos, focos baterías, etc.), y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su mayor deseo es darle una profesión a sus hijos.

Asi mismo refiere que le  gusta la forma en que Manuela Ramos trabaja.  Además le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal en las cuales ella puede distraerse y compartir con sus amigas
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Aswankaris II community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 45, and a single mother with three children to care for. She has a fifth grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. She buys and sells hardware store items. With her first loan of 500 PEN, she bough more products for her hardware store. She currently wants a loan for 2,300 PEN. With this loan she will buy more merchandise (padlocks, knives, light bulbs, batteries, etc.). This way her business will keep growing. Her biggest wish is to give her children a profession. She likes the way Manuela Ramos works. She also likes her community bank meetings where she is able to share with her friends and have a good time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy padlocks, knives, light bulbs, batteries

loans.name: Fortalecimiento Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo  "Fortalecimiento" están representadas por la señora Meliza, dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar D. las hermanas Maria Selva y Maria Eugenia ambas con ingresos independientes una D. la otra. Las socias D. este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades entre ellas a la venta D. productos como cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes, elaboración D. masitas y la venta D. las mismas, comida y los socios se dedican al servicio D. transporte público. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda a pesar D. ello las socias salen adelante siempre ya que su negocio es el sustento D. su familia, es por esta razón que requieren del crédito para poder incrementar su mercadería y la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. las socias participaron en el primer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. seguir adelante en sus negocios cumpliendo con honestidad y puntualidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the “Fortalecimiento” (“Strengthening”) group are represented by Meliza. Two of the members, Maria Selva and Maria Eugenia, are sisters, but both of them have their own incomes. The members of this group make a living doing different activities, including selling products such as cosmetics from a catalog, selling groceries, and making and selling pastries and other foods. Other members make a living in the public transport sector. As in all commercial situations, there is competition for supply and demand, but in spite of that the members always manage to do well, since their businesses are supporting their families. It is for this reason that they need a loan in order to increase their merchandise and purchase foodstuffs, materials, and tools. These items will help them generate more income so they can proviD. their families with a better quality of life. A majority of the members participated in the first loan cycle. They demonstrated responsibility and eagerness to go forward with their businesses, and fulfilled their loan obligations honestly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Dora Irma

texts.es:
La señora Dora es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” del Distrito de Puno, la  provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos.  Vive en el Barrio Progreso. Ella tiene estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio.  La señora dora se dedica a la venta de condimentos.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas condimentos (aji, vinagre, sal, pimienta, comino), para aumentar y surtir su negocio, luego los venderá en su puesto comercial.  Nos comenta que le gustaría ampliar su negocio y poner una tienda grande y bien surtida.

A la señora Dora le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y las capacitaciones que brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Palomas de Oro community bank in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 56, married, and has six children. She lives in the Progreso neighborhood. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. Dora sells condiments. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. With this loan for 1,500 PEN, she will buy more condiments (chili, vinegar, salt, pepper, cumin) to increase what she has and stock her business. Then she will sell them from her commercial location. She would like to expand her business and set up a large, well stocked store. Dora likes the community bank meetings and the trainings that Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chili, vinegar, salt, pepper, cumin

loans.name: Los Diamantes Group

texts.en:
Los Diamantes (The Diamonds) Village Bank is made up of thirteen members, almost all of them women. The group members are from the town of Quillabamba, about five hours from the city of Cusco in the province of La Convencion. Quillabamba is referred to as the “eyebrow of the jungle.” The climate is hot and humid, and the area produces many of the bananas, oranges and papayas that are consumed in Cusco. 

The group members are involved in a variety of different activities. For example, Hilda is 32 years old and is the single mother of one child. She and her mother sell prepared lunches at the local market in Quillabamba. For example, today’s meal was noodle soup and fish or pork chops with beans. Hilda starts preparing each day’s meal at 8:30 am. The food is ready by 10 am; then she leaves for the market so that she is ready for each day’s early customers. Hilda also sells perfume by catalog as an extra source of income. She is requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy the perfume that her customers request. She collects payments on a monthly basis. Hilda’s goal for the future is to open her own store and buy a hamburger cart to sell snacks at night. 

Hilda’s aunt, Celia, is also a group member. Celia is 45 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. She also has a lunch stand in Quillabamba’s Mercado Satélite, and has been serving meals for the past eight years. Celia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles so that she can put in a cement floor in her home. Her current floor is dirt. 

Another group member, Maritza, is 31 years old and lives with her partner. She recently started her own business bringing alcohol from Quillabamba to Cusco to sell to stores in the city. She travels every two weeks or so and brings between 110 and 140 kilos of alcohol on each trip. She earns about 50 centimos (17 cents US ) for each kilo she sells, so she earns a total of 50 to 70 soles ($17 to $23) per trip. Maritza is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more alcohol. Each kilo costs 2.35 soles, so her loan will buy her about 425 kilos, enough for 3-4 trips to Cusco.

Los Diamantes have pledged to repay their loan in full and on time. They are the first group from Quillabamba to be listed on Kiva! Their loan officer, Ramiro, is pictured in the red shirt on the far right.

loans.use: To buy perfume and alcohol, and to install a cement floor

loans.name: Las Intachables Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Las Intachables" esta representado por L. señora Victoria y presenta un parentesco familiar entre  L. señora Roxana Julieta y su hermana L. señora Amalia ambas se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos por lo que tienen ingresos independientes una de L. otra. L. F. de ingresos de una de L. mayoría de las socias es L. venta de productos como ropa interior, comida y refrescos en lugares turísticos como en el rió Pirai, otras son promotoras de cosméticos y de ropa de cama.
