Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe L. competencia de L. oferta y L. demanda pero las socias cuentan con buenos productos y ya son conocidas en sus puestos de venta. Este crédito esta destinado al mejoramiento de sus puestos de trabajo, a L. compra de materiales e insumos para diversificar sus productos y mejorar sus ventas para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Alguna de las socias cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios  pero para una mayoría es una nueva modalidad de adquirir un financiamiento pero conocen como cada una trabaja por lo que no será difícil cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Intachables (The Impeccables) Communal Bank are represented by Señora Victoria. There is a family connection between Señora Roxana Julieta and her daughter, Señora Amalia. They are both engaged in selling different products but each of their incomes is independent from the other. The source of income for most of the members is the sale of products such as underwear, meals and refreshments in tourist areas such as Río Piraí. Others are distributors of cosmetics and sleepwear. Because in every commercial situation there is supply and demand, the members are providing good products and they are well known at their stands in the market. This loan is intended for the improvement of work places, and the purchase of materials and ingredients so as to diversify their products and increase their sales and thus provide their families with a better quality of life. Some of the members have experience in solidarity groups but for most it is a new method of obtaining a loan. But they know that with everyone working together it will not be difficult to fulfill their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Eudosia Rosenda

texts.es:
La señora Eudosia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado en el  distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.
Tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 5 hijos.  No tiene estudios. 
Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. líquidos para frenos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará más líquidos para frenos, aceite para carro y piezas D. repuestos.  En este negocio la apoya su esposo, quien es mecánico.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca para tener más ganancias y poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
 
A ella le gusta los ahorros y la facilidad que birnda Manuela Ramos para otorgar un préstamo.
texts.en:
Eudosia belongs to the “Micaela Bastidas” Communal Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Department of Puno. She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles, and she used it to purchase brake fluid. Eudosia will use the current loan of 500.00 soles to purchase more brake fluid, motor oil, and spare parts. Her husband is a mechanic, and helps her with her business. Her dream is that her business will grow so that she will have more profits and be able to help with the household expenses. Eudosia likes the savings that Manuela Ramos offers as well as the ease of receiving loans.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brake fluid, spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal “Nuevo Renacer” están representados por la señora Zulema y conformado por 15 miembros que pertenecen a la zona del barrio las pampitas,  la mayoría de las socias tienen sus pequeños negocios en su zona. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar entra la señora Dionicia y Dora que son hermanas, ambas cuenta con ingresos independientes por lo que no se considera un obstáculo para el grupo.  Las socias desarrollan diferentes actividades comerciales y de servicio como  promotoras de cosméticos, venta de abarrotes, de masitas y venta de comida y algunas se dedican a actividades como el servicio de de peluquería, costura y transporte en lo que respecta  al socio participante. El crédito esta destinado para el incremento de mercadería y comprar repuestos para la movilidad de los socio.  Las socias comentan con experiencia en otras entidades financieras similares, en  lo que respecta a la fundación Agrocapital algunas ya participaron en el primer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nuevo Renacer” communal bank are represented by Zulema and the group consists of 15 members who are from the Las Pampitas neighborhood. The majority of the members have their small businesses in this neighborhood. Within the group, some are family members—Dionicia and Dora are sisters. Each has their own independent income, so this is not considered an obstacle for the group. The members work in various commercial and service activities, such as cosmetics sales, grocery sales, snacks and meals, and some work in businesses such as a hair salon, sewing, and transportation. The loan is for buying more merchandise and to buy automobile parts. Some of the members have had experience with other similar lenders, and with respect to Fundación Agrocapital, some have already participated in one loan cycle and have demonstrated responsibility and follow-through in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruth Angelica

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” en  Distrito de Puno, la  provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en el Barrio Progreso, ella tiene estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos de la zona (papa, papalisa, ocas, quinua).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas productos propios de la zona como choclo, papa, que son productos de la época.  Le gustaría poner un negocio de servicio de fotocopias o una cabina telefónica (servicio público).

Le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que puede compartir con sus compañeras, y está agradecida de las charlas que les da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the “Palomas de Oro” (“Golden Doves”) Community Bank in Puno district, Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the Progreso neighborhood, and has an elementary school education. Ruth has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years. She has a business selling products from the area, such as potatoes, papalisas and ocas (local Andean tubers), and quinoa. Her first loan was for 300.00 soles. She will use the current loan of 700.00 soles to purchase more products from the area such as corn and potatoes, which are currently in season. She would eventually like to have a photocopying service or a public telephone booth. Ruth likes her communal bank’s meetings, since she can share with the other members, and she is grateful for the lectures that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing potatoes, ocas and papalisas (Andean tubers), corn, and vegetables

loans.name: Los Luceros Group

texts.es:
Maria Lenny J..-  es la presidenta del banco comunal, fue elegida debido su actitud D. positivismo y por ser muy trabajadora.
Vive en el Balcón II KM.9  D. la cuidad D. Santa Cruz. En casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Gonzalo García y sus dos hijos, su actividad principal es la venta D. abarrotes el cual lo realiza en su domicilio. Como segunda actividad tiene punto D. llamadas. Su esposo el Sr. Gonzalo es chofer el mismo que trabaja hace 5 años con esta actividad. 
Rosa M..- tiene el cargo D. tesorera en el banco comunal, ella es casada tiene un hijo, viven en anticrético. Se dedica a la venta D. ropa en la feria los fines D. semanas. Su esposo el Sr. Edgar Palacios, se dedica a la cerrajería ya hace mas D. tres años que viene trabajando con esta actividad, están acumulando su propio capital para la compra D. un puesto dentro D. la feria D. Barrio Lindo. 
Clara R..- es una mas D. las integrantes D. este banco comunal, doña Clara vive en casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Francisco J.  y sus dos hijos, su actividad principal en la venta D. comida, como segunda actividad tiene la venta D. pan casero. Estos son realizados en su mismo domicilio.
Su esposo el Sr. Francisco es albañil el cual trabaja en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz. El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para aumentar sus mesas y sillas ya que estaba empezando a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Lenny J. – She is the president of this community bank. She was elected due to her positive attituD. and because she is very hardworking. She lives in Balcón II KM.9, in the city of Santa Cruz, with her husband, Mr. Gonzalo García, and their two children. Her primary activity is selling groceries out of her home. As a siD. business, she also operates a telephone center (where people can go to make phone calls). Her husband, Mr. Gonzalo, has worked as a driver for 5 years. Rosa M. – She is the treasurer of this community bank. She is married with one child. They live in a house with an “anticrético” contract, in which they paid the landlord a fixed sum when they moved in, in lieu of monthly rent. She sells clothing in a weekend market. Her husband, Mr. Edgar Palcios, is a locksmith with over three years of experience. They are saving up to buy a stand in the Barrio Lindo market. Clara R. – Another member of this community bank, Ms. Clara lives with her husband. Mr. Francisco J. and their two children. She sells food as her primary line of business, and receives a secondary stream of income from selling homemaD. bread. She runs both these enterprises out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries (oil, rice, noodles, flour)

loans.name: Guadalupitas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Guadalupitas", están representadas por la señora Janeth y conformada por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco entre la presidenta y la señora Luisa que son primas pero ambas tienen ingresos propios. Las socias desarrollan diferentes actividades por el barrio la colorada entre ellas la venta D.  fruta, comida, ropa, cosméticos y los socios participantes se dedican al servicio mecánico y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma y el crédito favorece para mejorar su negocio con la compra D. mercaderías así como los materiales y las herramientas necesarias para ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos pudiendo así dar a su familia una mejor calida D. vida. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que una mayoría D. las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the Guadalupitas (Women of Guadalupe) Communal Bank are represented by Señora Janeth and consists of 13 members among whom there exists a strong relationship. The President and Señora Luisa are cousins but both have their own incomes. The members developed different activities for the La Colorada neighborhood, such as the sale of fruit, meals, clothing, cosmetics, and the participating members are engaged in the mechanics traD. and public passenger transit. With respect to their capabilities, it may be said that they are all conscientious and the loan is granted to improve their businesses with the purchase of merchandise, such as the materials and tools necessary in order to increase their income and thus give their families a better quality of life. The members have experience with solidarity groups since most of the members are working on their second cycle while demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Saturnina's Group

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada 04 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Alto la Florida,  ella posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, La señora Saturnina tiene se dedica a compra y venta de frutas, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles; este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de frutas, (plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas) y venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su sueño es poner una gran tienda completando con abarrotes, ya que nos indica que la venta esta algo baja.
 
Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha el cumplimiento de sus compañeras y la forma de trabajo, de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a member of the Yunga Uyo community bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has four children. She lives in the Alto la Florida neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. Saturnina buys and sells fruit. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wants an additional loan for 1,000 PEN. She will buy a variety of fruit (bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, grapes) and sell them at the 15 de Agosto market. Her dream is to have a big store filled with groceries. Sales are down a bit. She really likes the fulfillment of working with her colleagues and the way Manuela Ramos works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bananas, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, grapes

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo  "8 D. diciembre" están representados por la señora Geovana Angelica y conformada por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Neyza y su hija Leticia, en todos los casos se cuenta con ingresos independientes. Este grupo tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. ropa, comida, promotoras D. cosméticos,  tiendas en su barrio y a la elaboración D. pan. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda por lo que los integrantes del grupo están concientes que deben esforzarse para que sus productos sean D. buena calidad y a un bajo precio para competir en el mercado. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden al desarrollo D. sus pequeños puestos D. venta. A pesar D. que las socias se encuentran es su primer ciclo como grupo solidario en la institución ya contaban con experiencia D. otras entidades similares por lo que cuentan con la habilidad para la buena administración D. los fondos y con la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir a tiempo con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the 8th of December Group are represented by Señora Geovana Angelica and consists of twelve members among whom there exists a strong relationship between Señora Neyza and her daughter Leticia, and all of them have independent incomes. This group engages in various activities such as the sale of clothing, or meals, cosmetics saleswomen, neighborhood stores and baking bread. As in all commercial areas, you have supply and demand, and the group members are aware that they must struggle with this, so that their products will be of good quality and at a low price in order to compete in the marketplace. The loan is intended for product diversification and materials acquisition, ingredients and tools that help to develop the small market stands. Although these members are in their first cycle as a solidarity group, they have experience in other similar organizations and have the capacity for good administration of the funds and have the resonsibility required to fulfill their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "San Expedito" presentan un nexo consanguíneo  entre la señora  Anita del Rosario quien es su representante y la señora María Eugenia ambas son hermanas con ingresos totalmente independientes una de la otra. Las socias de este banco tienen diferentes actividades pero una de las principales es la venta de productos como cosméticos, comida, ropa, repuestos, artesanías y al servicio de jardinería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda pero las socias saben como sacar adelante sus negocios gracias a los años de experiencia y a su habilidad para las ventas. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos, para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y a la adquisición de materiales de trabajo para ayudar a realizar un mejor producto mejorando sus ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. las socias se encuentran cursando su primer ciclo con la institución pero algunas de ellas ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que participaron en créditos financiados por otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen de la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento de sus  obligaciones para ganarse la confianza de la institución y de su grupo.
texts.en:
Some members of the San Expedito community bank are related. Anita del Rosario, the group’s representative, and María Eugenia are sisters. Their incomes are totally independent from each other. The members of this group have different activities, but one of the primary activities is selling products like cosmetics, meals, clothes, replacement parts, handicrafts and gardening services. As in every commercial area, there is a relationship between supply and demand. But, the members know how to get ahead in business thanks to years of experience and their ability for sales. This loan is for diversification of products, to invest in buying merchandise wholesale, and acquiring work materials to help make a better product. This will improve their incomes in order to give their families a better quality of life. The members are in their first loan cycle with the institution. However, some of them do have experience in supportive groups and have had loans from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They know about responsibility and fulfilling obligations in order to gain the trust of both the institution and their group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Lideres " esta representado por la señora Piedades que tienen un parentesco familiar con su Herman la señora Mirtha, ambas tienen ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. Los miembros del grupo tienen diferentes fuentes D. ingreso entre ellos esta la venta D. ropa, zapatos, pan, vidrio y cosméticos por catalogo. Dentro del mercado la competencia crece día a día por lo que las  socias deben mejorar sus productos y sus ventas, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder adquirir mercadería a bajo precio y materiales e insumos que mejoren sus ventas y por enD. sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad D. vida y las D. sus familias. La socias cuenta con la experiencia adquirida en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero es la primera vez que trabajan con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The group “Las Lideres” is represented by Señora Piedades whose sister Señora Mirtha is also part of the group. Their income is totally independent of each other. The members of the group earn their living in different ways such as selling clothes, shoes, bread, glass, and cosmetics from a catalogue. Competition in the market place increases daily so the members have to improve their products and their sales. For this reason they require financial assistance in order to be able to buy merchandise, materials, and ingredients at low prices. Increased sales and income will allow them to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The members have experience with organisations similar to Kiva partner, Agrocapital, but this will be their first loan with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Felicitas Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Julia H. Paredes Nº 454, Barrio Vilca Apaza, ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró diversos productos para su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1800.00 nuevos soles, comprará diferentes productos como fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc., además comprara  golosinas, y alimento para engorde de su ganado.  Quiere tener más ganancia para poder poner una tienda mas grande.

Asi mismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha el método de trabjo de Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros y también le gusta las charlas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank, which is located in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 31, married, and has three children to care for. She lives at Jr. Julia H. Paredes Nº 454, Vilca Apaza neighborhood. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. She buys and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy various products for her grocery store. With this loan for 1,800 PEN, she will buy different products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk etc. She will also buy sweets and food to fatten her livestock. She wants to have more income to be able to set up a larger store. She really likes the way Manuela Ramos works; above all she likes the savings. She also likes the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, noodles, milk, flour

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Isabel  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswankaris II” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno.  Tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 11 hijos, D. los cuales solo los menores están a su cargo.  Vive en el Jr. 28 D. julio  Nº 235.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos casi 03 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. comida, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará más víveres para la preparación D. comida, la misma que venderá en su restaurante, y D. esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; Desea poder poner una polleria y D. esta manera ampliar su negocio.

A ella le gusta mucho la forma D. trabajo D. Manuela Ramos y las charlas sobre mercadeo.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel is a member of the community bank “Aswankaris II” in the province of Azangaro, departament of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has eleven children, but only the youngest are still in her care. She lives at #235, July 28th Street. Sra. Isabel has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for almost three years. She earns her living by buying and selling food. Her first loan was for S/. 300. With this new loan of S/.1500 she will buy more supplies to make food to sell in her restaurant, and in this way continue to expand her business. She would also like to open a restaurant specializing in barbecued chicken. She likes the way her partnership with Manuela Ramos is working, especially the talks on marketing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, seasonings, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en el Jr. José Domingo Choquehuanca Barrio Vilca Apaza.  Solo tiene estudios de 1er grado (primaria). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró diversos productos para su bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará diferentes productos como son fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.,  y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo es seguir trabajando llevando sus productos a las ferias existentes en la zona.

Le gustaría  tener una tienda para distribución al por mayor, pero necesitaría mas capital.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho la puntualidad y el cumplimiento que hay de parte  de sus compañeras de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” Communal Bank in the province of Azangaro, Puno department. She is 60 years old, is married and supports 2 children. She lives in the José Domingo Choquehuanca Street in the Vilca Apaza neighborhood. She only studied up to first grade (primary). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year and a half. The activity that she dedicates herself to is the purchase and sale of groceries. Her first loan was for S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, with which she bought diverse products for her store. With this loan of S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, she will buy different products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc., and through this continue growing her business. Her desire is to continue working by taking her products to the area's existing markets. She would like to have a store for wholesale distribution, but she would need more capital. She also says that she likes the punctuality and performance that there is from her fellow members of the Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, oil, soft drinks, canned goods, milk.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es casada con 01 hijo a su cargo, vive en el Jr. José Domingo Choquehuanca,  Barrio Vilca Apaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de celulares, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles,  comprará accesorios para teléfonos, tarjetas pre-pago y recargas, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; trabaja en las ferias de la zona en forma ambulatoria, su deseo es poner un locutorio en un local propio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y encuentros deportivos.  Manifiesta que Manuela Ramos las incentivan al ahorro.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Aswancarias II Community Bank, in the Azangaro province, Puno district. She is 25 years old and is married with one child in her care. She lives in Jr. José Domingo Choquehuanca, in the neighborhood of Vilca Apaza. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. The activity to which she's dedicated is the purchase and sale of cellular phones. Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy telephone accessories, pre-paid cards and rechargers, and, in this manner, continue to grow her business. She works in the markets in the area on foot. Her wish is to establish a shop in her own storefront. What she likes the most about her community bank are the meetings and sporting events. She says that Manuela Ramos incents them to save.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phones, accessories and cards.

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
La señora Norma  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente con 06 hijos, vive en la Comunidad Punta Sahuancasi, en el Sector Acochupa, ella posee estudios  de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año, la sra. Norma se dedica a la Venta de ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, desea comprar ganado como vacas,  ovejas.  Nos indica que le gustaría trabajar comprando ganado mayor (como vacas, toros de raza) para poder obtener mas ganancias. Le gustaría que su negocio crezca mucho más pero dice que necesitaría más capital. 

Lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones de su banco Comunal, la puntualidad en el pago de las cuotas  y las charlas que da el personal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Community Bank in the Azangaro province, in the Puno department. She is 42 years old and lives with her six children in the Punta Sahuancasi community in the Acochupa sector. She has completed elementary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. Norma is dedicated to selling small livestock. Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 500 soles, she wishes to purchase livestock such as cattle and sheep. She indicated to us that she would like to purchase larger livestock (such as cattle and breeding bulls) in order to be able to obtain more income. She would like her business to grow much more but she says that she would need more capital. What she likes most are her community bank's meetings, making her payments on time and chatting with the personnel of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos,  tiene estudios de segundaria  completa. Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años.  Se dedica la compra venta de abarrotes.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, comprará más productos para surtir su bodega, comprará arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.
Su sueño es poner una tienda más grande y surtida, así podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
 
A ella le gusta el incentivo al ahorro y los encuentros organizados por la institución Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Beatriz belongs to the Micaela Bastidas Community Bank located in the Llave district in Collao province in the Puno department. She is 47 years old and is a single mother to six children. She has completed high school. She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. She is dedicated to selling groceries. Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 600 soles, she will purchase more products to stock her store. She will buy rice, milk, oil, sugar, etc. Her dream is create a store that is bigger and well stocked in order to obtain greater earnings. She likes the incentive to save and the meetings organized by the Manuela Ramos institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, milk, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La señora Mauricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de estado civil casada, tiene 31 años de edad y 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa.  Vive en la Av. Ilo. Nº 284.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió de capital.
Actualmente ella pretende ampliar su negocio y adquirir más mercadería (cereales, enlatados, bebidas, entre otros)  para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar su negocio (mini market).
texts.en:
Mauricia belongs to the Rio Desaguadero Community Bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is married, is 31 years old and has two children. She has completed high school. She lives at 284 Av. llo. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for eight years and began her grocery business with a loan of 300 soles, which served as capital. Currently, she wants to expand her business and acquire more merchandise (cereals, canned goods, drinks, among other items) for which she requires a loan of 2000 soles. WIth this, she will be able to improve her income and expand her mini-market business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cereals, canned goods, drinks, sodas, among other items.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada 03 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Central,  ella posee estudios segundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra  y venta de ropa (polleras), su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas polleras (faltas típicas de la región) en diferente colores y diseños. Nos indica que en este negocio se necesita mucho capital. 

Su sueño es comprar una casa en Lima y un carrito para trasladarse fácilmente.
 
A la señora Lidia le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, los encuentros deportivos y las capacitaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Yunga Uyo Community Bank in the Yunguyo district and province in the Puno department. She is 38 years old, is married with three children and lives in the Central neighborhood. She has completed high school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. The activity to which she is dedicated is the purchase and sale of clothing (polleras). Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy more polleras (skirts that are common in the region) in different colors and designs. She has indicated to us that this business needs a lot of capital. Her dream is purchase a house in Lima and a cart so she may move easily. Lidia likes her community bank's meetings, the sporting events and the skills she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of polleras (skirts).

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Doña Pastora V. tiene la edad de 42 años, mujer trabajadora que desde hace mucho años, vende cócteles, frijoles, frescos el cual inicio con fondos en micro financieras, reside en el barrio La primavera, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 19 años de edad, los dos estudian para mejorar el nivel de vida. Con este préstamo en Afodenic va invertir en la compra de marisco para hacer más y poder tener mejores ganancia ya que este producto se vende mucho por su rica comida. Sus planes es poner su negocio en un punto fijo y propio, y poder ayudar a sus hijos que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pastora V. is 42 years old. She is a hard-working woman who, thanks to a microcredit loan, has been selling mixed drinks, soft drinks, and beans for many years. She lives in the neighborhood La Primavera, and has 2 children (11 and 19). Both are in school. Mrs. V. plans to invest this loan from Afodenic in the purchase of fish, shrimp, etc. in order to offer a wider variety of foods and increase her profits since they are popular foods from which one can prepare many delicious dishes. Her plans are to put her business on sure footing so that she can help her children turn out to be upstanding people.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Vive en la Comunidad de Punta sahuacasi-central, ella posee estudios  superiores incompletos (agropecuaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ganado ovinos.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas ovinos para engordarlos y así venderlos a un mayor precio en la feria de la zona.  Le gustaría mucho tener más capital para poder agrandar su negocio. (“me gustaría ser mayorista”).

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y el ahorro individual.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 28, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She lives in the Punta Sahuacasi-Central community. She studied agriculture in college, but did not finish. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She buys and sells sheep. Her first loan was for 500 PEN. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more sheep to fatten and sell for a better price at the fair in the zone. She would very much like to have more capital to be able to expand her business. (“I would like to be a wholesaler”). She likes her community bank’s meetings and the individual savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Domitila Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” situado en el Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 9 hijos. Vive en el Barrio Bolognesi,  ella tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (2do grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de artículos de abarrotes como betunes, jaboncillo, tijeras, candados, pilas, champús, hilos, etc.   Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, podrá comprar variedades de productos como betunes, jaboncillo, tijeras, candados, pilas, champús e hilos en mayor cantidad.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda para vender al por mayor y generarse mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Yunga Uyo community bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 50, married, and has nine children. She lives in the Bolognesi neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She sells grocery store items like shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, thread, etc. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. With this loan for 1,500 PEN, she will be able to buy a variety of items like shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, and thread in larger quantities. Her greatest wish is to set up a store to sell wholesale and generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, and thread

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: La señora Maura T., reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene 41 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 18 y 23 años de edad,  uno de ellos trabaja y el menor estudia, su negocio es una pulpería que administra desde hace cuatro años,  que inicio con ahorros y préstamo para poner surtida la pulpería. Con este préstamo es el segundo ciclo y quiere invertir en la compra de granos básicos, leche, productos enlatados y otros de consumo diarios que es lo que la población consume día a día, ya que todo esta caro. Sus planes es ampliar la pulpería para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Maura T. live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the the capital of Managua. She is 41, married, and has two children ages 18 and 23. One child works, and the younger one goes to school. She has run her mini market for four years. She started with savings and a loan to be able to stock the mini market. With this loan she is in her second loan cycle. She wants to buy basic grains, milk, canned goods, and other products that the public consumes daily. Everything is now expensive. Her plan is to expand her mini market to increase its profitability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, milk,  and canned goods

loans.name: Mayllori

texts.es:
La señora Mayllori, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo” vive en el Jr. Loreto Nº 218, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada y tiene 47 años; es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella. 

Mayllori, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, y es una de nuestras socias mas antiguas dentro de su banquito, empezó vendiendo truzas para varones, en una parte del Mercado Central de la Ciudad de Juanjui, fueron obtuvieron ganancias y hoy en la actualidad alquilaron un puesto mas grande donde implementaron su negocio de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Es una negociante ya muy conocida, y sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprara en docenas (al por mayor) ropa interior para damas y caballeros en todas las tallas modelos y colores, pantalones, polos y blusas en distintos modelos, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela.

Mayllori, refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar.
texts.en:
Mayllori belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives at Jr. Loreto Nº 218, Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 47, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still dependent upon her. Mayllori started with a loan of 300 PEN, and she is one of the oldest members in her bank. She started selling men’s underwear in the Central Market in the city of Juanjui. This was profitable, and she currently rents a larger stand where she sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes. She is a well known businesswoman. Her main customers are residents of the community and friends. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy dozens (wholesale) of women’s and men’s underwear in all sizes, styles, and colors. She will buy pants, polo shirts, and blouses in different styles. This way she will be able to have a variety of items to offer her customers. Mayllori says that the community bank is an excellent proposal for women who want to work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to increase her stock

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Adilia tiene 34 año de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos de 5, 9,10, 17 de edad, solo el mayor es independiente, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposo se desempeña como enderezador y pintura de autos, ella trabaja de cocinera en un pequeño comedor, desde hace cuatro años, sus anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa. Es por eso que con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que no quiere mojarse en este invierno. Sus planes es poder tener un pequeño negocio su casa para dejar de trabajar en la cocina ya que es cansado.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. is 34 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 5, 9, 10, and 17 years old, respectively. Only the oldest is independent. Mrs. M. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her spouse who does auto body work and paint. For the past 4 years she has worked as a cook in a small cafeteria, and her wish is to be able to finish building her house. That is why she is going to use this loan to buy materials for a new roof for her home, since she doesn't want to get wet in the winter. Her plan is to have a small business in her house so that she can quit her job in the kitchen (which she is quite tired of).

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for a new roof

loans.name: Brígida Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyu” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 6 hijos.
Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida Jr. Zepita S/n.  Solo tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de productos de la región (papas, chuño, ocas)y frutas.
Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 900.00 nuevos soles, comprará variedades de productos de la región como papa, chuño, tunta, ocas y habas, para luego venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y así juntar un buen capital.
 
A la señora Brígida refiere que le gusta mucho las reuniones y la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Brígida is a member of the Yunga Uyu Communal Bank in the District of Yunguyo, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 47 years of age, in a civil marriage and has six children. She lives on Zepita Avenue in the Alto Florida neighborhood. She has only an elementary (third grade) education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last two years. Her work is buying and selling local produce, such as potatoes, chuño and ocas (Andean tuberous root crops), and fruit. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols. With this loan of 900 New Sols, she will buy various local produce such as potatoes, chuño, tunta ("white chuño"), ocas and beans which she will later sell in the 15 de Agosto market. She wishes to improve her business in order to increase her earnings and thus build up her capital. Señora Brígida relates that she likes very much the Manuela Ramos meetings and the way that they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local produce to sell in the market.

loans.name: Vanessa Isadora

texts.es: Doña Vanessa Isadora  es una mujer que desde joven trabaja en la venta de cosmético, para ayudar a los gastos de la familia. Tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo es Tipógrafo, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 16 años estudiantes, ella comenzó con prestamos en Afodenic es su cuarto ciclo y da las gracias por el beneficio que ha podido mantener su negocio. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de la casa que esta en malas condiciones y embaldosar la sala para poder estar cómoda con su familia y gozar de los esfuerzos. Sus planes  es poder incrementar las ventas, captar clientes.
texts.en:
Vanessa Isador is a woman who has worked selling cosmetics to help with family expenses since she was a young girl. She is 37 and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband is a printer. She has two children, ages 9 and 16. They are students. She started with loans from Afodenic. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she is thankful for the benefit of having been able to keep her business. With this loan she will buy construction materials to change the roof of her house, which is in bad condition. She will also tile the living room to make her family comfortable and enjoy the benefits of her hard work. Her plan is to be able to increase sales and get customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en el sector  Pachinchapata  Comunidad de Punta Sahuacasi.  Solo tiene estudios  de 5to grado de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1/2  año, la actividad a la que se dedica es venta de fibra (lana de alpaca) y de hilos para artesanías. Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará diferentes tipos de hilos y fibra para poder vender y ganar un poco mas. Le gustaría poder darles una profesión a sus hijos.

Lo que a la señora Celestina le gusta es la puntualidad de los pagos, la responsabilidad de sus compañeras y la facilidad que da Manuela Ramos para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Celestina is a member of the "Punta Sahuacasi" communal bank in the province of Azangaro, department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in the Pachinchapata Comunidad section of Punta Sahuacasi. She has only studied up to the 5th grade of primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past half year and sellsalpaca wool and threads to craftspersons. Her first loan was for S/ 500.00 new soles. With this loan for S/ 500.00 new soles she will buy different kinds of thread and wool so she can sell and earn a little more. She would like to be able to give her children a profession. What Celestina likes is being on time with payments, the sense of responsibility of her fellow members and the accessibility that Manuela Ramos gives for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool.

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Ana Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mi Sueño”, vive en el Jr. Santa Rosa cdra. 06, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.

Anita, como le dicen de cariño, es joven y con muchas ganas de cumplir sus sueños en el transcurso de su vida.

Se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas y anticuchos, tiene años ya trabajando con este negocio y le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida en el barrio donde vive. Nos cuenta que una de sus metas es ahorrar mas, e implementar su propio restaurant, para esto tendría que ampliar mas su casa y dejarlo bien acondicionado y se siente con capacidad de lograrlo. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos por kilos que compra a diario y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Cree que si pone más entusiasmo y optimismo podrá cumplir con sus sueños.
Dice: “Agradezco a Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.
texts.en:
Ana Consuelo belongs to the "Mi Sueño" communal bank. She lives on Jr. Santa Rosa cdra 6, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She has a common-law husband, is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children who she supports and who are the reason she perseveres every day. Anita, as she is affectionately called, is young and has a strong desire to fulfill her dreams during her lifetime. She sells prepared meals and anticuchos. She has been working in the business for years and it is going well because she is very well-established in her neighborhood. She tells us that one of her goals is to save more and start her own restaurant. To do this she will have to expand and remodel her house and she feels capable of achieving this. Currently she continues her business and personally attends to her customers with the charisma that characterizes her. With a loan for S/ 1,000.00, she would like to buy ingredients for preparing meals such kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, kilos of chicken which she buys daily and also some utensils for the business so she can give better service to her customers. She believes that with more enthusiasm and optimism she will be able to fulfill her dreams. She says, "I thank Manuel Ramos for having helped me get ahead and to start my business with a loan, now I feel like a fulfilled and capable woman."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Doña Ángela Espinosa tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposo es comerciante de trucha en el mercado Mayoreo. Ella tiene tres hijos de 13,18 y 26 años dos independiente y uno es discapacitado, lo cual tiene que tener mayor cuidado. Con su trabajo ella trata de formarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Tiene su pequeño negoció de tortillería desde hace 7 años tiene su ingreso poco pero fijo. Lo inicio con fondos que tenían ahorrado.
Con este préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales como: cemento, hierro, zinc, tuberías para hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela Espinosa is 52 years old. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband sells trout at the wholesale market. She has three children who are 13, 18 and 26 years old; two are on their own and one has a disability and needs greater care. With her work she tries to give a better future to her children. She has had a small tortilla-making business for the past 7 years and has a small but steady income. She started the business with money she had saved. With a loan from Afodenic she will buy materials such as cement, iron, zinc and tubing to make some improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La señora Salome pertenece al Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.  Tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace 09 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas de nylon, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio.  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir mayor materia prima (nylon) y elaborar sogas en mayor volumen, los mismos que los comercializará en los diferentes mercados de la región; obteniendo ganancias que los destinará en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Salome is a member of the Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero", of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She completed her high school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement since she was 9 years old. She works producing and selling nylon rope. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. With this new loan for S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles she will be able to purchase more raw materials (nylon) to produce rope in greater volume, similar to the type that is sold in the markets of the region. She will use her earnings to help pay for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase strands of nylon

loans.name: Bernarda Lucia

texts.es: Bernarda Lucia López B. tiene la edad de 40 años, Doña Bernarda es madre soltera. Doña Bernarda tiene1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Bernarda inicio este negocio por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día. Bernarda tiene los propósitos de seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es el único que le ayudo salir adelante. Es por este motivo que solicita un financiamiento utilizado para capital de trabajo por lo que Bernarda se considera muy trabajadora y quiere seguir creciendo es por eso que con este dinero compraría camisetas, pantalones, shorts, faldas y ropa interior.  Los sueños de Bernarda son de establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Bernarda Lucia López B. is 40 years old and a single mother. She has one school-aged son. Bernarda's economic activity is selling new clothing, which she has been doing for more than 5 years. She started this business because of the necessity of providing for her son. Bernanda's goal is to continue maintaining the business since it is the only thing that is helping her get ahead. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use as work capital. Bernanda is considered to be very hard-working. She would like to continue growing the business and thus will use the loan to purchase T-shirts, pants, shorts, skirts and underwear. Bernarda's dreams are to set up a business in her home and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años, es una madre jornalera y muy cumplidora, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, por lo que lucha incansablemente a diario, con la finalidad de convertirlos en hombres de bien para la sociedad. Tiene cultivos de arverjas y papas, para ello se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de su esposo que regresa a las 7.00am después de haber trabajado en sus cultivos durante la madrugada. Los 22 años que lleva como agricultora le han dado la experiencia necesaria para conocer las temporadas y el clima, para de acuerdo a ello determinar qué productos deberá sembrar primero. Ana está muy complacida con sus cultivos y más aún con sus cosechas, las cuales le son muy rentables en su tiempo. Para más adelante espera incrementar el número de sus cultivos, aunque hay que tener mucha paciencia para desarrollar sus plantas desde muy pequeñas hasta que maduren, como ésta, su chacra de arvejas, donde decidió tomarse la foto. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, durante los periodos consecutivos de crédito demostró ser una cliente muy responsable con cada uno de sus pagos a su banco comunal, asimismo para este ciclo hace promesas de seguir trabajando con el mismo dinamismo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para el desarrollo de sus cultivos de arvejas, flores y papas que viene sembrando cada año.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old, she is a very hard working mother, she lives in her own house with her couple and father of her 3 children, so she works tirelessly in order to turn them into men of good for society. She grows peas and potatoes, so she wakes up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband who comes back at 7am after working on the farm during the early morning hours. The 22 years she has been working as a farmer give her enough experience to know the season and weather, which is very profitable for her. In the future she expects to increase the plants she farms, although you need a lot of patience to grow plants from the beginning like the pea plants where she took the picture. This is her 5th loan with MFP, during the previous loans she showed to be a very responsible with all her payments to the community bank, she promises to keep on paying the same way. She will invest the money on buying chemical fertilizers in order to develop the pea plants, flowers and potatoes that she farms each year.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 38 años, es una madre muy cumplidora con sus responsabilidades, vive en su casa propia, con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, motivo por el cual está dispuesta a trabajar duramente hasta verlos profesionales. La agricultura es parte de su vida, y la fuente primordial de su economía, pero lamentablemente su chacra de gladiolos, donde hizo una inversión por más de 4000 soles, se inundó debido a las constantes lluvias. Ella y su esposo sienten la impotencia de reparar los daños, pero aun así mantienen las esperanzas de volver a sembrar y recuperar sus inversiones. Gloria está esperando que el agua se evapore, para dejar madurar los bulbos (especie de cápsulas que contienen las semillas) y los cosechará para tratar de recuperar parte de su inversión con la venta de semillas, Lo bueno, es que al recuperar sus semillas podrá volver a sembrar nuevas chacras que le permitirán recuperar su dinero en aproximadamente ocho meses. Por el momento, con sus otros cultivos podrá sostener las necesidades básicas de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido ningún problema con sus pagos anteriores, ya que los ha cumplido con regularidad, en su banco comunal es muy activa y se preocupa por el bienestar de sus demás compañeras. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes químicos para la siembra de otras chacras de papas y gladiolos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old. She is a mother who always takes care of her responsibilities, and she lives in her own house with her partner with whom she has 3 children. Giving her children the opportunities that they need to get ahead in life is what motivates her to work long and hard. Farming is part of her life, and a basic source of income, but unfortunately, her patch of gladiola, in which she invested more than 4000 Sols, was flooded due to the constants rains. She and her spouse feel unable to repair the damages, but they still hold on to the hope that they will be able to plant again and recoup their investment. Gloria is waiting for the water to evaporate to allow the bulbs (which contain the seeds) to mature. She will then harvest the seeds in order to get back some of the initial investment. The good thing is that once she has the seeds, she will be able to plant new patches, which will get her money back in 8 months. For the moment, her other crops will be enough to provide for the basic needs of the home and the education of her children. This is the 5th loan she has sought from MFP, and she has not had a single problem with her payments in the past, since she has always paid on time. She is very active in her community bank, and always thinks about the well-being of her fellow members. With the money that she's asking for, she will buy chemical fertilizers for her other patches of potatoes and gladiola.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 32 años, es una persona tranquila y dócil, vive con su pareja y padre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia desde hace un año, por la cual trabajó mucho para obtener. Desde pequeña apoyaba en los trabajos agrícolas a sus padres, ahora con su propia familia, su trabajo se ha incrementado porque tiene que preparar los alimentos para después acudir a su chacra a realizar los trabajos agrícolas. A Gloria le gusta mucho su labor y le tiene mucho cariño, ya que en todo este tiempo le han permitido ganar mucho dinero, en especial en ocasiones como semana santa, por la venta de flores, y en los meses de enero, febrero y marzo sus hortalizas llegan a tener un buen  precio en el mercado por ser verano en la ciudad de Lima, meses claves para acumular ingresos para mantener su familia durante el año y ahorrar. Durante los años anteriores mayormente ha sembrado hortalizas y flores, después los comercializaba en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, y con esas ganancias pudo construir su casa, donde ahora sus hijos gozan de la comodidad de su hogar, por ello es que ahora va volver a sembrar flores con las semillas que nos muestra en la foto. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y durante los ciclos que viene trabajando ha demostrado puntualidad en los pagos a su banco comunal, y para este préstamo seguirá trabajando con la  misma responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para la siembra de flores y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years old and is a very peaceful person who lives with her couple and father of her two children at their home. Since she was a child she worked in the farm helping her parents, now with her own family, her work has increased as he has to prepare their meals after going to work at the farm. Gloria likes very much her work because it has provided good profit, specially during Holy Week for the flowers sale, and in January, February and march her vegetables get a very good price as it it summer in the city of Lima, those are key months to save profits in order to support her family during the year and save. During the previous years she farmed vegetables and flowers and then she sold them at the city of Tarma, and with those profits she was able to build her house, where her children now have the comfort of a home, this is why she wants to farm flowers again with the seed she shows us in the photo. This is the 5th loan with MFP and during the previous cycles she has paid on time to the community bank, and she will keep on working with responsibility. With the money she is requesting she will buy chemical fertilizers for her flowers and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizaers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 47 años, es una madre muy hacendosa y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, 2 de ellos viven y estudian en Lima, y son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Se dedica a la agricultura y a su bodega, diariamente se levanta a las 4.00am para tener el tiempo suficiente de preparar los alimentos para sus hijos y su esposo que trabaja en la chacra, a eso de las 11.00am cierra su bodega para acudir a sus cultivos, llevando el almuerzo. Maria sabe que la atención oportuna de sus cultivos le procurará buenos frutos y por ende buenas ganancias, las cuales le permitirán acumular el dinero para mantener a su familia. Durante los años que viene trabajando en estas dos actividades; tanto su tienda, como en sus cultivos, ha ganado mucha experiencia, la necesaria para persuadir a cada uno de sus clientes en aras de incrementar sus ventas. María está muy feliz con los trabajos que desarrolla, ya que estas labores le permiten pagar la educación de sus hijos, esperando a que se conviertan en buenos profesionales. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual, y del mismo modo espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una cliente muy respetada debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 1600 soles que solicita comprará de 2 sacos de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de maíz y de papa, y con otra parte comprará mercadería para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years, she is a very responsible mother, she lives with her husband and father of her six children, two of them study in Lima, her children are the reason of all her efforts. She works in agriculture and a grocery store, she wakes up at 4am every day to have enough time to prepare the meals for her children and her husband who works at the farm, around 11am she closes her grocery store to work at her farm and bring lunch to her husband. Maria knows that her attention to her farm will provide her good results and good profits, that will allow her to save money to support her family. During the years she has been working at the farm and her grocery store she has gain a lot of experience on dealing with her clients. Maria is very happy with her work because her business allows her to pay for her children education and she wishes they will turn into good professionals. This is the 5th loan with MFP, she has paid the previous ones on time and will do the same with this one, she is very respected member at her community bank. With the 1600 soles she is requesting she will buy 2 sacks of chemical fertilizers for corn and potatoes, and with the rest she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
" I am a tenant but I never stop believing that someday I will have a farm of my own that I will use to provide the needs of my family. For many years, I acquired the skills to properly grow rice. My husband is also a farmer and we are working together to send all of our three children to school", says Aida D. C., a 32-year old farmer from Agusan Del Sur.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of complete fertilizer and 3 sacks of ammonium sulfate. She thinks that, by doing so, she will be able to help her husband increase their harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. It not only provides people with loans, but with training and insurance coverage, too.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and ammonium sulfate

loans.name: Jonna Mae

texts.en:
" Before we were just renting a small parcel of land to grow rice. Now we have our own farm, which we use to provide and support our family's needs," says Jonna Mae L., a 23-year old mother of one child.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase crude oil, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides. The loan will really help to improve their harvest.

CEVI gives their clients with not just loans. They also provide training and insurance coverage to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase crude oil, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Jonjib

texts.en:
"I started tilling a 3.5 hectare farm during my high school years. My harvest is what I use to buy my needs. I work so that I would have savings of my own for my future family. I help my siblings too with paying for their school needs and my parents with the household expenses. I dreamed that someday I could have a bigger farm so that I could provide for all the needs of all my loved ones," says Jonjib P., 27-year-old single man from Agusan Del Sur.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase herbicides, 30 liters of crude oil and fertilizers. The loan will truly help him to improve his harvest.

CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, 30 liters of crude oil and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sut's Group

texts.en:
There are two people requesting this small loan, all residents of the City of Phnom Penh. The leader, Mrs. Sut S., is a 42-year-old, married woman and is the mother of three children, all of whom are single and live in the family home. Sut S. and her husband own a grocery store out of their home where they sell grocery items to the neighbors who live near their house in the village. They can earn approximately $5 a day to buy foods for their family's eating.

Recently, the family has sold all their inventory from the store and due to the lack of money to continue running the business, Sut S. has decided to seek a loan to purchase additional grocery inventory to sell. The other borrower who has joined the loan, Mrs. Ouch S., is a good homemaker who is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Koy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan that is made up by three people, all residents of Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Koy H. has been selected to be leader by members. Koy H.'s age is 49 and she is widowed with five children; most of her daughters are employed as garment workers for an industry. Her son, Mr. Run, 24, works as a local construction worker.

Presently, Koy H. sells breakfast foods (porridge). She buys the ingredients from the village market, then she cooks them from her home, and finally she starts selling her foods in the morning for her neighbors. Koy H. will use the loan money to purchase more necessary ingredients for cooking food.

The other two borrowers are:

Mrs. P., 35 years old, is a widowed garment factory worker and she requests a loan to pay for her child's school fee.

Mr. B. is a widower man driving a trailer-motor taxi and he is applying for a loan to repair his motor taxi.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients for cooking food

loans.name: Irah Mae

texts.en:
Irah Mae is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Irah Mae is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Irah Mae owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of snacks in the local community. She also retails fruits and vegetables to have extra income.

Irah Mae joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irah Mae is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. Also, she wants to save funds for the schooling of her future children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:

Elvira owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

texts.en:

Its leader, Mrs. Kea S., 39, is a grocery seller. She sells items like cooked ingredients, canned food, and sweets (candies) for kids. She makes an income of around $5 per day to manage her family's daily expenses. Her husband works with her business selling groceries. The modest couple has given birth to two children: both are single and of school age. Kea S. will use all amount of the loan in order to increase the quantity of grocery items to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

S., 30, is a local farmer who is seeking a loan to grow crops.

P. is a 36-year-old housewife and she applies for a loan in order to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of grocery items to sell

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. The loan will help her to save for the future educational needs of her children.

Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to renovate the pens of her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo M. is managing a small parcel of rice farm. He is 32 years old and unmarried. He owns a 1.5 hectare farm that helps him satisfy his daily needs. "I want to grow this farm so that when I will have my own family, I can easily provide all their needs", he says.

He is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase insecticides, fertilizers and pay the laborers’ salaries. He thinks that with the loan he would be able to improve his harvest. 

CEVI aims to help small business grow. It reaches out rural communities and encourages people to start their own livelihood. CEVI gives with not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, fertilizers and pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is 50 years old, married and is the mother of 3 adult-aged children. She lives in the town of Lallo, Cagayan. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. 

Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina M. operates a food-vending business at her age of 60 years old and is married to Remigio. They are blessed with five children: Junior is 38 years old and a farmer; Remilyn is 35 years old and an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker); Rubelyn is 32 years old and an entrepreneur; Rosemarie is 28 years old and a housewife; and their youngest is Mary-Ann who is 21 years old. According to Adelina, in their small rural town of La Paz all of the villagers have a strong sense of community and help each other out.

For almost 27 years now, Adelina has had a business selling vegetables and prepared food. Aside from that, she also manages a typical village store just beside her food stand. She hopes to a loan of  PHP 8,000 in order to increase her current weekly business net income of PHP 1,500. She is really giving her best in order to develop her business despite her old age.

loans.use: To increase her current weekly net income

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“God always plan the best things for us, just trust in Him” said Erlinda. It was this quote that was her motivating factor to move forward in expanding her business and in overcoming difficulties of life. Erlinda was very lucky to have her business continuously grow through her sacrifices. She really wants her business to develop into a grocery store someday and is working very hard to realize her dream. She is asking to borrow loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital.  

She also maintains an eatery business and despite her busy days in the business, Erlinda still does not forget her obligation to her family especially during Sundays when her while family attends mass in their local Church. She is married to Rudy who works with her in their business. They were blessed with 3 children who were all married already. Her daily income from the business is mostly used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
“If you feel like you’re not worthy enough in your business, you should aim higher, deal with it, don’t ever give up, because God is with you always” says Esmeralda T..
