She is married to Rodolfo T. and was blessed with 4 children, Renjielyn, Marilyn, Lorielyn, and Andrealyn. Her children are all married and she already has grandchildren. They live in the village of La Paz Cabatuan, Isabela where there is peace and love felt among villagers.

Her husband has operated a welding shop business for almost 27 years now. Their weekly income from the business is around PHP 3,500 and it really is a big help in sustaining their daily necessities. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to use as working capital for the improvement of their welding shop.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Janit

texts.en:
" I am a tenant of a 1-hectare farm. My husband and I work everyday to really take good care of our crops and ensure quality harvest. Our income is predominantly come from shares. The owner of the farm give us a 1/2 share of the harvest which we use to feed our children", says Janit C., 36-yeaqr old mother of four children.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides. "The loan will really help us be able to increase our harvest. We hope that it will  increase our income as well", she said.

CEVI provides people with credit assistance that they need. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 39 years old and has operated a general store for almost 3 years. The business has become the sole source of income for her family. Eulalia is married to Orlando F. Sr. who he is 41 years old. She has 5 children; Regan is 20 years of age and a farmer, Regan Angelo is 17 years of age, Melvin is 14 years old Angel is the forth child and is in the first year high school and the youngest is Orlando F. Jr. who is 6 years old and is in grade school. 

Eulalia earns a weekly net income of PHP 1,000 from her general store. She is asking for a  loan amounting to PHP 25,000 as additional working capital. She believes that “if you work hard you should incorporate a lot of patience” you can become successful someday. She hopes that the loan she is requesting will pave the way to progress in their only livelihood.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years old and she has operated a typical village store for many years. She is married to German Laggui and they were blessed with 3 children; John Mark is 12 years old and in the first year high school, Jay Jay is 11 years old and in grade school, finally John Lloyd is 5 years old also attends grade school. They currently reside at Barangay Minanga Proper, Angadanan Isabela, a rural area, approximately 4 kilometers away from the national highway.
                                  
Jonalyn is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 20,000. Her daily gross income from the business is around PHP 2,100. Beverages are the most popular item in her village and will use the loan to satisfy her customers and able to improve her business. Jonalyn added that, “when you work hard, unexpectedly you will receive more blessings”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily has run a typical village store and a food vending business for almost 13 years. She is earning a weekly net income of PHP 1,500. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 as additional working capital for her food vending business. She is choosing to maintain her food vending instead of her general store because she believes that she will be able to generate higher income from food vending. 

She is married to Freddie Agdinaoay, a farm laborer in their village. They were blessed with 3 children; Nico is 14 years old, Allan is13 years old, and April Marie is 8 years old. The three are currently studying in high school and elementary school. The family lives together with her parents in law at the moment since they don’t have their own house to live in. Lily tries her best to save money both for the education of their children and for a house of their own someday.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Efrena owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Efrena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In May 2008, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Efrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Efrena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees and other educational expenses of her children. 


About GDMPC:
Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 that she will use to expand her vending business. She is 41 years old and married to Raymundo S., who is a farmer. They live in Barangay La Paz, a rural place where people live peacefully. They were blessed with three children who are studying in high school and elementary school. Merlita has had her business for 12 years and have been able to improve her business some but not to the extent that she has wanted. Merlita is able to generate a weekly net income of PHP 1,000, which she uses to support their necessities at home and education of their children.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married to Domingo C., a seller of agricultural fertilizer in their village. They are blessed with 3 children; Lorelie is 29 years old and an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), Randy is 27 years old & a farmer, and finally Rogie is 23 years old and a Nursing graduate. Rosalina and Comingo both still live in their family home in Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

Rosalina owns and operates her own tailoring business and she specializes in curtains. For as long as she has been in business she has not had the success she would have hoped. Rosalina wants to change this and is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to help expand her business. She believes that patience should always be accompanied by hard work in order to become successful in every business endeavor.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and is married to a Baranggay Captain. He is Santiago G. Jr. and is 47 years old. They were blessed with 3 children; Roxanne is 22 years old and a secretary in Isabela State University, Santiago III is 20 year’s old and nursing graduate, and Salvador is 19 years old and graduate of marine transportation. They live in Baranggay La Paz in a well organized place. 

Rosemarie operates a food vending business in their village. She cooks a homemade “Puto” (Rice cake). She is asking for financial capital to sustain and expand her business. She is able to generate an average income of PHP 400 daily. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to use as additional working capital in order to develop her rice cake making business. She loves cooking and she hopes it will become productive in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
" I am a tenant of a 3-hectare farm and I need an additional capital to support my farming business. I wish to grow my harvest so that I would be able to save enough money to buy my own farm", says Shirley B., 41-year old mother of two children. 

She would like to ask a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. " With my loan I will have the chance to improve my harvest and income as well", she said.

Through CEVI. Mrs. B. has developed strong entrepreneurial skills that she used to earn a living for her family. CEVI reached out a number of poor communities in the Philippines to help people get started a new business. CEVI provide with not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old and married to Thomas B., who is a farmer. They are blessed with five children namely: Larry, Danilo, Shirley, Nimfa, and Jeffrey. Four of them are already married.

Teodora manages a vending business. Through the aid of a pedicab, she is able to roam to all the houses in their villages to sell her vegetables and fish. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 in order to sustain and expand her vending business.

Her weekly net income from her business is around PHP 1,500. A good neighbor in their village invited her to join the ASKI microfinance program, which is why she applied for the loan. Teodora believes that hard work is the key to a progressive living.

loans.use: To sustain and expand her vending business

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie wants to borrow PHP 6, 000 from Kiva lenders to maintain her vending business. She is 34 years old and married to Efren E., 35 years old. He assists her in the business by planting different kinds of vegetables in their backyard garden. They are blessed with four children namely: Cherry - 18, Monette - 12, Perang - 11 and Efren - 6. All of them are attending school in different levels. The couple strives hard for the improvement of their poor living situation.

Melonie chooses to roam houses in their village to sell her vegetables instead of waiting for customers to buy the product at her home.

Having a poor living situation really turns Melonie to work harder for the future of her children. Currently, her family lives in the poor and remote village of St. Teresa Lallo, Cagayan. Melonie is hoping that, someday, despite their poor living conditions they will be able to support their children’s education through their small business that she strives to develop.

loans.use: To maintain her vending business

loans.name: Meren

texts.en:
Meren C. is 58 years old and a resident of Barangay St. Teresa in Lallo, Cagayan province. She sells fruit and vegetables and is able to make PHP 300 average daily net income. Her husband served as Barangay (district) Captain in their village and used to help her in managing her fruits and vegetable vending business. They have children who are also helping her in buying volumes of vegetables and fruit since they no longer attend school.

They have only .3 hectares (.75 acres) of rice field where they get stock for their rice consumption. Meren is asking to borrow PHP 10,000 that will serve as additional working capital for her vending business. In this way, her vending will grow more for the future of her two children who were not able to continue studying to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To serve as additional working capital

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg D. lives with her husband and two small children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 4 year old son and 2 year old daughter go to a local kindergarten.

Battsetseg and her husband have a small business in passenger transportation. Her husband drives a microbus along the Tsaiz 16-Narantuul route, one of the busiest routes between two large market places. Battsetseg works on the bus collecting tickets and helping passengers on and off. Battsetseg and her husband usually work 6 to 8 rounds of their routes a day and have been working their routes for the last four years.

In the future, they would like to purchase a bigger microbus to serve more passengers. They request a loan to fix the microbus. All four tires need to be replaced and the engine needs to be checked.

loans.use: To fix their microbus

loans.name: Michelle Ann

texts.en:
Michelle Ann A. is already married, has one child at her young age of 21. Her family is happily and peacefully living in the village of Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan. The couple maintains a hog raising business in their simple village which served as their sole source of income in the village. Their hog raising also produces piglets which they usually sells after two months of giving birth to little some villagers who also wanted to raise hogs like them. For further sustenance of hog feeds and vaccines for piglets Michelle plans to borrow loan from the lenders amounting to PHP4,000. 

When she was young, Michelle also used to sell vegetables in their village to earn a daily income for her family. She isn't hesitant in selling like other mothers at young ages do, because according to her, she wants her family to live a progressive way of living in the future.  She is trying to work hard to achieve her dreams someday. She is happy having earned PHP500 daily gross income from her business as this already lessens their financial difficulties.

loans.use: To buy hog feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Onofre

texts.en:
Onofre is engaged in a native hog raising business in their poor and remote village of St. Teresa in Lallo, Cagayan. He is 30 years old and married to Wilma, 28 years old, who is a housewife.

He was glad that he was given opportunity to have his pig to raise considering that most residents in their village lack income opportunities and most have low educational attainment. Through serving as rented farm laborer and tilling his small farm lot and by patiently raising his pig, Onofre is able to continuously support the education of his two children and provide their daily living. 

Onofre finds it difficult to keep his pig raising progressing due to lack of finances to supply feed for the animal to grow and produce piglets. Thus, he is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 for maintenance of the business and also to use for some other needs. He hopes to improve his business and somehow is planning to put up a pig house where he can secure his livestock.

loans.use: For maintenance of his business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
"Farming entails a lot of hard work," says Gina F., the 31-year-old of mother of two children. "My husband and I have been tilling land since the start of our marriage. It is hard work, but this has been the only thing that sustains our family."

Gina is requesting a loan of Php 14,000. She will use the loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and well as pesticides and other farm necessities.

She hopes to be able to improve their harvest with her loan. She would like to thank CEVI for helping her to sustain her livelihood.

CEVI provides not only loans but training sessions and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of fertilizer and well as pesticides and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric D. S. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married, and has two infants. Ric is starting a business providing barber services to local community members. He is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ric joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This loan will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 


About GDMPC:
Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She plans to utilize this loan toward the improvement of her general store business, located in their peaceful and remote village of Barangay Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan.

She and her husband Cirilo sell a wide variety of items in their general store, including several kinds of vegetables. Much of their income goes toward the education of their five children, who presently attend college, high school, and elementary school. It is Rosalina's and Cirilo's earnest hope that all their children will someday earn college degrees, and they support them in this endeavor not only financially but by providing a great deal of moral support.

The general store business generates enough financial resources to cover their daily household expenses, which is why Rosalina hopes to sustain the business for the sake of supporting her family. By expanding and growing her business, she can continue to do this, as well as to provide for the children's educational goals.

loans.use: To improve her general store business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma L. is about 43 years old. She is married with five children. They live in the peaceful village of Barangay Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan. Thelma raises hogs and also sells fruits and vegetables in their village. She earns PHP 250 a day in income from vending. Some of the income is invested in hog raising and some is used to pay for her family's basic needs and the allowances of her children who are still studying. She is thankful that her husband accompanies her in their business undertakings.

Three of Thelma's children are currently attending school and so, together with her husband, she is working hard. She is seeking the support of lenders to loan her even the small amount of PHP 4000 to maintain her hog raising and vending business. She hopes to diversify her business someday to create a brighter future for her children. Thelma says that she believes that through this loan, she will be able to pursue all her business plans with patience, hard work, and trust.

loans.use: To mainain her hog raising business and diversify her vending inventory.

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Byambahuu T. lives with her husband and 20 year old daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a sophomore student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar.

Byambahuu has a small retail business selling women's handbags and purses. She sells from a small, rented stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She brings her goods from Ereen, a border town in China from which many products are imported. Sometimes she travels to Beijing to purchase higher quality handbags and purses. In the future, she would like to rent stalls at busy shopping malls in the city. She requests a loan to purchase more handbags and purses from Ereen.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags and purses to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda manages a humble hog raising business. She lives in the remote village of Barangay St. Teresa of Lallo, Cagayan. She is already 47 years old. Married to Manuel, 50 year-old  farmer.  The couple is blessed with one child whom they want to dedicate their sacrifices in maintaining both their farming and hog raising business. Yolanda is requesting to borrow loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7,000 for her business maintenance and will also able to earn good profit when sold to pig buyers. She hopes to improve her business in order to help her husband uplift their way of living. 


.

loans.use: Buy hog feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Murotali

texts.ru: Худойназаров Муротали- мужчина 35 лет. Муротали женат отец 4-х детей. Муродали занимается продажей запчастей на рынке Аппон Аштского района. Муродали также работает в пожарном охране. Муродали закупает товары у оптовиков на рынках Гули Сурх города Истаравшана. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года ему нравятся все наши условия поэтому он решил продолжить с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Murotali H. is a 35 year old man, married and the father of four children. He sells spare auto parts at the Appon Asht district market. He also works in the fire protection service. Murotali buys goods from wholesalers at the Guli Surkh markets in the city of Istaravshan. He has been a client of the organization since 2008 and has liked our loan conditions, so he decided to continue working with us.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare auto parts

loans.name: Dugarjav

texts.en:
Dugarjav N. lives with his wife in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All four of his children have grown. The oldest son is married and lives with his family. The next oldest son is a soldier in the Mongolian army. The two youngest children are college students in Darhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.

Dugarjav has a small sewing business. He has been working for his family's sewing business with his wife for the last three years. They sew various clothes for women and men, by request. His two children in Darhan contribute to their parents' business by selling some of the clothes in Darhan. In the future, they would like to expand their family business by adding more clients and seeking different possible channels to sell their products in the local market.

Dugarjav requests a loan to purchase more raw materials, such as various cottons, and one new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials and one new sewing machine.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena I. is engaged in a unique type of business. She buys scrap materials, empty bottles, cans and other recyclable materials then she resells them at a higher price to gain an income. She is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. Three of her children are married and her younger three children still attend school. Together with her responsible husband, they were able to maintain their business until now. 

She is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 9,000 to increase their operating capital, allowing them to buy and sell more items and bring in more profit. They even collect old newspapers, used bottles and boxes, plastic bottles, etc. Despite the hardship they are encountering in their business, Buena said that with God’s help, they can overcome the challenges of life. She hopes to set up a junkshop business and purchase a motorcycle to use as they roam villages buying junk materials to sell in higher price. She also prays that her three children may someday finish their studies through college allowing them to obtain a better job in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
"We started farming last 2005. We have two separate farms and we use our harvest to buy our family needs, especially for our children. We fish in the river for viands. Freshwater fish are tasty and very safe to eat," says Rosielyn T., a 22 year old mother of one child.

Rosielyn would like a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She needs more capital for land preparation. She will use the loan to purchase two quarts of fungicide and bags of complete fertilizers.

CEVI is reaching out to poor Filipino families to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI gives not just loans but also provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase two quarts of fungicide and bags of complete fertilizers.

loans.name: Nishonboy

texts.ru: Мамадкулов Нишонбой-мужчина 31 лет. Нишонбой женат. Нишонбой занимается купли продажей скота. По специальности он электрик. Весною каждый год он ездил на заработки в Российскую Федерацию но из за финансового кризиса не решился поэтому в этом сезоне. Вот решил, получит у нас кредит, и  заняться купли продажей скота. Жена Нишонбоя швея также вырученная сумма идет на бюджет семьи. Он очень рад с нами сотрудничать Нишонбой хочет развиваться, что больше не поехать на заработки.
texts.en:
Nishonboy M. is 31 years old and married. He buys and sells livestock. He is a professional electrician, and has travelled to Russia every spring to find work, but because of the economic crisis he decided not to go this year. Instead he will take out a loan and work buying and selling livestock. Nishonboy's wife is a seamstress, and her income also aids the family budget. He is very happy to be working with us, as he wants to develop his business and make traveling to seek work unnecessary.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock trading

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Гапирова  Мунира – женшина 26 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребенка. Мунира узнала о нашей программе решил получит займы для увеличение оборота. Мунира на полученный займ хочет купить овец и перепродать по выгодной цене. Муж Муниры работает в колхозником получает мало денег из за это Мунира вынуждена помогать мужу, чтобы прокормит семью. Мунира также в сезон фруктов занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Мунира очень благодарна   нам за оказанную услугу.
texts.en:
Munira G. is a 26 year old woman. She is married and has one child. She found out about our program and decided to obtain a loan to increase her business's turnover. She would like to use the loan to buy sheep and resell them at a profit. Munira's husband works on a collective farm and makes very little money, so she needs to help him support the family. In the fruit season she will also buy and sell dried fruit. Munira is grateful for the service provided.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock sales

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar B. lives with his wife and two small children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His ten year old son goes to a local high school and his three year old daughter stays at home.

Enhbayar runs a small car repair shop from his home's garage. He also sells second hand car accessories. He has been running his repair shop for the last nine years. He usually purchases cheap car accessories from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar. In 2008, he traveled to South Korea to buy high quality car accessories for his business but failed to make a profit due to the expensive shipping costs. He is working hard to make this up.

In the future, he would like to expand the most profitable side of his business, which is fixing cars in his shop and selling cheap secondhand accessories. He requests a loan to purchase materials and car accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and car accessories for his repair shop.

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Enhbold D. lives with his wife and their teenaged daughter in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Enhbold's family lives in his parents' home because they are unable to afford one of their own. His daughter is 14 years old and goes to a local high school.

Enhbold has a small business making furniture. He started his business in 2000 with his wife. His workplace is located very close to the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. This convenient location makes the transportation of furniture to the Narantuul market easier and cheaper. He mostly makes drawers, cabinets, and shelves. The demand for these products is quite high because they are cheaper than imported furniture.

In the future, Enhbold would like to expand his business by adding more desirable furniture items. He says that with his increased profit, he aims to purchase his own home, where he will be able to live with his family.

He requests a loan to purchase raw materials, such as clean-cut wood, for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his furniture-making business

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Искандарова Сайера- молодая девушка ей 21 лет. Занимается вязанием шерстянных носков и переработкой пряжи. Сайере помогает мама и старшая сестра. Свой товар она продает на рынках Ошоба и Аппон Аштского района. Она узнала о нашей организации у своих соседей и решила придти в наш офис. Ей понравились все наши условия теперь она наша клиентка. На полученный займ она хочет оптом купит пряжу. Отец Муниры находится на заработках в Казахстане, поэтому она с мамой вынуждены сами работать.
texts.en:
Sayora I. is young, 21-year-old woman. She is involved in knitting of wool socks and processing of yarn. Her mother and sister assist her with the business. Sayora sells her products at the Oshoba and Appon markets in the Asht district. She found out about our organization from her neighbors and decided to come to our office. She liked all of our terms and became our client. Sayora wants to use this loan to purchase yarn wholesale. Sayora’s father is working in Kazakhstan, which is why Sayora and her mother need to work.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of yarn

loans.name: Enhmaa

texts.en:
Enhmaa D. lives with her husband and four children, whose ages range between 7 and 13, in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two oldest children are both high school students and the youngest two are 7-year-old twins who stay at home. Enhmaa's husband is a driver and works in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.

Enhmaa has a small retail business selling second-hand clothing. She has been selling clothes for the last eight years in the Narantuul market. She usually purchases her clothes in large bags in the wholesale section of the Narantuul market and sells them individually for profit. Her family currently lives on a piece of land owned by Enhmaa's sister. In the future, she hopes to buy her own land and build a small house for her family. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes for her business

loans.name: Наргиса

texts.en: Худойкулова Наргиса – молодая девушка ей 22 лет. Образование у нее  средне – специальное. Наргиса занимается переработкой пряжи и продажей шерстяных вещей. Наргис по специальности швея. На полученный займ она хочет купит пряжу. Свой товар она реализует на рынках Ошоба и Аппон торговать, ей помогает мать. Наргис имеет достаточный опыт работы в этой сфере. После окончания  средней школы она начала занимается, переработкой пряжи так это приносит не плохой доход.

loans.use: производство и пряжа насков

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Yolanda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling roasted pig (lechon) in the community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $170) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as savings for her children's future.

About GDMPC:

nGata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Сатторова Гульбахор - женщина 47-ми лет, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Продаёт метражные ткани на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района. Два раза в неделю Гулбахор вместе с дочкой ездит в город Истаравшан за товаром.  На полученный кредит она хочет расширить свой ассортимент за счет летних тканей, и тем самым поднять свой товарооборот. Её товары пользуются большим спросом среди покупателей,  так как она привозит качественные и красочные ткани по доступным  для населения  ценам. Гульбахор рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Gulbahor S. is 47 years old, married and has three children. She sells textiles at a clothing market of the Spitamen district. Together with her daughter, Gulbahor travels to the city Istaravshan twice per week for her goods. She wants to use this loan to expand her goods assortment by adding summer fabrics and, thus, increasing her goods turnover. Gulbahor’s textiles are in high demand among customers because she sells quality and colorful fabrics at affordable prices. Gulbahor is happy to be collaborating with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and is a resident of Barangay Natappian West Solana in Solana, Cagayan. She has five children. The first three are attending school, while two of them are still young. She is married to Marcelo I., who is a driver in their village. Janet and Marcelo help each other for the progress of their lives.

Janet operates a village store to help her husband provide for their family and send their children to school. She is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 as additional working capital to grow her general store. She wakes up as early as she can to open the store and does not close until 8 p.m. to earn as much profit as she possibly can. The couple tries hard in order to give their children better lives in the future.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny lives in the village of Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her husband works as a simple farmer. While free from farming duties, Jenny operates their old “kalesa” transport business that still exists in Solana, Cagayan. A “kalesa” is a cart which is pulled by a horse. Its use dates back to the Spanish regime in the Philippines. Jenny says that the “kalesa” is helpful to their daily living. It does not require the expense of gasoline, which is also a great contribution to the environment. She further said that this type of transportation will last for a long time and is something they can rely on.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 for business necessities such as improvement of the cart used in their transportation business. The cart they use is old and is in need of repair in order to give their passenger comfort as they ride. Jenny is 24 years old and soon will have a child to support with its education and basic needs.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 24 years old and lives in Barangay Natappian, West Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Juan I., who is 28 years old and a simple farmer in their village. She has one child who is still young and does not yet attend school. Juanita runs a general store and has struggled to expand it because she lacks the capital to make improvements. She is requesting a loan to get working capital to make these improvements happen. With this loan, Juanita plans to buy more groceries in bulk and more of the items in highest demand among her customers, such soft drinks, cosmetics, canned goods, soaps and other items. 

She hopes to expand her business because she knows this can help improve her family's life. She says that the loan she is requesting will be paid back through hard work and perseverance so she may succeed. Juanita also hopes to provide the child she has now and any others she may have in the future with better education. She is praying that her loan request is granted soon.

loans.use: To improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Турабоева Насиба-1986 года рождения, замужем, имеет одного ребёнка.Её муж Боймуродов Маруф занимается куплей и продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Её муж помогает ей  с куплей-продажей скота, потому что хочет расширить  семейный  бизнес пока она сидит  с их маленьким сыном. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, Nasiba T. is married and has one child. Her husband, Maruf Boymurodov, is involved in buying and selling livestock at a livestock market. Nasiba feeds cattle at home. Her husband helps her with the livestock sales because he wants to expand the family business while Nasiba is at home with their young son. They want to use this loan to increase the livestock headcount and make a bigger profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 29 years old, married and lives in the village of Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan, where she operates a small general store. This business is her sole source of income, and her husband helps her run it. Working together, they hope to provide a good future for their children. To help generate additional income, her husband sometimes works as hired farm laborer. 

Julia works at her job while also doing household chores, and finds it difficult to expand her business because money is so tight. She is seeking this loan to improve her store, increase her income, and improve her house.

loans.use: To expand her small grocery store

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina and her husband Santiago own and operate a general store in the village of Natappian, which is west of Solana, Cagayan. They sell a variety of items in their store, including dried fish, vegetables, candy and household tools. Much of their income goes towards raising and providing for the education of their children. She is requesting this loan to expand the store and increase her income. Lina and her husband are working hard to give their children a better life and quality education.

loans.use: To expand her small grocery store

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina P. is 46 years old and makes a living producing soy sauce in her peaceful village, Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Rogelio, who is 45 years old and works as a security guard at the San Miguel Corporation. They are blessed with 5 children: Alexander, 28 years old and a driver-mechanic in Dubai; Primo, 25 years old and a helper in the San Miguel Corporation; Arsenio, 19 years old and currently in his third year of college; Divina Grace,16 years old and a freshmen college student; and Angelica, 9 years old and in grade school. 

Rina works hard to make her soy sauce, and delivers it in boxes to general stores in their village and other ones nearby. She currently invests part of her profits in the business and uses the rest to meet her daily needs and pay her children’s tuition fees and school allowances. Rina has applied for this loan to expanded her business, generate a higher income and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: To expand a small manufacturing business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables, and is proud that this business helps her family overcome many of life's hardships. They live in the simple village of Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her husband farms a small rice field, but his earnings were only enough to pay for one semester's education of their children. 

Her strong desire to improve her business has led her to apply for this loan, which she will use to increase her working capital. She is proud that she has been able to give her children an education that will allow them to get good jobs and support their own families. She hopes to expand her business and become an even more successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru: Тошпулотов  Мансуржон - мужчина 32-х лет, женат,  имеет 3-х  детей.   Он  занимается  куплей  и  продажей  скота  на  скотном  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  Мансуржон  кредитуется  у  нас  больше  двух  лет.  Его  жена  Джураева  Мархабо  занимается  переработкой  и  продажей  молока  и  тем  самым  пополняет  семейный  бюджет.  За  счёт  нашего  нового  кредита  эта  молодая  семья  планирует  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Мансуржон  благодарен  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  его  планов  и  рекомендует  нашу  организацию  своим  знакомым.
texts.en:
Mansurjon T. is a 32 year old man with a wife and three children. He works in livestock trading at the Spitamensk district livestock market. Mansurjon has been our client for over two years. His wife Marhabo Juraeva processes and sells milk to earn income for the family. The young family plans to use the new loan to buy a dairy cow with a calf. Mansurjon is grateful to the lenders for helping him fulfil his plans. He recommends this organization to his friends.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa T. is 50 years old and resides in Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. She currently makes an income by selling fruits and vegetables in front of her house. She is earning a weekly income of PHP 750. She is married to Angel T. who is the father of her three children. Her husband assists her in the business and they both wish to expand it for the future of their children.

Tomasa is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 in order to purchase more vending products. She hopes to buy three new kinds of vegetables: lettuce, cabbage and “pechay” (a squash) to further increase her income. She dreams of having a permanent stall for her business someday and is working very hard to achieve all her dreams in life, especially for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 44 years old and is married to Marcos H., a 43-year-old farmer. They were blessed with two children who are both studying. The eldest, Herson, is 17 years old and is currently a college student, while the second, Lea May, is 13 years old and a high school student. The family lives in the hilly place of Barangay San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. Delia's dream is to uplift their standard of living someday, and she is working very hard to become successful. According to her, life is full of challenges, but she never gives up trying to reach her dreams.

Delia is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to expand her rice retailing business. The money will enable her to maintain her business and also expand into a vegetable vending business. Currently, Delia is able to earn an income of PHP 700 weekly. She uses her income to provide for her family needs and saves some of it for the schooling of her children, who are enjoying their summer class vacation at the moment. She wants to grow her business and she is praying that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.ru: Хайдаров  Исомиддин - мужчина 43-х лет, женат,  имеет 5-х  детей. Чтобы  прокормить  свою  семью  он  решил  заняться  откормом  скота.  Он  имеет  большой  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  так  как    с  юных  лет  помогал  отцу  пасти  скот.  Исомиддину  помогают  его  сыновья.  Он  закупает  бычков  на  Спитаменском  скотном  рынке  и,  откормив  в  течении  5-6  месяцев,  перепродаёт  их  за  хорошую  цену.  Кроме  того  он  работает  колхозником  в  дехканском  хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Isomiddin H. is a 43 year old man, he is married and has five children. He decided to start feeding cattle to be able to feed his family. He has good experience in animal husbandry because he has been helping his father to shepherd the cattle when he was young. Isomiddin's sons help him. He buys calves on the Spitamen cattle market and after feeding them for five or six months he resells them at a profitable price. Besides that he works as a farmer in the collective farm.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a resident of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. She is 42 and married to Edwin A., 43. They have five children: Michael, 25; Julius, a 23-year-old high school graduate; Edwin, 22; Edward, 17; and Rachel, 14. Unfortunately her children did not pursue their studies because of financial difficulties. She believes that as a mother, no matter what unfortunate circumstances her family encounters, she must do her best to provide her family with a satisfactory daily life. 

Elsie has just started selling cut firewood in their village. Before this she was engaged in retailing but due to life difficulties she had to change jobs in order to provide for her family. She would like a loan of PHP 6,000 so that she can expand her business. She dreams to uplift her family’s quality of life and is working very hard to realize that dream. She is happy that they manage to eat three times a day like other families do in their simple village. She also shared that by being patient and active in their community, she knows she can be of great help and become successful someday.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Geremias

texts.en:
Geremias, 43, is now a widower. Geremias and his children currently live in San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. His eldest child is Marrisdine, 15, then Kein Paul, 11, and Geremias A. Jr., 7. All his children are studying and he hopes to support them in their studies through college.

Geremias has operated a tricycle transport business for four years. He would like to obtain a loan so that he has enough capital to pay for maintenance of his passenger tricycle. He is requesting to a loan of PHP 4,000. He hopes that his request will be granted because his transportation business is very helpful for his family. This is the only source of income and he hopes it will be successful. He knows God will always be there to support him so he always includes his family and their success in his prayers.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Chulduzoy

texts.ru: Хаитова Чулдузой- женщина 41 лет. Замужем имеет 4-х детей. Чулдузой занимается откормом скота. У неё 60 коз и 2 овца. Её помогает муж и старшая дочка.Чулдузой дополнительно занимается переработкой пряжи и вязанием шерстяных вещей а её муж продаёт на рынке Чоркута. На полученный займ  хочет купить овец и козы. Чулдузой очень внимательная женщина так она прокармливает свою семью.
texts.en:
Chulduzoy H. is a 41 year old married woman with 4 children. Her main occupation is animal farming. She has 60 goats and 2 sheep. Both her husband and her oldest daughter help her with this. In addition, Chulduzoy processes wool and knits various clothing, which her husband sells at a market "Chorkuta". Using Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional goats and sheep. Chulduzoy is a very responsible woman who provides for her family.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda D. S. is a resident of Barangay San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. She is already a widow and has four children. Her children aren’t able to pursue college due to financial difficulties. Her eldest child is Beth, who is now 30 years old and is already married. Her second child is Maricel, who is 27 years old. Her child third is Marlon, who is 26 years old, and her fourth child is Rowel.

Emelda is engaged in a hog-raising business and is maintaining a vending business at school, which she runs during classes in her village since the school building is near her house. Emelda would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to fund additional working capital for her hog-raising business. She hopes that her business will grow and become a good source of income for her family. Now that her husband has passed away and her children are all married, Imelda has no one to depend on but herself alone. She believes in the saying, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: Fund working capital for hog-raising business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 48 years old. He lives and maintains a piggery business in the village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. He is married to Eponela S. and they are blessed with three children. His eldest child, Sherwin, is 26 years old and a high school graduate. Joey is 24 years old and a college graduate. Adrian and is currently studying in college. 
Mario is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 for his piggery business. Mario is able to generate an income of PHP 800 for every piglet that he sells to individual buyers who also want to raise pigs. He plans to expand his piggery house into a larger space so he can raise more pigs. Mario hopes to avail the loan he is requesting because he believes it will serve as a means to continue paying for his youngest child’s education. He is dreaming that his child will finish his education. He knows that nothing is impossible if he does his best to succeed in his business endeavor.

loans.use: Expand piggery house

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros sells snacks in the high school building just beside her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more goods and snacks to sell at her school vending business. She also sells ready-made food and vegetables to some of the other villagers. According to her, she is able to earn around PHP 3,000 a month and uses it to provide her family with necessities. Milagros hopes to become financially stable and she wished her family will always be healthy.

“Only those who are diligent will survive” shared Milagros; this has been her main principle in life. She is 60 years old and is married to a farmer, Antonio A.. They live in the peaceful village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with five children; Elito, Edwin, Evelyn, Emelyn, and Marilyn. Milagros feels lucky to have her children who are very supportive and responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Солиева  Мехринисо - 1968 года рождения, замужем, имеет  8  детей.  Вот  уже  больше  пяти  лет  она  занимается  продажей  продуктов  питания  на  Центральном  рынке  Спитаменского  рынка. Три  года  назад  она  обратилась  в  нашу  организацию  за  помощью  в  приобретении  магазина.  Сейчас  Солиева  Мехринисо  благодаря  нашим  кредитам  имеет  собственный  продовольственный  магазин  на  территории  рынка.  Её  товары  пользуются  хорошим  спросом  среди  покупателей,  так  как  она  всегда  привозит  качественные  и  хорошие  продукты.  Два  ёё  старших  сына  - студента  помогают  ей  привозить  товар  из  города  Худжанда,  куда  они  ездят  2-3  раза  в  неделю.
texts.en:
Mehriniso S., 41, is married and has 8 children. For more than 5 years, she has been in the business of selling food at the central market "Spitamensky". 3 years ago, she applied for a loan with our organization to purchase a store. Now, thanks to the credit that we provided, Mehriniso has her own store on the territory of the market. Since she always sells good quality food products, there is a significant demand for them among the customers. Two of her older sons help her with this business by assisting with importing the products from Hujanda town, where they go 2-3 times a week.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. is 43 years old and married to Reynaldo A., a 44-year-old farmer. They live in the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. The place is quite remote and mountainous. Over time, they were blessed with four children. The eldest, Hazel, is 22 years old and is a high school graduate. The second, Hemerson, is 19 years old. Jayherson, her third child, is 15 years old and just graduated from primary school. Her youngest child, Kyla, is still in grade school.

Nora is engaged in a piggery (hog raising) business. She has been in business for many years and it has been of big help to her family. Her wish is to expand her business to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used as her working capital in the expansion of her business. She is planning to buy additional piglets and four sacks of pig feed. She is always dreaming of raising their standard of living, and she knows that she can reach her dream by working continuously. Nora believes that, having patience in work, anything we want in life we will be able to attain some day.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay C. is a 46-year-old mother of six children; all of them are single and attend school. She and her husband are local rice cultivators. As another income source, Hay C. raises a few pigs in a pigpen next to her house. She can sell all her pigs to buyers four months after she begins raising them.

To alleviate the hard physical labor in farm work, Hay C. would like a loan on Kiva to purchase a buffalo to plow their farmland, and she will rent it out to the other farmers for additional income. (Mrs. Hay C. was not available for photographing so her husband is in the photo instead).

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to plow the farmland

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Шербеков  Азамат – мужчина  1958  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   5  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  продажей  скота.  Каждое  утро  он  отправляет  скот  на  пастбище  вместе  с  пастухом,  которому  платит  по  договорной  цене.  Его  жена  вместе  с  дочерьми  работает  в  колхозе.  Кроме  того  Шербеков  Азамат  покупает  у  пастухов  молодых  бычков  по  низкой  цене  и,  откормив,  через некоторое  время  перепродаёт  их  мясникам  по  хорошей  цене.  На  новый  кредит  он  рассчитывает  купить  партию  мелкорогатого  скота  и  отправить  их  на  пастбище  до  осени.
texts.en:
Azamat S., 51, is married and has 5 children. His main occupation is animal farming. Every morning, he sends the animals with a shepherd, whom he pays an arranged price. His wife and daughters work on a farm. In addition, Azamat purchases calves from shepherds at a fairly low price, fattens them, and after a period of time sells them to butchers for a profit. He plans to use this loan to purchase several calves and send them to pasture until fall.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 and married to a farmer, Marcelino D. who is 54 years old. They reside in Barangay San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with three children who were all now married. Her children were not able to finish their studies because of early marriage and difficulties in life.

Rebecca's main business is hog-raising. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to purchase feed for her pigs. The money will enable her to improve her business and increase her income as the pigs grow larger. Rebecca is a woman full of hopes. She believes that dreaming should be accompanied by hard work and patience to attain success.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda hopes to start a hog-raising business and is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to start up the business. She already has a pigpen but due to lack of capital she couldn’t buy any piglets to raise. She is hoping that Kiva Lenders will give her the opportunity to develop her hog-raising business so that she may help her husband earn a living. She wants to prepare for the future education of their children. She hopes that they will be able to finish college someday but she will have to save a lot of money for that dream to be realized. She just hopes that she will be given the chance to have the business that someday will expand and provide a large income.

Yolanda is 38 years old and married to Policarpio A.. They are blessed with two children; her elder Jayvee is 19 years old, and Rustom is 13 years old. Yolanda hopes to give them both the best education she can so that they may have a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Amam

texts.en:
Amam S. is currently selling beans and rice at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more chairs and tables for enough accommodation of customers in her restaurant. She is 28 years old and got married to a clerk who works in the Ministry of Regional Co-operation, government of Southern Sudan (GOSS). Amam has one child who doesn't go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land, build a house and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more chairs and tables for her little restaurant

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang N., 39, has been in the farming business since 1990 in the province of Pursat. Her husband helps her in growing crops. The family work hard every day at their business activities and never waste time because they want to send their four children to study at high school and university.

The family are facing a problem in the farming business because their farmland is full of water during the rainy season; that is why they hope to buy a piece of land by looking for a loan on Kiva. Neang N. plans to use 30% of the loan to pay for plowing a field.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and to pay for plowing a field

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Турдикулова Матлюба- женжина 25 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребёнка. Она занимается откормом скота более 8 лет. Её свекров ухаживает за её маленьким ребёнком. В свободные время ей помогает муж. У Матлюбы муж работает на стройке. На полученный займ  хочет купить овец и козы. Матлюба очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Matluba T. is 25 years old, married and has one child. She has been involved in livestock feeding for over 8 years. Her father-in-law looks after her young child. Matluba’s husband helps her with the business during his free time. He works as a construction worker. Matluba wants to use this loan to purchase sheep and goats. She is very grateful to our organization and wants to further grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru: Тупалов Ермухаммад житель города Яван. Возраст 53 года, женат и имеет шестерых детей.Старшие сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Сам Ермухаммад всю жизнь работает в сельском хозяйстве. Засеевает землю злаковыми культурами и овощами. Так и сейчас работает на поле. Получаемый урожай использует для реализации , а некоторую часть оставляет в запасе для семьи. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Yormuhammad T. lives in Yavan. He is 53 years olf and is married with 6 children. His elder sons are working in Russia. Yormuhammad has always worked in agriculture, cultivating grains and vegetables. He still works in the fielf. He sells most of the produce but he also keeps some for his family. Yormuhammad is planning to use the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Мамаюсупов  Ибодулло – мужчина  1973  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  3  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  скота.  Недавно  его  жена  Бобоева  Дилрабо  посоветовала  ему  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученный  кредит  они  решили  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Ибодулло  очень  любит  свою  работу,  так  как  занимается  этим  с  юных  лет.  В  будущем  он  хочет  продолжить  сотрудничество  с  «Микроинвест»  и  на  полученный  займ  он  планирует  расширить  коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Ibodullo M. is married and has 3 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Recently, his wife, Dilrabo Boboeva, advised him to request a loan from our organization. They want to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow with a calf. Ibodullo loves his work because he has been doing it since a young age. In the future, he wants to continue the collaboration with MicroInvest and plans to expand his cowshed with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow with a calf

loans.name: Hursanoy

texts.ru: Дехканова Хурсаной- женщина 40 лет. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Хурсаной занимается, со своей семьёй переработкой пряжи вязанием шерстяных носков. Ей помогают невестка и дочка. Хурсаной реализует свой товар в городе Адрасмане и в городе Худжанде. У неё имеют надежные клиенты, у которых большой спрос. Хурсаной хочет закупить оптом пряжу на полученный займ.
texts.en:
Hursanoy D. is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. Together with her family, Hursanoy is involved in processing of yarn and knitting of wool socks. Her daughter-in-law and daughter help with the business. Hursanoy sells her merchandise in the cities of Adrasman and Khujand. She has reliable clients, ad her products are in high demand. Hursanoy wants to use this loan to purchase yarn wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale yarn purchase

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea V. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of farmland since she was single. She grows rice and all kinds of vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother to one lovely young child. She is married to Than, age 26, who also work as a rice farmer with her.

Crop growing is Chea V.'s main source of income to sustain her family. Chea V. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to use for plowing the fields with the rest of the loan to purchase a plot of land for growing crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow to use for plowing the fields and maybe a plot of land

loans.name: Modo

texts.en:
Modo P. sells green vegetables at the market and requests a loan to open up a shop. She is a 42-year-old woman who lost her husband during the two-decades-long power struggle in South Sudan between the government of Omar and the Southern Sudanese People's Liberation Army which ended as a result of the Naivasa Comprehensive Peace Agreement, signed in early 2003. Modo has four children who do not go to school. In the future, she hopes to be able to build a rental house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Hoja

texts.ru: Хакимов Худжа проживает водном из отдаленных кишлаков города Яван. Возраст 46 лет, женат . Имеет пятерых детей. Зарабатывает на жизнь путем выращивания сельхоз культур. Имеет участок земли. В данный момент необходимо посееть лук и другие овощи. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Это поможет ему получить своевременно урожай. Таким образом он сможет сделать запас для своей семьи , а так же получить прибыль от проданной продукции.
texts.en:
Hoja H. lives in a remote village of Yavan. He is 46 years old and is married with five children. He owns a plot of land and makes a living by cultivating vegetables. At the moment he needs to plant onions and other vegetables, and he is applying for a loan that he would use for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. This would help him harvest the vegetables on time, stock food for the family and sells the rest at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Тургун

texts.ru: Насриддинов Тургун – мужчина 48 лет. Женат имеет 2-х детей. Тургун занимается продажей пряжей и насков. Уму помогает жена невестка и дочка. Тургун продаёт свой товар на рынке Аппон. Тургун является, членом дехканского хозяйства «Сино» Аштского района также дополнительно занимается выращиванием лука и картофеля.У него имеют надежные клиенты, у которых всегда большой спрос.
texts.en:
Nasriddinov Turgun is a 48 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. Turgun sells yarn and socks. His, wife, daughter-in-law and daughter help him. Turgun sells his products at the Appon market. Turgun is a member of a farm “Sino” in the Asht region, where he also grows onions and potatoes. He has reliable customers who always have high demand.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim A. is a 22-year-old man who lives in Hebron city, Palestine, with his parents. Ibrahim owns a pastry shop where he sells sweets. He always looks for a way to improve his business and therefore has been able to grow a good base of loyal customers. He opened the pastry shop because he enjoyed making and selling pastries and wanted to have an independent work life. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his work. The loan he is asking for, USD 3000, is to purchase raw materials and thereby diversify his inventory of goods.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: An

texts.en: An M., 27, raises pigs in a stall next to her house. She also grows vegetables, such as cabbage, morning glory and cucumbers, and sells them to a market-seller three months after they mature. She is married to Sothea, who is 35 and works as a motorbike taxi driver. The couple is responsible for three young children. An M. recently sold all her pigs to a slaughterer. She hopes to acquire another pig to raise. Therefore, she would like to ask for a $300 loan to buy more piglets to raise and more fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Fe is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,416 Philippine Pesos (about US $30) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 pesos from GDMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy N. is 35 years old and married with six children. She has a bookshop where she sells books. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more books to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Norboy

texts.ru: Хасанов Норбой житель города Яван. Живет очень далеко от города. Жители той местности занимаются сельским хозяйством , а так же животноводством. Основными источниками дохода той местности и являются эти два вида бизнеса. Норбой как и все . Сейчас посевной сезон и ему необходим кредит для закупки семян и удобрений. Это поможет ему своевременно произвезти посев и получить качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Norboy H. lives in a very remote area of Yavan. Yavan residents make their living by animal breeding and agriculture. Norboy is no exception. At the moment he needs to purchase seeds and fertilizers. A loan that he is applying for would help to complete everything on time and to get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kambar

texts.ru: Ходжаев КАмбар житель горда Яван. Возраст 38 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. В семье работает один . Работает в сфере услуг. Имеет микроавтобус , который использует в качестве маршрутного такси. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже четыре года. Для того,чтобы произхвезти ремонт машины он решил получить кредит и использовать его для покупки автозапчастей.
texts.en:
Kambar H. lives in Yavan. He is 38 years old and is married with six children. He is the only breadwinner in the family. Kambar owns a minivan that he uses as a taxi. He's had this business for 4 years. Kambar is applying for a loan in order to get spare parts and fix the van.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix the van

loans.name: Zokirchon

texts.ru: Зокирчон Ахмедов - молодой мужчина 1985 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Жена домохозяйка. Зокирчон - парикмахер. Он работает в мужском салоне красоты в районе "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. С начала его деятельности он начинал работу в качестве ученика. Зокирчон учился парикмахером около одного года. Тогда он не получал зарплату. А теперь он сам стал мастером и хочет расширить свой бизнес. Зокирчон пришел в нашу организацию за помощью финансовой части, для приобретения основных средств.
texts.en:
Zokirchon A. is a young man, born in 1985. He is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker, and Zokirchon is a hairdresser. He works in a men's salon in the Panchshanbe district of Khudzhand. He first began working as an apprentice, and spent about a year learning the trade. He was not paid for that time. Now he is a professional and wants to expand his business. Zokirchon contacted our organization for assistance with financing basic assets.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hairdressing salon

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., 51, who lives in Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979, usually grows rice and has two crop yields per year, one in the dry and one in the rainy seaS.. The mother of two children, both teenagers who are attending school, But is married to Saroeun (shown in the photo), 47, who earns a good income driving a motor taxi.   Unfortunately, the motorbike frequently needs repairs, so he can't attract additional customers. Because of this problem, Bun is requesting a loan to buy another motorbike to replace it.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Ашуров Абдуазиз  1960 года рождения ,женат  имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне образование.  Дома содержит и откармливает скот .  Сам он работает в водо-канализации.  Связи с тем что там мало платят он  решил заняться бизнесом . Целыми днями ухажывают за скотом жена и дети. В выходные дни выводит скот на продажу на базар. Купив еще пару скота он откармливает и выводит  на продажу.
texts.en:
A. Abduaziz was born in 1960, is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. He keeps and fattens livestock at home. He works at the water sanitation plant. Because they do not pay a lot there he decided to go into business. His wife and children take care of the livestock during the day. On the weekends he takes the livestock to the market to sell. Having bought another pair of livestock he is fattening it and will take it to sell.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Bojana

texts.en:
Bojana Jeremić was born in 1988. She comes from Karanovac, Petrovo. She is not married and lives with her parents and brother in their family house. Bojana is employed in a big shopping center as a merchant.

Her family owns an orchard with different kinds of fruit such as plums, apples, pears and cherries. As they live together so they work and invest in the orchard together.

So, Bojana requested a loan of 1,500 KM, her first from WWI (Women for Women International). This loan will be used to buy needed equipment and supplies for her orchard. Also, they must provide minerals and use funds for the protection of the fruit. Bojana`s family business is still developing and they expect their first good crop next year.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the orchard

loans.name: Selina's Group

texts.en:
Selina G., 32, currently sells bread and tea and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. She is married to a businessman and has three children who all go to school at St. Bakhita primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Selina hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2005, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It aims to empower people by providing livelihood opportunities through various types of services. Its contribution to community development in upland, lowland and coastal areas is through a professionally managed credit and savings operation, training, and the provision of social services. In addition, GDMPC also actively assists various livelihood projects for small farmers and fisherfolk including access to technologies, procurement of inputs and marketing of products.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru: Ашурхон - пожилая женщина 62 лет. Замужем и мать 6-х детей. Её муж занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Он покупает там дешевле, и через неделю продает, если найдется хороший покупатель, который купит его скот за хорошую цену. Ашурхон помогает мужу. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Ashurhon is an older woman, 62 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Her husband trades livestock at the livestock market. He buys there cheaply, and resells after a weeks or so if he finds a good buyer willing to pay a good price. They would like to use a loan to increase their number of livestock and earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of livestock

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan S. is 25 years old.  She lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of farmland for growing crops. Her husband works with her on the farm. The couple now lives with two children, both of whom are still young and enrolled in school. Kan S. noticed that the business of raising pigs is very profitable because pork is now commanding high prices. Therefore, she would like a loan through Kiva to provide capital to buy piglets and also to fund the growing of crops.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Palima

texts.en:
