Palima S. sells locally brewed alcohol and requests a loan to open up a bar as a sales outlet. She is married to a driver, is 38 years old, and has five children who are not attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she will build a house and rent it out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar as a sales outlet

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Нурматов Шухрат- мужчина 40 лет. Женат имеет 4-х детей. Шухрат имеет 10 летный  стаж в сфере животноводства. Ему помогает жена Гуландом и сын Мурод. 
Так как весной сезон закупа скота, Шухрат хочет на полученный займ купить овец и перепродать  по выгодной ему цене. Он работает сварщикам и дополнительно подрабатывает на жизнь. Откорм и продажа домашнего скота является основным видом деятельности Шухрата.
texts.en:
N. Shuhrat is a 40 year old man. He is married and has 4 children. Shuhrat has 10 years of livestock experience. His wife, Gulandom, and son, Murod, help him. Because spring is the season to purchase livestock, Shuhrat would like to use the loan to purchase sheep and to resell them at a profitable price. He works as a welder and earns additional income to support his lifestyle. The fattening and sale of livestock is Shuhrat’s main business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джуре 41 год. Он женат и отец 5-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Джура занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Джуры – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Джура экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Джура продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Jura is 41 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is not employed, but stays at home, does housework, and feeds the livestock. Jura raises and sells cattle. For him, the beginning of spring means the time to buy animals, as they are cheaper this time of year. He also doesn't spend much on feed for the cows. They eat the mountain pasture, so Jura doesn't need to buy feed. At the beginning of fall Jura sells some of the fattened cows. In the fall he doesn't buy livestock, only feed for the remaining animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат Мирхолов 1962 года рождения , женат имеет  2 детей.  Имеет среднее образования.  Занимается купелей продажей скота. Дома содержит Крупно рогатый скот.  Скот он отправляет  на пастбище вместе с пастухом, которому платит по договоренной цене. Жена  сидит дома, он ни где не работает.  На  прошлой недели он продал корову и на покупки молодых  бычков не хватила некоторая сумма. Для этого он обратился в Мкироинвест для  покупки скота.
texts.en:
Nemat M. was born in 1962, is married and has 2 children. He has a secondary education. He buys and sells livestock. He keeps livestock at home. Nemat sends the livestock to pasture with a shepherd whom he pays the agreed price. His wife stays at home; she does not have a job. Last week he sold a cow and did not have enough money to purchase young bulls. He has turned to MicroInvest in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en:
Marionito A. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Marionito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marionito owns & operates a business selling "tuba" or coconut wine. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Marionito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marionito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marionito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marionito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his busines. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mamatkul

texts.ru: Барлибаев Маматкул- мужчина 50 лет. Женат имеет 4-х детей. Маматкул имеет 12 летный стаж в сфере жывотновотства. Маматкулу помогают жене и дочка. Маматкул подрабатывает на стройке. Каждый месяц сын Маматкула с Росии присылает деньги. Его жена домохозяйка. Она также помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Утром и вечером она доит корову и продаёт молоко. Овцы и козы пасутся в горах на пастбище. Маматкул очень любить свою работу так как он этим занимается с юношеского возраста.
texts.en:
Mamatkul B. is a 50 year old man. He is married and has four children. Mamatkul has twelve years of experience in the field of agriculture. Mamatkul's wife and daughter help him. He also works part time in construction. Every month Mamatkul's son sends money from Russia. His wife is a housewife and she also helps take care of the cattle. In the mornings and evenings she milks the cow and sells the milk. The sheep and goats are on the pastures in the mountains. Mamatkul loves his work very much and he has been doing it since he was a young man.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Abdumachid

texts.ru: Абдумачид – мужчина средних лет (45 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Абдумачида есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состоящее примерно из 40 овец и 20 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Абдумачид каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Абдумачид пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Абдумачид за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Абдумачид очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Abdumachid is a middle aged man (45 years old); he is married and is the father of 4 children. Abdumachid has a flock of small-horned livestock, composed of around 40 sheep and 20 goats. His wife is a homemaker, but in her free time she processes yarn and knits a variety of warm clothing. She sells this clothing to neighbors or relatives. Every morning Abdumachid takes his flock to pasture in the mountains, tends them and in the evening brings them back. For now Abdumachid does not have large-horned livestock. But Abdumachid would like to use this new loan to purchase two medium bulls. After fattening them for 3-4 months he will be able to sell them for a very good price. Abdumachid is very happy to work with us, because the credit helps him very much.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bulls

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is a vegetable vendor and village store owner in their village at Casili Mallig, Isabela.

Her greatest dream is to send her children to school and pursue their education to college level for she believes that education is the only treasure that she can give them. With the support of her husband Domingo and her hard work, she has been able to maintain her businesses that will pave the way to reach her dreams for her three children.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 10, 000 as additional capital for her store. Her hope is to become healthier and stronger to work for her business endeavor and be able to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon wants to expand her general store in order to generate higher income for her family. According to her, this is their main source of income. Aside from having a store, she also manages an eatery located in their rural village in Casili Mallig, Isabela. Her daily income assists her in meeting the needs of her family and also in sending her children to school. 

On the other hand, Sharon was happy for the positive outcome of her businesses. She hopes to borrow PHP 15,000 that she needs for business expansion such as purchasing more merchandise to meet the needs of her customers. With this, she will surely increase her income and maintain her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf E. is a 37-year-old master barber who has run his business for the last 10 years. He is married and has two children. Rauf started his business after he went to special barber school and since that time he has been a master barber for men. Rauf says that he dedicates his life to his adorable children and would like to provide them the best future. For this purpose he applied for a $1,200 loan to improve his work conditions and to purchase new barber tools.

loans.use: Improve work conditions and purchase new barber tools

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is a hardworking mother; she will sacrifice a lot and venture in any work to help her husband in improving their poor living situation. She thinks positively and works out the things that are good in the eye of other people around her.

Estrelita is 44 years old with seven children. Two of them are currently attending school. Her husband is a Barangay (district) leader who wants to become a good model to his constituents. 

Estrelita manages a vegetable vending business where she has a small stall that displays her products. Aside from vegetables, she also sells generic medicines. To further improve her business, she wants to borrow PHP 12,000 that will serve as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: To uses as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores believes that by joining this lending program she will surely expand her business. It is her business that is of big help in providing their daily needs at home, especially the educational needs of her children.

Her family is living in Barangay Casili Mallig, Isabela. Her husband, Jonel, is a tricycle operator while she is selling street foods such as hot dogs, barbecue, fried peanut and so on. The business has been their major source of income thus she patiently maintains it to cope with their needs. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she will use as additional capital to improve her business. She also hopes that they would be able to repair the roof of their house so that it will not leak when it rains. But it is providing a good education for her children that is her priority.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
For almost two years, Mario has successfully managed his village store business. He is already 54 years old and still single.

Mario is hoping to borrow PHP 9,000 for the improvement of his store. He feels the contentment of living all by himself and dedicates his perseverance to support his parents and their daily necessities.

Mario also shared that every week, he can earn around PHP 1,000 net income. That is very useful in supporting their family needs since he serves as the bread winner of his family.

loans.use: To uses for business Improvement

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
M. Brigitte est née vers les années 1963 dans l’une des villes touristiques du BENIN. Brigitte est mariée à GOMEZ Léopold conducteur de véhicule administratif au Ministère des Finances et de l’Economie du BENIN. Brigitte et Léopold ont cinq (5) enfants respectivement âgés de 27 ans, 25 ans, 23 ans, 20 ans et 17 ans ; mais seulement deux continuent leurs études scolaires. Brigitte et sa famille réside depuis 25 ans au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou. Depuis plus de cinq (5) ans Brigitte vend la glace, le jus de bissap, les fruits et le maïs cuit. Brigitte a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts auprès de ALIDé. Ces prêts ont permis à Brigitte de diversifier son activité au fur et mesure jusqu’au stade où elle est aujourd’hui. Brigitte sollicite un cinquième prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
M. Brigitte was born around 1963 in one of the tourist cities of Benin. She is married to GOMEZ Léopold, a chauffeur at the ministry of finance and the economy of Benin. Brigitte and Léopold have five children, ages 27, 25, 23, 20, and 17; but only two of them are continuing in school. Brigitte and her family have been residing for 25 years in the Xwlacodji district of Cotonou. For over five years, she has been selling ice cream, bissap juice, fruit, and cooked corn. She has already been the recipient of four loans from ALIDÉ. These loans have enabled her to diversify her business as she goes along, to the point at which she is today. She's requesting a fifth loan to boost her working capital in order to do better in satisfying her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fresh corn, fruit (bananas), sugar, and packaging for water, and bissap (hibiscus flowers)

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet operates a hog-raising business. She is married, 47 years old, and has children living in Barangay Catayauan Lallo, Cagayan.

Juliet has raised hogs for many years. She hopes that the business will somehow become progressive for her family, especially for her four children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she needs to purchase a feed supply for her hogs.  

According to her, the business is doing well and it really contributes a big help in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Reuon

texts.en:
Reuon R. is 31 years old and a resident of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He sells wood carvings that he carves using wood from the forest and transports the carvings to sell to villagers in his community. He currently earns around $3 per day.

He is married to Prean, who is a vegetable farmer, and who is also a good housewife and the mother of two children; both children are single and still under their care.

The family have been planning to have a motorbike to ride, but the family's finances are only just enough for daily expenses, Therefore, Reuon R. would like a $250 loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for his family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his family's transportation

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Ортиков Баходур. Торгует мясом, колбасой и другими мясными изделиями. Товар привозит из Узбекистана , а также торгует местного производства. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Кредит получил на расширение ассортимента мясных изделий. Благодаря поддержки КИВА он расширил свой товар и бизнес . Планирует в будущем открыть еще одну точку в другом месте.
texts.en:
O. Bahodur sells meat, sausage, and other meat products. He imports goods from Uzbekistan and also sells local products. He has worked with MicroInvest since 2005. He has used his loan to expand his assortment of meat products. Thanks to Kiva, he has been able to expand his inventory and business. He plans to open another shop in the future.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en:
Maylene is a responsible mother and a cooperative resident of Barangay Catayauan Lallo, Cagayan. She is 42 years old and married to Reynaldo U., a farmer. The couple has three children that they send to school.

Maylene sells fish and vegetables in their village and earns a daily income of PHP 750. Sometimes, her husband buys fish from Aparri, Cagayan where they can buy wholesale at low prices.

Maylene is seeking a loan of PHP 7,000 that will be used for the maintenance of her business. Maylene proudly shares that the daily generated income from her business was invested for the future of their children.

loans.use: To be used for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is seeking financial support from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 6,000 for the maintenance of her hog-raising business. Thelma is hoping that her business will grow fast to further support their needs and that they may continue to send all her children to school.

Thelma is 50 years old and living in the village of Catayauan Lallo, Cagayan. She is married to Renato Taraday, a farmer in their village. She has five children namely: Angelie, 28 years old, a college graduate; Janiel, 24 years old, also a college graduate; Jenifer, 22 years old, and a high school graduate; Jinky, 19, who is still in third year college; and Renato Taraday Jr. who is 10 years old and in grade school. 

Thelma believes that, through perseverance, she will be able to manage her hog-raising business well. The business is of great help in fulfilling her family ambitions in life. She prays to God that her requested loan will be granted. It is intended to be used for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To be uses for business maintenance

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old and married with four children. She sells kitchen utensils like plates, spoons, pots, etc. and has been in this business for a long time.

She hopes for the loan N100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Mirzomahsum

texts.ru: Буриев Мирзомахсум- мужчина 28 лет. Неженат имеет среднее образование. Мирзомахсум начел работать  самостоятельно с 18 лет. Он каждый год на заработки ездил в Россию из за финансового кризиса в этом году он не поехал. Он узнал о нашей программе кредитования у соседей и решил попробовать,  он очень доволен нашими условиями. Мирзомахсуму помогает отец и мать. Свой скот Мирзомахсум реализует у мясников. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться
texts.en:
Mirzomahsum B. is a 28 year old man. He is not married and has secondary education. Mirzomahsum began working since the age of eighteen. Every year he would travel to Russia to find work, but did not go this year because of the financial crisis. He found out about our loan program from his neighbors and decided to try it and is very happy with the terms. Mirzomahsum's father and mother help him. He sells his cattle to the butchers. He is very grateful to our organization and wants to keep growing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breeding of cattle

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
D. Virginie est née le 08/07/1968 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Virginie est mariée à GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel gestionnaire de cabine GSM. Virginie est mère de quatre (4) enfants tous scolarisés. Virginie et sa famille vit à Cotonou au quartier Sènadé. Depuis douze (12) ans Virginie vend de divers(Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans sa boutique érigée devant son domicile. Virginie s’approvisionne en ses divers articles à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire accroître ses activités, Virginie sollicite un crédit de auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Virginie was born on July 8, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel, a manager of a GSM phone booth. She is the mother of four children. She and her family live in Cotonou in the Sènadé district. For twelve years, Virginie has been selling various items: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, and bath soap, etc. in her shop set up in front of her home. She stocks up with these goods in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin. To respond better to customer demand and to have her business grow, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of cookies, and 2 boxes of candy

loans.name: Nonouwede

texts.fr:
Cette femme  est née dans la ville de tabligbo, une ville à l’intérieur du Togo, aujourd’hui elle habite à kpogan où elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelée "Sodabi" qu'elle met dans des bidons de 25l, cette boisson est de production locale et très appréciée par les togolais. Actuellement, elle fait face à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 400l de Sodabi. 
Elle est veuve et a 01 enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman was born in Tabligbo, a city in the interior of Togo. She now lives in Kpogan, where her money-making business is consists in selling an alcoholic drink called "Sodabi". She puts it in 25-liter containers. This beverage is produced locally, and very much appreciated in Togo. At this time, she's out of stock and, to resupply, she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 400 liters of "Sodabi". She's a widow with one child, and she uses the profits of her business to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 400 liters of "sodabi" (local alcoholic drink)

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' C Group

texts.en:
For many years, Subira has owned a small shop in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Daily she works at her business.

Subira is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Subira is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 7 and 7. She also cares for four additional dependents.

Subira will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Maria, who has her own small business selling maize in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
For 3 years, Maulid has been a clothes-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns a average monthly profit of approximetly $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Maulid is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Maulid is 27 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Adjélé Mawulé

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle A. a très tôt abandonné les études, devant subvenir  elle-même à ses propres charges, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de mèches, tissages et perruques qu'elle vend en détail, elle souhaite agrandir son activité avec la vente de produits cosmétisques, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier  crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et augmenter son stock avec 4 cartons de mèches, 10 perruques. 
Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a un enfant, c’est avec le revenu issu de son activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle A. left school at an early age. As she had to support herself, she began selling hair extensions and hair pieces which she sells retail. She hopes to expand her business and sell cosmetics, so she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics and add to her inventory with 4 cases of hair extensions and 10 wigs.

She is not married but she has a child. The income from her business allows her to support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora O. is a widow with six children. She is 52 years old. She rears pigs to make a living.

She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more pigs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to rear and sell

loans.name: Eghe

texts.en:
Eghe is married with six children and he is 54 years old. He has a pig farm where he rears pigs.

Eghe hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more pigs to rear and sell. He thanks all Kiva  lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to rear and sell

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en: Ilyas E. is 25. His family lives in a small village of the Agsu region, where Ilyas runs a small grocery store selling food. Ilyas' store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with work. Ilyas has been in business for seven years. Currently he is seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers. Ilyas had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married with two children. She owns a retail business that sells various agricultural products, like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Yulia has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Yulia has been in this business for ten years. The business is seasonal - items sell mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Yulia's business is very useful to them.

Yulia would like to borrow 14,520 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories - bug killers and fertilizers. She hopes to develop her business even more and have more clients who would use her services.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one young daughter. He uses his car to offer taxi services in his city and between neighboring cities as well. Sergei has been in this business for 11 years. Using the phone to get client’s orders he always has plenty of clients. This business is the only source of income for his family.

Sergei would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to fix his car engine. As he makes more profit, he hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To fix the engine in his taxi

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
G. Jeanne est âgée de quarante (40) ans. Jeanne est née à Cana dans la Commune d’Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Jeanne est divorcée et mère de trois (3) filles: Chantal, Sylvie et Lydie qui sont à sa charge. Jeanne vit avec ses enfants  à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; dans le quartier Missessin. Jeanne vend depuis quinze (15) ans des produits cosmétiques, des fruits et des tubercules d’ignames. Depuis trois ans, Jeanne bénéficie des prêts à ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a toujours bien remboursés. Jeanne sollicite encore de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux développer son activité afin d’augmenter son revenu pour un mieux être de ses enfants.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Jeanne is 40 years old. She was born in Cana in the township of Abomey in the County of Zou. Jeanne is divorced and the mother of 3 daughters: Chantal, Sylvie, and Lydie, who are all still her responsibility. She lives with her children in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, in the Missessin district.

For 15 years, Jeanne has been selling cosmetics, fruit, and cocoyams. For 3 years, Jeanne has been taking out loans at ALIDé and has always correctly reimbursed them. She is requesting another loan from ALIDé to use to develop her business further so that she can do better by her children.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of body milks, toilet soaps, sacks of fruit and cocoyams

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 47 years old and is married with a child. She sells gravel and sand. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sand and gravel to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Adjolloh Amessika

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’avepozo qui est un quartier au sud de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’oignons. Elle est la seule à exercer ce genre d’activité dans son quartier ce qui est très bénéfique pour elle, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et s’approvisionne au nord du togo. Son stock actuel a diminué, raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse  à WAGES pour solliciter  un crédit afin d’acheter 18 sacs d’oignons.
Elle est mariée et mère de  02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Avepozo neighborhood, a district south of the city of Lomé. She sells onions. She is the only one to be in this kind of business in her neighborhood, which is very helpful for her undertaking. She has been in business since 2002 and she buys her inventory in the north of Togo. Her present stock is diminished, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to use to buy 18 sacks of onions.

She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of onions

loans.name: Bisoleha

texts.ru: Хабибуллоева Бисолеха- женщина которая кредитуется в Микроинвесте второй год. Кредит использует на расширение бизнеса  торговли женской одежды. Товар ей привозит её муж с Бишкека на своей машине. Поэтому Бисолеха экономит на транспортных расходах. Бисолеха получив очередной займ хочет привезти товары весеннего ассортимента. Бисолеха на месте бизнеса во время торговли.
texts.en:
Bisoleha H. is a woman who has been taking out loans at MicroInvest for the second year. She uses the loans to expand her women's clothing retail business. Her husband brings the merchandise on his own car from Bishkek. This is why Bisoleha saves on her travel expenses. Bisoleha wants to use her next loan to bring in the merchandise for the spring season. On the photo, Bisoleha is at her retail business location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spring assortment of clothing

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 28 years old and is single with no children. He has a poultry business where he rears poultry. He hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Choukouratou Olanikè

texts.fr:
O.  Choukouratou Olanikè est née le 16/06/1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Choukouratou Olanikè est mariée à AGBOTI Mathias un soudeur de profession. Choukouratou Olanikè est mère d’un enfant âgé de quinze (15) ans et en quatrième année du lycée. Choukouratou Olanikè est dans le secteur de la téléphonie depuis 2007. Choukouratou Olanikè a une cabine téléphonique et vend des services téléphoniques, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, des divers (bombons, biscuits, pâtes dentifrices, détergents, boîtes de laits, etc.) ainsi que des chaussures à  la place publique LENINE de Cotonou. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire croître ses activités Choukouratou Olanikè sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
O. Choukouratou Olanikè was born on June 16, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Choukouratou Olanikè is married to Agboti Mathias, who is a trained welder. She is the mother of a child of 15 who is in the fourth year of the lycée (high school).

Choukouratou Olanikè has been in the telephone sector since 2007. She has a phone booth and sells telephone services, rechargeable phone cards, various small items (candy, cookies, toothpaste, detergent, tins of milk, etc.) as well as shoes, in the Lenin public square in Cotonou. In order to do all she can to respond to the demand from her clientele and grow her business, she is presently requesting her third loan from ALIDé.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of phone use cards, 2 cases of cookies, 5 boxes of candy, and a case of toothpaste

loans.name: Tuhtaboy

texts.ru: Неъматов Тухтабой пожилой человек , который занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Его точка торговли расположена на рынке «Фаровон» г.Гафурова. Он кредитуется с 2007 года для расширения своего бизнеса. Товар ему привозят его дети, не хотят загружать отца тяжёлой работой. Тухтабой хотя и в возрасте, но очень энергичный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Его устраивают все условия Фонда, поэтому Тухтабой, решил получить повторно кредит для завоза товара.
texts.en:
Tuhtaboy N. is an elderly man who sells household goods. His vendor location is on Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. He has been taking out loans since 2007 to expand his business. His children bring in the merchandise and do not want to their father do all the hard work. Even Tuhtaboy is in his old age, but he is very energetic and hardworking man. He is very happy with all the terms of the fund and has decided to repeat the loan term to buy merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of spare parts

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Jitahidi group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell so as to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rehema is 23 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kazija

texts.en:
Kazija has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Tushikamane  group loan (Group code 2002).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50. She works 8 hours every day at her business.   


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items to add her current stock and expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Kazija is 49 years old, and she is married.

loans.use: To buy more items to add her current stock

loans.name: Манзура

texts.ru: Абдурахмонова Манзура- женщина 36 лет,  мать одного ребёнка. Имеет высшее образование и сейчас по своей специальности работает учительницей физики , старших классов. Из-за не хватки её заработной платы Манзура также имеет доход на жизнь со своего бизнеса, шитья на дому женских платьев. Для чего и кредитуется уже третий год. Свой кредит она использует на приобретения нитей, материи и различных нужных для шитья проборов( пуговиц, клеевого материала, подплечек и.т.п)
texts.en:
Abdurahmonova Manzura is a 36 year old woman; she is the mother of one child. She has a college education and right now works in her profession as a high school physics teacher. Because her salary is not enough, Manzura also has an income from her business – sewing women’s dresses at home. She has been a borrower for this for the third year now. She uses her credit to purchase thread, fabric and different items needed for sewing (buttons, sticky material, shoulder pads, etc.).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing women's dresses

loans.name: Mith's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in Ratanak Commune in Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Mith S., is 32 years old and a local fruit seller. She usually goes to buy different kinds of fruit in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them at a local market near her house. She is married to Mao Sin, 42, who buys motorcycles from people in rural areas, then cleans them up in his home and resells them.

This humble couple generates a daily income of approximately $6 per day to meet their family's needs and especially to make sure their one child gets a good education. Mith S. is running her investment smoothly.  In order to make the business more successful,  Mith S. would like a loan for capital to buy more fruit. The other four borrowers are:

C., who is looking for a loan to increase her ability to sell grocery items.

K., who is a staff member of Christian Association and is seeking a loan to repair her old house.

S.,  a local perfume seller who would like to buy additional perfume to sell.

S., who sells roasted eggs, and is looking to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase sales of fruit, groceries, perfume, roasted eggs

loans.name: Velikhan

texts.en: Velikhan M. is a 46-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves since he was young, thanks to his father's instruction. He raises calves and sells them for meat production. He also has his own land where he cultivates fodder and wheat. Velikhan is married and has one adorable daughter. Velikhan has applied for a $1200 US loan in order to purchase two more calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 35 years old.  She is married with 8 children. She sells palm oil, and is seeking a loan of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme  a perdu son mari et a depuis à sa charge ses 05 enfants. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la petite ville d’AMOU-BLO parce que dans cette ville le sac de charbon de bois est moins coûteux. Son stock actuel de charbons de bois a diminué, pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This lady lost her husband and is the sole breadwinner for her 5 children. Her business is selling charcoal. She stocks up in the countryside in the little town of AMOU-BLO because in that town, a sack of charcoal is less expensive. Her present stock of charcoal is low, so in order to stock up, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru:
Махмудова Мавчуда кредитор Фонда с 2004 года. Она использует каждый свой займ на расширение своего бизнеса. Её бизнес- это продажа швейных машин и  плащей.
Сама Мавчуда проживает в Костакозе, а торгует на рынке «Сомон» города Худжанда. Поставщики Мавчуды должны привести хорошие качественные швейные машинки, за которые Мавчуда должна заплатить. Поэтому Она решила в кредит закупить их. А потом подороже продать в розницу с наценкой. Мавуда благодарит инвесторов за своевременное финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavchuda M. has been a MicroInvest loan customer since 2004. She has used each loan for business expansion. She sells sewing machines and coats. Mavchuda lives in Kostakoz, but works at the Somon market in the city of Khujand. Mavchuda's suppliers provide high-quality sewing machines for which she must pay, so she has decided to take out a loan to purchase them to then markup and sell retail. Mavchuda is grateful to the investors for the timely financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing Machine

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.ru: Кузиева Гулхумор проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Гулхумор имеет свою пирожочную, которая находится на рынке. Ее муж тоже работает на рынке, а старший сын подрабатывает в России. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Клиентка хочет получить у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот. Т.к. у нее очень много клиентов.
texts.en:
Gulhumor K. lives in Gissar. She is 44 years old and is married with 3 children. Gulhumor has a pastry shop at the market. Her husband also works at the market, and their elder son works in Russia. Gulhumor has been selling pastry for over 15 years. She has many clients and she is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is a tomato seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwanahamis is 36 years old, married, and has a 16-year-old child. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Kuvandik

texts.ru:
Кувандик – кредитор в Микроинвест с 2004 года. Кредит берёт на поддержку своего основного бизнеса, окорма и продажа скота. За пять лет кредитной истории он ни разу не нарушил условий Фонда, и благодарен за сотрудничество. Потому что смог расширить свой бизнес, увеличив количество скота ( коз) и улучшив проживание семьи.
Следующий кредит хочет использовать для ремонта своего хлева, где находится его скот в дождливые дни. А в другие солнечные благополучные дни они пасутся на пастбищах вблизи гор и питаются зелёной целебной травой .
texts.en:
Kuvandik has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2004. He has taken out loans to support basic business operations: livestock fattening and sale. During the five years of his credit history, he has never broken any part of the credit agreement. He is grateful for the assistance. Because of it, he has been able to expand the business, increasing his number of goats, and has improved his family’s standard of living. He would like to use his next loan to repair the shed where he keeps his livestock on rainy days. On sunny days, they are grazed in pastures near the mountains and eat wholesome green grass.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Nuru Njema Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a tomatoes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 14, 12 and 10.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwatima, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with four children and she is 36 years old. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 48 years old and married with 4 children. He has a restaurant where he sells cooked food and drinks. He is seeking a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more food and drinks.

He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Домуллочонова Манзура – кредитор в Микроинвест с 2008 года, уже два кредита хорошо закончила и хочет получить следующий. Кредиты получает для увеличения своего бизнеса- продажи овощей, на овощном  рынке Худжанда.
Муж Манзуры помогает ей по завозу товара, т.к. после операции Манзуре нельзя поднимать груз свыше трёх килограмм. Но торговля у неё всегда кипит , т.к. у неё много своих постоянных оптовых клиентов.
texts.en:
Manzura D., who has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2008, already has successfully paid off two loans and wants to take out another. She takes out loans to expand her business: selling vegetables in the Khujand vegetable market Manzura’s husband helps her deliver the goods, since after an operation she has been unable to lift more than three kilograms. Her sales are always brisk since she has many loyal wholesale customers.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Хасанова Гулнора- женщина , которая  занимается продажей моркови и картофеля.Она хочет получив кредит закупить крупную партию моркови по оптовой цене и продать в розницу. Гулнора  смогла ценаправлено и удачно использовать кредиты и расширить бизнес. Гулнора благодарна Фонду, за предоставившую возможность в кредит, расширить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Gulnora H. is a woman who sells carrots and potatoes. She wants to take out a loan to make the wholesale purchase of a large lot of carrots to then sell retail. Gulnora has been able to successfully use financing to expand her business. Gulnora is grateful to MicroInvest for the presenting the opportunity for financing to increase her turnover.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetable sales

loans.name: Abla's Group

texts.fr: Cette  association  a été crée en  1999 par  3 femmes mariées toutes dynamiques, l’une d’entre elles fait comme activité le commerce de céréales, les 2 autres vendent des produits d’alimentation générale. Le revenu issu de leur activité leur permet de réaliser des œuvres sociales et d’aider beaucoup de femmes de leur quartier. Elles veulent agrandir leurs activités pour mieux vendre et réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle sollicite alors de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter, des céréales et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This association was created in 1999 by three energetic married women. One of them sells cereals; the two others sell groceries. The income from their businesses permits them to take on charitable work and to help lots of women from their neighborhood. They want to expand their activities so as to make more sales and thus more profit. They are asking WAGES for their first loan to buy cereals and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of items for resale

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma Nancy R., the 31-year old mother of one child, started selling goods in 2002.  Her sari-sari store (convenience store) had its ups and downs, so she joined the CEVI credit program in 1998. 

"For long years I was able to manage it wisely because it is where I get the money for our daily needs," says Ma. Nancy.  "Before, I was working in a private company. But because my employer paid less compensation to all his staff, I decided to quit and put up a small store."

Ma. Nancy is seeking a loan of Php 25,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. "The loan will do a lot of things to win more customers. With my loan, my business could compete well with other stores," she said.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. Ma. Nancy receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage, as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
A. Antoinette est née le 26/10/1956 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Antoinette est divorcée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés respectivement âgés de 28 ans et 25 ans. Antoinette réside au quartier Akpakpa, un quartier populaire de Cotonou. Antoinette vend des services téléphoniques, des cartes de recharge téléphonique ainsi que des divers(Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) depuis cinq ans. Grâce à son activité Antoinette arrive à satisfaire ses propres besoins et arrive aussi à répondre partiellement aux besoins de ses enfants. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Antoinette sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Antoinette was born on October 26, 1956 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Antoinette is divorced and the mother of two children, ages 28 and 25. Antoinette lives in Akpakpa neighborhood, a populous neighborhood in Cotonou.

Antoinette has been selling telephone services, rechargeable telephone cards, and various items (candy, cookies, tins of milk, sardines and tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap, and toilet soap, etc.) for 5 years.

Thanks to her business, Antoinette manages to support herself and partially support her children as well. Antoinette has already had two loans from ALIDé to bolster her working capital. Antoinette is requesting her third loan from ALIDé so that she can better respond to the demand from her clientele.

The signification of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average yearly income stands at US$ 1,500 per inhabitant per year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable telephone cards, 5 cases of cookies, 7 boxes of candy, and three cartons of toothpaste

loans.name: Mirzobahodur

texts.ru: Рофиев Мирзобаходур парень- студент пятого курса ВУЗа города Худжанда, заочного отделения. Мирзобаходур имеет свой доход с купли продажи мобильных телефонов. Он покупает рабочие исправные телефоны и отремонтировав их перепродаёт с наценкой. У него место деятельности находится на рынке Худжанда, он арендует маленький ларёк где ведёт свою работу.
texts.en:
Mirzobahodur R. is a young man who is a fifth-year student in the distance learning program at an institution of higher learning in the city of Khujand. Mirzobahodur has his own income from buying and selling mobile phones. He purchases working phones in good repair and, once they have been refurbished, resells them at a markup. His sales outlet is located at the Khujand market, where he rents a small stall to conduct his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Telephone sales

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 49 years old and she is married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colours. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $70. She works at her business for eight hours a day. Aisha is 38 years old, married, and has two children: ages 15 and 12.

Aisha is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use. She belongs to Hatuyumbishwi Group loan (Group code 2025).

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Iklim

texts.ru: Иклим Исматова проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Иклим имеет самбусочную на рынке "Корвон". Она продает самбусу, пирожки, кофе и т.д. Этим видом бизнеса занимется более 7 лет. Муж работает проводником на поезде "Душанбе-Москва". Клиентка хочет взять кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот. На полученный доход хочет дать детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Iklim I. lives in the vicinity of Gissar. She is 27 years old and is married with 3 children. Iklim has a sambusa shop at the Korvon market. She sells sambusa, pies, coffee, etc. She has been doing it for over 7 years. Her husband is an attendant in the train Dushanbe - Moscow. Iklim would like to use her loan for increasing cash flow and using the profit for providing her children with good education.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with four children. She is 48 years old. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more goods. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Маджидов Ином – кредитор в Микроинвест с  2007 года. Он занимается продажей женской и мужской одеждой. Ином ездит за товаром сам в Истаравшан. Для завоза весеннего ассортимента одежды он хочет получить кредит. Ином ни разу не нарушил условия Фонда и доволен ими. На снимке Ином в День подачи заявки.Как говорит Ином его прибыльные дни торговли в основном это выходные дни,воскресные базары. За три года кредитования у него улучшилась жизнь семьи и увеличился товарооборот.
texts.en:
Inom M. has been a loan customer of MicroInvest since 2007. He sells men and women's clothing, and goes himself on buying trips to Istaravshan. He wants to take out a loan to bring in an assortment of clothing for spring. Inom has always abided by MicroInvest's terms and is a customer in good standing. He is pictured on the day he applied for his loan. According to Inom, the most lucrative sales days generally has on the weekends, at the market on Sundays. In three years as a loan client, his family's standard of living has improved and his turnover has increased.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of men and women's clothing

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Mrs. Erlinda B., of legal age, is married and the mother of seven children. She is a resident of Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her primary source of income is backyard gardening of corn, different root crops and vegetables. She also has a sari-sari store in her home and she sells fish. She is now requesting her sixth loan from Paglaum intended to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
"Since 1999, I have been doing a lot of selling goods to earn income for my family. I sell food to my neighbors and in the street to be able to help contribute in the family income.The income that I get from selling is mainly what I use to buy our family needs," says Rabina L., a 34-year-old mother of four children. She would like a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her sari-sari store. The loan will really help her attract more customers and earn better income.

CEVI provides more than just loans. Trainings and insurance coverage are provided as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Джумаева Фарогат – кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года. Она работает техничкой в областной больнице. Кроме своей работы она занимается продажей нижнего женского белья. Получив очередной кредит, она планирует съездить за товаром в Истаравшан на оптовый рынок. Фарогат смогла использовать кредиты, благодаря чему у неё расширился товарооборот. На снимке Фарогат  в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Farogat J. has been a loan customer of MicroInvest since 2007. She works as a cleaning woman at the regional hospital, and sells ladies lingerie on the side. Since she has received her next loan, she plans to make a buying trip to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Thanks to the use of credit, Farogat has been able to increase her turnover. She is pictured on the day her loan was dispersed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of ladies lingerie

loans.name: Sharef Group

texts.en:
Sharef, the leader of this group, requests a loan for her business selling wood. Pray Khanum wants to take a loan for her husband who has a smithy shop. Lateafa wants to take a loan for a car part shop. Basera wants a loan for a bakery. 
There are four members in this group. They are applying for a loan of 48,000 afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders that provide support across the world.

loans.use: For expanding wood selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bolster her little business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita V. is 60 years old. She is still selling wine to support her self as well as her two children who are already married. She wants to grow her business even more. She needs additional capital to be able to display more tuba (palm wine) in her house. Tuba is a type of wine that is produced from coconut plants. People in her village know her very well for her tuba business. She would like a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional tuba wine to sell.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI gives credit assistance as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy additional "tuba" (palm wine)

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
A. Florence née le 25/01/1986 dans le Département du MONO. Florence est célibataire sans enfants. Depuis cinq (5) ans Florence vend de produits vivriers (haricot, maïs, mil, sorgho, farine de manioc.). Florence exerçait cette activité avec sa mère après son abandon de l’école. C’est dans les villages du Bénin, en dehors de Cotonou que Florence achète ses produits vivriers auprès des paysans. Depuis quatre ans Florence fait de prêts à ALIDé et respecte toujours ses engagements de remboursement. Florence a pu développer son activité grâce aux différents prêts qu’elle a eu de ALIDé.  Pour satisfaire sa clientèle sans cesse croissante, Florence sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Florence was born on January 25, 1986 in the County of MONO. Florence is single and has no children. For 5 years, Florence has been selling foodstuffs (beans, maize, millet, sorghum, and manioc flour). Florence worked at this same business, together with her mother, after leaving school. She buys her merchandise from rural people in the villages of Benin, outside of Cotonou.

For 4 years, Florence has been taking out loans from ALIDé and always respects the terms of her repayment schedule. She has been able to develop her business thanks to the various loans she has received from ALIDé. In order to satisfy the needs of her ever-increasing clientele, Florence is now requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé.

The signification of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average yearly income stands at US$ 1,500 per inhabitant per year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of 50 kg of dried beans, 15 sacks of 50 kg of maize, and two sacks 0f 50 kg of sorghum

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 39 years old and married with 3 children. He sells VCDs and electronics. He hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy is 33 years old and is married with children. He sells bags of cement to make a living. He hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Rasheeda M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
My name is Rasheeda and I have lived in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats. My husband's name is M. A.. He has a  business selling construction supplies. He has been in this business for the last 6 years. I am a mother of three sons; all of them are currently in school and getting an education. I belong to a decorative embroidery business. I prepare embroidery dresses on order which I collect from the cloth market. To make one dress takes me 1 month and I earn a good income from this work. I use my income to pay off the school fees of my kids and fulfill their basic needs. I am applying for a loan to expand my husband’s construction supply business.

I am the group leader of three other women from my locality. Majidan baji and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy embroidery materials (colored thread, cloth and beads). Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit- selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Phou's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phou K., 39, was selected as the team leader by the other two members of the group. Phou K. currently sells snack cakes from a hand-cart that she transports around her village. She is able to make an income around of $3 each day to support her family's daily expenses. She is divorced but has no child so she lives alone in a medium-size house. Phou K. noticed that selling beef is a profitable business and is a good idea to invest in; thus, she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to be used as capital to begin selling beef in the local market. The other two borrowers are Un R. and Khun N.. Un R. is a used goods seller who looking for a loan to buy more used goods to sell. Khun N. sells breakfast foods for neighbors and is applying for a loan to start a new business as a hairdresser.

loans.use: To order beef to begin selling in the local market

loans.name: Razia Bashir Masih Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a very devoted and hardworking lady. She sews embroidery dresses to earn income, because her husband’s income is insufficient and it is difficult to manage the house expenses. 

Razia baji takes orders from clothing shops. Her two daughters also help her by preparing the embroidery clothing. She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and sketches) to increase the profit of her business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (beads and colored thread). Ayesha siddiqan baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery business

loans.name: Abraham

texts.fr: Abraham S. est un jeune qui exploit un taxi clando sur la ligne Ziguinchor-Cap Skiring. Avec la saison touristique il arrive à faire de bonnes affaires. Avec son taxi il soutient sa famille restée au village. Il demande un crédit pour relooker son véhicule et offrir des servicves de qualité à sa clientéle.
texts.en:
Abraham S. is a young man who has an independent taxi run on the Ziguinchor-Cap Skiring line. In the tourist season, he manages to do quite well. With his taxi, he supports the members of his family who stayed in the village. He is asking for a loan to overhaul his vehicle so as to offer quality service to his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: overhauling his vehicle

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye N., 47 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus et de café. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ndèye N., age 47, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling cloth and coffee. She wants to bolster her commerce to do better in supporting her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and coffee

loans.name: Azra M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Azra baji is a very supportive and hardworking lady. Her husband operates a Punjabi food selling business and she helps him by making the Punjabi food. They have both lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Her husband has a good number of customers because he sells good quality food. He specifically sells the Punjabi food samosas, which is famous to all people and Azra baji is happy to prepare them. She is applying for a loan to buy materials like potatoes, cooking oil, spices and flour with the aim to increase the profit of her husband’s business.

Azra baji is the leader of a group of five other women from her locality. Razia baji and Shahnaz baji want loans to buy materials like colored thread and beads for their embroidery businesses. Naseem begum baji wants a loan to buy potatoes, cooking oil, spices and flour for her Punjabi food (samosas) business. Amna baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The money will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for Punjabi food business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda C. is supporting her husband financially through her small variety store. In addition, she peddles food which she has manually processed. Though these businesses are small, Hilda is confident that her efforts help a lot in meeting their daily expenses. She is 34 years of age and the mother of three children. They presently live in Purok 1-B Del Carmen Iligan City. She wants to make more money from these businesses, therefore she is requesting additional capital of 5,000 PHP for business expansion.

loans.use: To puchase stock for a variety store and ingredients for a food processing business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Sairanbi

texts.en:
Sairanbi is the widowed mother of two children. Her women’s shoes sales have been a valuable source of income for her family over the past four years since she’s been in business. In a typical month, Sairanbi makes about $400 in profit. Sairanbi is a hardworking, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has a good attitude and loves being able to help women with their shoe needs. Sairanbi has requested a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue to develop her business and provide a good income for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
R. Nurullo is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling shoes for women at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past eight years. Business has been good for Nurullo as there is always a demand for shoes. Nurullo is a married man with four children. He is doing his best and he works hard to ensure that all his children have a good future. Nurullo has requested a loan of 10,000 somoni to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Nurullo hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
