These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna M. is an entrepreneur in her own right. She finances her business using her own capital and works hard to bring in money for the family. Myrna is married with three children--two of whom are in school. Every day Myrna has to go to the market where she has a small stall for her fish. According to her, she needs to sell 9 to 15 k of fish to have capital for the next day's business activity and to cover the family's expenses. She wants to continue to expand this business by borrowing 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: To purchase fish

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Sohelah Group

texts.en: Sohelah is the group leader of the four-member Sohelah group. All of the group members are requesting money for their businesses. Sakoko and Anesa want to take a loan for their tailoring business in order to buy three machines. Sohelah wants to take a loan for her husband’s car parts business so that he can buy materials for his shop. Hafeza wants to take a loan for her brother’s general store business so that he can enlarge his shop. With this loan, the group members can improve their businesses and support their families, thus making a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy materials for car parts shop

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra B. is a working mother. At 47, she manages to take care of the household chores and uses her cooking skill to bring income to help her husband provide their daily needs. Sandra is very much aware that with her 7 children, 6 of whom are in school, she needs to budget carefully to be able to cover educational expenses, household expenses, medication and savings. She wants to increase her profits therefore she needs additional capital of PHP 5,000 from the HSPFI micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase pork meat and other ingredients for her homemade longganisa

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou D. 41 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 03 ans et demi. Son activité est le commerce. Kadiatou veut s’approvisionner en riz, savon, cotol, lait et autres pour renforcer sa boutique.
texts.en:
Kadiatou D., age 41, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Sinthiang Aidara for three and a half years. Her work involves commerce. She wants to stock up on rice, soap, “cotol”, milk, and other items to enhance her shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with rice, soap, cotol, milk, and more

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is requested by three people who reside in Ocha Commune, Battambang Province. Mrs. Tin S., 51, was selected to be the group leader by the group. Tin S. is married with eight children and her husband is Mr. Khoeun, a motorbike taxi driver. Tin S. makes a living selling Khmer cakes from home. She always goes to the village market to buy sugar, pork, bananas, salt, and then mixes them, makes them into packages, and boils them. One of her children helps with her selling the cakes. Many of her clients appreciate the tasty cakes she makes. In order to meet the customer's requirements, Tin S. is applying for a loan to support her business operations, by buying necessary ingredients to make the cakes to sell. The other two borrowers are P. and S. Y.. 
P. is a cake seller who is requesting a loan to expand the size of her business.
S. Y. sells cooked ingredients from home and is applying for a loan to buy additional items to sell.

loans.use: To support her business operations

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina E. is 51 years old  and a mother of 5 children. She lives in Del Carmen Iligan City.
She has a small variety store in their village that she has operated for a long time. This store helps them a lot in paying for their daily needs, and supports her husband financially. She needs to expand her business to cater to the customer's needs and to compete well in the market. Therefore she is requesting her first loan of PHP 5, 000 from the HSPFI - KIVA  field partner.

loans.use: additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine C. is single and 40 years old. All her life all she wanted was to work to support her parents and her family. She is happy because although she doesn't have a family of her own, her work paid off from seeing her family happy from the financial support she offered to them. Her variety store is why she was able to give her help to them. Therefore she plans to expand her business. Additional capital from HSPFI will be a great help for the business to continue to do well in the market. She is applying for PHP 5,000, her first loan.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her variety store

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Mariama Birame

texts.fr: Mariama Birame D. 61 ans est mariée avec 10 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 06 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus teintés et de téléphone portable. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mariama Birame D., age 61, is married and has ten children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group in Sinthiang Aidara for six years. Her work involves selling dyed fabrics and mobile phones. She wants to bolster her commerce to do better in supporting her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and mobile phones

loans.name: Tal

texts.en: Tal D., 41, lives in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows both rice and vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of five children. All of them are single and are employed in different occupations. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband works as a construction worker around the community. Tal D. saw that the business of selling groceries was a profitable one, so that is why she requests a loan in order to run a store out of her home for selling grocery items.

loans.use: To run a store out of her home for selling grocery items

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
K. Monique est née vers 1978 à Lokossa dans le Département du Mono. Monique est mariée à un maçon de profession mais elle n’a pas d’enfant. Monique vend des produits vivriers (maïs, mil, sorgho, arachide, haricot, farine de manioc et de causette d’igname) au grand marché international du Bénin (Dantokpa) à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Monique vient en aide à son mari dans les charges du ménage. Monique a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Monique sollicite de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Monique was born around 1978 in Lokossa, in Mono County. She is married to a professional mason, but she doesn’t have any children. She sells staple foods (corn, millet, sorghum, peanuts, beans, cassava flour, and yam chips) at the international grand market of Benin (Dantokpa) in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Thanks to the revenues from her business, Monique is helping her husband with household expenses. She has already been the recipient of four loans with Alidé for developing her business. To bolster her working capital and to increase her business volume, so as to do better in satisfying her customers, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 25 sacks of corn, a sack of beans, a sack of sesame, a sack of peanuts, and two sacks of sorghum

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
K. Blandine est âgée de trente quatre (34) ans; elle est née à Lokossa dans le Département du Mono. Blandine est mariée à un Conducteur de taxi ville. Blandine vend des produits vivriers (maïs, mil, sorgho, arachide, haricot, farine de manioc et de causette d’igname) au grand marché international du Bénin (Dantokpa) à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Blandine aide énormément son mari dans les charges du ménage. Blandine finance également les études de ses frères et sœurs toujours grâce au revenu de son activité. Blandine a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Blandine sollicite de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Blandine is 34 years old and was born in Lokossa, in Mono County. She is married to a city taxi driver. She sells staple foods (corn, millet, sorghum, peanuts, beans, cassava flour, and yam chips) at the grand international market of Benin (Dantokpa) in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Thanks to the revenues from her business, she is helping her husband enormously with household expenses. She is also financing the schooling for her brothers and sisters, again, thanks to those revenues. Blandine has already been the recipient of four loans with Alidé for developing her business. To bolster her working capital and to increase her business volume, so as to do better in satisfying her customers, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of beans, and a sack of peanuts

loans.name: Saimuhammad

texts.en:
T. Saimuhammad is a young guy with a great optimistic character. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard to find a job and he thus started his own business of selling men's shoes to support his parents with family expenses. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Saimuhammad now needs a 10 000 Somoni loan which he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demands. Saimuhammad is very thankful to you to help him improve his service and the quality of life of his family.   

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new shoes for summer season sales

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna A., 42, is a married mother of two children and is a resident of Pigsag-an Cagayan de Oro City. She is engaged in food-snack vending business. She peddles food and snacks in her village. She also lends small amounts of money with 10-15% interest to her established customers. She is happy because although the money lent is small, it helps her co-villagers during emergencies. She wants to pursue her food-vending business and requires additional capital; therefore she is applying to HSPFI for her third loan of PHP 11,000.

loans.use: additional capital for her food-snack business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn D. is a mother of two children and lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro city. Her husband works as a gold miner using the traditional way of mining. She manages a variety store to support her husband financially. Every week she purchases additional grocery items. She needs on an average PHP 4000 to buy all the items that her store needs. Genalyn is determined to do this business as it brings extra income for the family. She is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ahmadbek

texts.en:
K. Ahmadbek is 44 years old, married, and has two children. He grows wheat and potato and sells them in the market for income. He has been in the farming business for almost six years and has gained much experience. Ahmadbek has a large family which includes his parents. He works almost everyday to generate revenue to support his family's needs. As his family relies on his crop, Ahmadbek needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest. This will be his first loan with IMON International and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr:
D.  Anne-Marie est née le 26/07/1967 à Ouidah, une des villes historiques et touristique du BENIN. Anne-Marie est mariée à ANGO Justin employé à la Société Béninoise de la Brasserie. Anne-Marie et Justin ont cinq (5) enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anne-Marie et sa famille vit au quartier Enagnon, un quartier peuplé de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Depuis plus de dix (10)ans, Anne-Marie vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.), des liqueurs et des produits vivriers (haricot, riz, mil, maïs et les farines de manioc et de causette d’igame). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Anne-Marie s’approvisionne en ses différents articles. Anne-Marie a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne-Marie sollicite de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Anne-Marie was born on July 26, 1967 in Ouidah, one of the historic and tourist cities of Benin. She is married to ANGO Justin, an employee at the Société Béninoise de la Brasserie. Anne-Marie and Justin have five children, all in school. She and her family live in Enagnon, a populated district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For over ten years, Anne-Marie has been selling various goods: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soap (for the laundry, dishes, and bath), liquors, and staple foods (beans, rice, millet, corn, cassava flour, and yam chips). There, in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, she stocks up on these different items. Anne-Marie has already been the recipient of four loans with Alidé for developing her business. To bolster her working capital and to increase her business volume, so as to do better in satisfying her customers, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of canned milk, a box of powdered milk, a box of sugar (chucks and powdered), 3 boxes of soap for the laundry and the bath, 2 boxes of canned tomatoes, a half-box of sardines, a dozen hair straighteners, a dozen shampoos, 2 sacks of rice, 50 kg of beans, five 50-kg sacks of corn, a 50-kg sack of cassava flour, and 2 boxes of liquor.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en: A. Abdurashid was born in 1960 in Shahristan, Tajikistan where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has four children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Abdurashid owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of $1500 to buy seed and fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Abdurashid’s income and his family's living standard. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
N. Justine est née le 13/05/1968 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Justine est veuve et mère d’un enfant. Depuis le décès de son mari, Justine vit dans sa maison paternelle à Ayélawadjè, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou,Capitale Économique du Bénin. Justine vend des tissus chez elle à domicile. Justine a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs crédits de ALIDé pour faire son commerce de tissus. Mais Justine a besoin encore de fonds pour augmenter le volume de son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
N. Justine was born on May 13, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow and mother of a child. Since her husband’s death, she has been living in her father’s house in Ayélawadjè, a district of the city of Cotonou. Justine sells cloth out of her home. She has already been the recipient of several Alidé loans for doing commerce in cloth. But she still has a need for funding to increase her business volume and to respond better to the demands of her customers. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five bolts of Hitarget cloth (25 meters each), three bolts of Wax cloth (12 meters each), and a few bolts of Phoenix cloth .

loans.name: Rahmatilla

texts.en: Rahmatilla is 27 years old and he is the father of three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she supports him in everything he does. Rahmatilla is a hard working person and he has been providing taxi services for more than 5 years. The most important thing to him is that his children finish school so that they may have a bright future. Rahmatilla wishes to keep his taxi business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work Rahmatilla has been able to stabilize his quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy G. is a 53-year-old mother, widowed and blessed with four children. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Mercy's business has existed for almost a year now and it’s getting better. But due to the demands of her customers, she wanted to have more items in her store. To be able to support this, she wanted to obtain a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 11,000 to purchase grocery items.

This will be a great help for the family to earn more income especially since she is the only one who earns money for the family. Sometimes, her son helps her to earn money by planting bananas and the fruit is sold through peddling in their neighborhood and nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her sari-sari store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr:
B. Honorine est née le 23/07/1947 à ALLADA, dans le Département de l’Atlantique. Honorine est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Depuis huit (8) ans Honorine vit chez sa fille à Sènadé, un quartier de  la Commune Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Honorine vend des tissus depuis vingt deux (22) ans à domicile. Honorine a vu son activité accroître avec le premier crédit qu’elle a eu de ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité Honorine sollicite un deuxième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
B. Honorine was born on July 23, 1947 in ALLADA, in Atlantique County. She is a widow and mother of three children, 2 boys and a girl. For eight years, Honorine has been living with her daughter in Sènadé, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been selling cloth for 22 years at home. She has seen her business grow with the first loan she had with Alidé. To develop her business further, she’s requesting a second loan. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten bolts of Hitarget cloth (25 meters each) and some kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr:
Cette dame a appris le métier de la coiffure, après sa formation ne disposant pas de moyens pour ouvrir son atelier,elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes en 2007 , elle veut associé à ce commerce la vente produits cosmétiques et aussi agrandir son stock de pagnes raison pour laquelle elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 04 cartons de mèches, des produits cosmétiques et 5 pièces de pagnes de haute qualité.
Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant.
texts.en:
This is a lady who learned the trade of hairdressing. After her training, she lacked the means to open her own salon. She therefore got started in 2007 in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She wants to include commerce in cosmetics and also to expand her stock of pagnes. For these reasons, she’s asking WAGES for her first loan to buy four boxes of hair extensions, some cosmetic products, and five bolts of high quality pagnes. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cloth for resale

loans.name: Urbina

texts.en:
Urbina C., 35 years old, is married and blessed with eight children. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. One of her children is married and two are in school. She is separated from her first husband who left her with two children. Currently, her second husband works in their village as a gold miner using the traditional system of mining gold. Sometimes, he works as a construction worker in the city. 

Urbina runs a sari-sari (variety) store. Sometimes, she sells banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) selling them through peddling. Most of her customers are her neighbors and the gold miners working in their village.

Currently, business is good but her income is not sufficient to provide for the needs of her family. She wanted to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 14,000 to purchase additional grocery items for her store. This will be a great help for the family to generate a higher income and Urbina will be able send her children to school and give the family a comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
M. Yvette est née en 1957 à Guézin. Yvette  est veuve et mère d’une fille. Yvette vit à Irédé, un quartier de la Commune de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Avant la mort de son mari, Yvette vendait les produits vivriers. Mais depuis dix (10) ans, Yvette vend des  tissus et de l’huile de palme. C’est de façon ambulante que Yvette vend ses produits. Yvette se promène de quartier en quartier pour proposer ses produits. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Yvette achète ses produits. Yvette a déjà eu un crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de commerce. Yvette a bien remboursé ce crédit. Yvette demande aujourd’hui un deuxième prêt pour mieux développer son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
M. Yvette was born in 1957 in Guézin. She is a widow and the mother of a girl. She lives in Irédé, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Before her husband’s death, Yvette used to sell staple goods. But for ten years, she has been selling cloth and palm oil. She is an itinerant seller, walking from district to district to offer her goods. There, in Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, she acquires her merchandise. She has already had an Alidé loan. She’s now asking for a second loan to develop her business further. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 7 bolts of Hitarget cloth (12 meters each) and 50 liters of palm oil

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 39 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been working as an electrician for twenty five years.

Tarek requested a loan of $3,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his children's school tuition. This is the first time that Tarek has requested a loan.

Tarek is special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Tarek decided on his business because of his experience and he also wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and pay for his children's school tuition

loans.name: Mahougnon

texts.fr:
H. Mahougnon est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Mahougnon est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Depuis le décès de son mari Mahougnon vit à Sodjéatinmè dans sa maison paternelle avec sa belle fille. Mahougnon vend de boissons alcoolisées localement produites et des ustensiles de cuisines. Mahougnon a déjà eu un crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de commerce. Mahougnon a bien remboursé ce crédit. Mahougnon demande aujourd’hui un deuxième prêt pour mieux développer son activité. 
                      
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Mahougnon was born around 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow and the mother of three children, 2 boys and a girl. Since her husband died, she has been living in Sodjéatinmè in her father’s house with her daughter-in-law. Mahougnon sells locally produced alcoholic drinks and some kitchen utensils. She has already had an Alidé loan for boosting her working capital, and she has repaid it. She’s now asking for a second loan to develop her business further. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four 50-liter drums of a local beverage called sodabi and three dozen basins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky A., a 36-year-old mother of four children, lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. Her husband works as a farmer on their own small parcel of land, growing a variety of bananas, while Vicky operates a variety store that sells goods such as sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, etc.

She is now requesting a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) of Php 11,000.00 to purchase additional items for her business. With this money, she will be able to meet customer demand and generate a higher income that will provide the family with a more comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a très tôt abandonné les études, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins, il a ouvert en 2007 sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait le commerce de produits congelés. Il réalise de grosses recettes. La majorité de ses clients sont des propriétaires de restaurant, de cafétéria.  Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, il s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un premier crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de poulets congelés, 07 cartons de cuisses de pintades, 10 cartons de poissons.
texts.en:
This gentleman abandoned his studies early on to support himself. In 2007 he opened his own shop in which he sells frozen foods. He makes a lot of sales. The majority of his customers are restaurant or cafeteria owners. His present stock does not permit him to satisfy the needs of his clientele, so he has come to WAGES to request a first-ever loan to buy 2 cartons of frozen chickens, 7 cartons of Guinea fowl thighs, and 10 cases of fish.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of frozen foods for resale

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Cette femme habite dans le quartier de Tokoin Soted qui est un quartier au centre de la ville de lomé.  Elle est divorcée de son mari et vit seule avec ses 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pains en gros et en détail, elle s’approvisionne dans une grande  boulangerie de la ville de Lomé. Voulant rehausser son stock elle sollicite auprès de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 120 pains.
C’est avec le revenu issu de ce commerce qu’il subvient aux besoins de ses 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady lives in Tokoin Soted district, which is an area in downtown Lomé. She is divorced from her husband and lives alone with her three children. She sells bread wholesale and retail, stocking up in a big bakery in the city of Lomé. Wishing to increase her stocks, she is asking WAGES for her first-ever loan to buy 120 loaves of bread.

The income from this business permits her to support her three children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of loaves of bread for resale

loans.name: Orzubek

texts.ru: Сангов Орзубек житель района Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем частного такси. Автомобиль собственный, поэтому ремонт придется делать за свой счет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти.
texts.en:
Orzubek S. lives in Gissar. He is 35 years old and is married with 3 children. He has a high school diploma and works as a taxi driver. He uses his own car, which he has to repair at his own cost. He is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Maqsuda

texts.ru: Мухтарамова Максуда проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 44 года, разведена. Одна воспитывает своих детей. Старший сын учиться в ТПУ - Таджикский Педагогический Университет.Сама Максуда работает в ателье. Шьет платья на заказ. Для расширения деятельности решила получить кредит для того, чтобы купить еще одну швейную машинку и закупить ткани для пошива платьев.
texts.en:
Maqsuda M. lives in Gissar. She is 44 years old and is divorced with two children. Her elder child is a student of Tajik Teacher's College. Maqsuda works in a workshop where she sews dresses. She would like to use the loan for the purchase of a sewing machine and fabric. This would allow her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Базарова Адолат проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 44 года , вдова. Одна воспитывает четверых детей.муж погиб в автокатострофе. Уже 4 года она занимается пошивом национальных платьев, ватных одеял, подушек и др. Для покупки новой более универсальной швейной машинки решила получить кредит .Это поможет ей наладить бизнес.
texts.en:
Adolat B. resides in Gissar. She is a 44-year old widow with 4 children. Her husband was killed in a car crash. For the past four years Adolat has been making a living by sewing national dresses, cotton blankets, pillows, etc. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase a better sewing machine and get the business running.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Alassane G. âgée de vingt cinq (25) ans est une commerçante au marché central de Mbour, ville touristique située à 70 km de Dakar. Elle vend des chaussures, des effets de toilette et autres objets pour femmes. Elle marié et mère de famille  est fait ce travail depuis plus de cinq (5) ans. Avec les revenus tirés de son activité, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne au même titre que son mari ainsi elle s’affranchie de la tutelle maritale. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicite est veut diversifier le type de fruits qu’elle  vend pour accroitre ses revenus et affirmer ainsi son rôle de chef de ménage.
texts.en:
Alassane G., age 25, is a merchant at the central marketplace of Mbour, a tourist city located 70 km from Dakar. She sells shoes, toiletries, and other goods for women. She is married and the mother of a family. She has been in this business for five years. With the revenues derived from her work, she helps meet day-to-day expenses just like her husband does, and thus, she frees herself from marital supervision. With this loan she's requesting, she wants to diversify the types of fruit she sells in order to increase her revenues and therefore to assert her role as head of household.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sidibé est âgé de 33 ans et père de 2 enfants.Il vit avec son épouse et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Dialanicoro de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins.
Il a tenté pendant des années différentes activités comme le commerce de vêtements pour enfants et la maçonnerie mais sans succès. C’est ainsi que depuis 4 années il mène une activité de  menuiserie bois  apprise  auprès de son ami des années durant. Il maîtrise bien cette activité et est réputé pour la qualités de ses productions.( fauteuils, chaises bourrées, tables, armoires etc) 
Pour satisfaction de sa clientèle, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 2eme prêt individuel, le  précédent ayant été correctement remboursé.
Il compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, du bois, des pointes, des tissus et des matelas pour en faire des fauteuils.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni, Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et en Guinée Conakry et effectue sa vente sur place à Bougouni.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il compte améliorer son atelier et construire une  maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Sidibé, age 33, is the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in his fathers place in the Dialanicoro district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he decided to earn an income to support himself. For years, he tried different kinds of work, such as commerce in children's clothing and masonry, though unsuccessfully. And so, for four years, he has been running a woodworking business with a friend of many years. He has a good command of his business and is well-known for the quality of his products (armchairs, stuffed chairs, tables, armoires, etc.) For his customers' satisfaction, he decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan, the preceding one having been correctly repaid. He intends to use this new loan to buy some wood, nails, fabrics, and padding to make armchairs. Supplies are gotten in Bougouni, Bamako (capital of Mali), and in Guinée Conakry. Sales are made locally in Bougouni. He hopes to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA. With the profits, he intends to improve his workshop and to build a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, cloth, nails, and cushions

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saibou Samaké est un homme  de 37 ans et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier Dougounina de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus.
Avant de mener l’activité d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques qu’il a appris auprès d’un frère, Monsieur Saibou était cultivateur au village pendant 10 ans.
Avec une expérience de 3 ans,  Saibou Samaké maîtrise bien son activité commerciale et est très réputé de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, il décida de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter des appareils électroniques (lampes, torches, radios...).
Il s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali)  et effectue sa vente sur place à Bougouni à une clientèle  composée de la population locale et des forains venant des villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Saibou Samaké compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Dans les années à venir il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Saibou Samaké, age 37, is the father of three children and lives with his wife and children in a monogamous family in the Dougounina district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he soon began working to earn a living. Before running a business buying and selling electronics that he learned from his brother, he was a village farmer for ten years. With three years of experience, he has a good command of his commercial business and is well-known by his customers, who are growing in number. In his search for supplemental financial resources, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan for buying electronics (lamps, flashlights, radios...) Supplies are gotten from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of Mali), and sales are made locally in Bougouni to customers composed of local people and fair vendors from surrounding villages. With this loan, he intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan interest payments and to provide for his family. In the years to come, he envisions expanding his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic goods

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est âgée de vingt sept ans (27) ans, elle gère  depuis un an une mercerie au niveau du marché central de Mbour. Elle a démarré son commerce avec un prêt qu’un ami  lui a accordé qu’elle a fini de rembourser  avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Pour  renforcer son fonds de commerce et maintenir sa clientèle, Fatou  sollicite un prêt de l’IMCEC. Elle est célibataire  et vive avec ses parents qu’elle aide pour la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Fatou Guey, age 27, has been managing a sewing supplies shop for a year at the central marketplace of Mbour. She started this business with a loan from a friend that she repaid with the revenues from her business. To boost her working capital and to maintain her customers, Fatou is requesting a loan from IMCEC. She is unmarried and lives with her parents, whom she helps by covering their day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Раджабова Парвина проживаетв Гиссарском районе. Возраст 32 года. Одна воспитывает двоих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию и пропал безвести. С того момента уже 4 года она работает на рынке Гиссара. Торгует одеждой. Получает прибыль в размере 700 сомони в месяц. Сейчас планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Parvina R. lives in the Gissar district. She is 32 years and is raising two children. Her husband left to earn a living in Russia and disappeared. Since that moment, almost 4 years ago, Parvina has been working at the Gissar market, selling clothing. She receives a profit of 700 somoni per month. She currently plans to obtain a loan in order to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Abdupatta

texts.ru: Худжакулов Абдулпатта проживает в городе Трсун-заде. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет четверых детей.Занимается посевом риса. Имеет рисовые поля. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена и минеральные удобрения.Своевременный посев даст возможность получить хороший и качественный урожай.
texts.en:
Abdulpatta H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. He is involved in sowing rice and has rice fields. Abdulpatta plans to use this loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Timely sowing will result in a good quality harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Sebastian Cuariti, trabaja con su mamá la Sra. Joaquina, quien fue cliente anteriormente, pero por su enfermedad, quien se hace cargo de los trabajos es el hijo, razón por la cual, el destino del crédito es para compra de materia prima, ellos tienen una tienda llamada Creaciones Santa Lucía, donde realizan la costura bordada a mano de vestidos de niñas, a la vez también reciben pedidos para confecciones de ropa de niñas, él es cliente hace un año, pero la mamá  trabajo con Emprender más de seis años, demostranso cumplimiento.
texts.en:
Juan Sebastian Cuariti works with his mother Joaquina who had previously been the loan client, however, due to her illness her son now is in charge of the business. This loan will be used to purchase basic materials; they own a store named “Creaciones Santa Lucia” where they make hand-sown girls dresses and also take orders to make girls clothing. He has been a bank member for the past year, but his mother has worked with Emprender for over six years, always fulfilling her commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make girls clothing.

loans.name: Isaura Maria

texts.es: Isaura María D. Zeledón tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Isaura tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una bloquera. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. Doña Isaura inicio por cuenta propia con ambos negocios por lo que le fue muy difícil por la situación ella ha tratado de salir adelante. El financiamiento que ella solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa y además para su bloquera por lo que necesita la compra de materia prima como cemento, arena, moldes y piedra triturada. Los sueños de Isaura son de salir adelante con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isaura Maria D. Z. is 30 years old and she is married. She has 3 children and they are all studying. Her business is to sell general merchandise and the creation of cement blocks for the past 5 years. Isaura started her business by her own so it was very difficult for her to get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used for working capital, to buy clothes and materials to create her blocks like cement, sand, molds, and stones. Her dream is to succeed with her business so her children can have better life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Atsa Adoté

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur était un déclarant en douane, mais comme le revenu de cette activité ne lui permettait pas de couvrir ses charges, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées et de pneus. Il a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et s’approvisionne au marché local du port de Lomé, son stock de pneus est épuisé, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 40 pneus.
Il est veuf et a 03 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
This gentleman used to be a customs agent, but since the income from it did not allow him to support himself, he got started in the commerce of spare parts and tires. He started this business in 2007 and supplies himself at the local marketplace of the port of Lomé. With his stock of tires exhausted, he would like to stock up again and is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 40 tires. He is a widower and has three people in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Kossigan

texts.fr: A. est un jeune homme célibataire qui travaille très dur pour subvenir à ses propres besoins. Il a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock actuel de marchandises a diminué, raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de détergents , 08 bidons d’huile de 25l, 10 sacs de riz, des cartes de recharges et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
A. is a young unmarried man who works very hard to support himself. He opened his own shop in which he does commerce in grocery items. His current stock of merchandise has shrunk, so he's inquiring with WAGES to request a loan to buy two boxes of detergents, eight 25-liter drums of oil, ten sacks of rice, some mobile phone recharge cards, and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is a 60 year old woman, married, and the mother of five children. All of them are independent except the last born who is currently in school.

Through hard work, Adwoa provides support for her kids education. She is a food vendor who has sold kenkey in her neighborhood for the past twenty years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper, gravy stew or any kind of soup and fried fish or meat. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. 

With the loan, Adwoa wants to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. As part of her business expansion, Adwoa has added cooked rice and stew to her product line. When asked, she said most of her customers request the rice so she saw it as an opportunity.

She hopes to raise more income to allow her child to enter university. She belongs to the community group called “Eye Adom” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Pricila Del Carmen

texts.es: Pricila del Carmen R. Méndez es una joven madre de 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad. La actividad económica a la que Priscila se designa es a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Ella se dedica a esto desde muy jovencita ya que este era también el oficio de su madre, al hacerse Pricila una madre quiso valerse por si misma. iniciando un negocio heredado por su madre, lo que le ha permitido sustentar su familia. Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a Fundación León 2000 pues requiere de este para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar maíz el cual es su materia prima y leña para seguir elaborando tortillas y salir a venderlas a sus clientes. El deseo mas grande de Pricila es mejorar su casa de habitación y engrandecer el negocio para proveer trabajo a su familia.
texts.en:
Pricila del Carmen R. Méndez is a young, 30 year old mother. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 13. Pricila makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this since she was a very young girl; her mother did the same work. Upon becoming a mother, Pricila wanted to be self-sufficient. She started a business that she inherited from her mother. This allowed her to support her family. She has asked for a loan from Fundación León 2000 to increase her working capital. She will buy corn, which is her basic ingredient, and wood to keep making tortillas and selling them to her customers. Pricila’s biggest wish is to improve her house and expand her business in order to provide work for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia E. is 26 years old. She is married with a single child who is currently in school. Sophia lives with her family at Mankessim in the coastal region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who has been selling yams for 2 years now. She buys her fresh yams from farming villages around her town and sells them to her retail customers at a profit.

She wants to use the loan to buy more tubers of yam to store and sell them in small lots to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the community group called “Eye Adom” (translated, Grace) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and through supporting each other, repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy yam in bulk

loans.name: Andrea De Jesus

texts.es: Andrea de Jesús S. M. tiene35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes, y necesitan de ella para sustentarse. Andrea se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva. ya que ella inicio con un pequeño negocio de cosméticos, y luego de intentar mejorar sus ingresos decidió vender ropa y hacer clientela de manera ambulante visitando los barrios y repartos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Ella ya ha trabajado con financiamientos de Fundación León 2000 los que han sido oportunos para la mejora de su negocio. El propósito de Andrea, una vez aprobado este préstamo es, invertir en su capital de trabajo de manera que le permita comprar más ropa para vender y por lo consiguiente mejorar su vivienda ya que necesita repararla. Su deseo es tener una tienda propia en su casa que le permita estar al cuidado de sus hijos y su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea de Jesús S. M., 35, is single and the mother of two dependent children who go to school. Andrea sells new clothes. She started with a small cosmetic business. Later, with the intention of improving her income, she decided to sell clothes in a traveling fashion by visiting the neighborhoods and suburbs of Chinandega. She has worked with loans from Fundación León 2000, and they have given her the opportunity to improve her business. Once this loan is approved, Andrea will buy more clothes to sell. Then she will improve her house since it needs repairs. Her wish is to have her own store in her house. This would permit her to take care of her children and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. is a 25-year-old trader who is hard working and enterprising. She is married and the mother of two children, currently in school.

She loves trading. She has been selling food stuff like maize, plantain, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and gari (a fried cassava dish) in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family.

Gifty is a member of the group called “Ahobrase” (translated: “Humility”) Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy maize, plantain, groundnut, gari and beans

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal tiene 50 años, está casado con  Lucia de 42 años de edad .De la unión de ambos han nacido 4 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, solamente 2 siguen viviendo con el matrimonio mientras que los demás ya han formado su propio hogar.
Anibal es un sacrificado hombre que junto con su esposa se dedica a la a la elaboración y venta de tortas de miel, actividad que realizan desde hace 30 años atrás. 
Anibal comenta que junto con su esposa se levantan muy temprano para la elaboración  de sus tortas y una vez terminado salen a vender por diversos lugares de la ciudad de Itá ya que cuentan con varios clientes, y  éstos a su vez  venden en sus puestos de ventas que están ubicados al costado de la ruta internacional. Todos los días realizan el mismo trabajo que ya es una costumbre para ellos por que lo vienen realizando desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y se sienten muy orgullosos   porque a su vez también dan trabajo a muchas personas que venden dicho producto. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de mayor cantidad de tortas de miel, como ser: miel de caña, azúcar, bicarbonato, leña, etc.
texts.en:
Anibal is 50, and he is married to Lucia who is 42. They have four grown children. Only two are living with them; the others have formed their own homes. Anibal is a man who has made sacrifices. Together with his wife, he makes and sells honey cakes. He has been doing this for thirty years. Anibal and his wife get up very early to make their cakes. Once they are done, they leave to sell in different places in the city of Itá. They now can count on various customers who then sell the cakes from their stands, which are located along the international route. Every day they do the same work, and they are accustomed to it because they have been doing it for so long. They feel very proud, because, at the same time, they are providing work for many people who sell their product. He is asking for a loan to buy basic supplies such as molasses, sugar, baking soda, wood, etc. to make a large quantity of honey cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy  sugar, honey, baking soda, wood, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia B. is the 50-year-old mother of five children. She is very supportive to her husband in taking care of the children in school. Through her business, she has paid for three children to graduate from tertiary education.

Felicia is a seamstress and has operated a seamstress shop for the past twenty years. She trains seven young ladies in sewing to equip them with her skills and experience for their future careers. She sews all forms of female wear with various kinds of styles like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for the rest of her children to graduate from school.

She is a member of the community group called “Ahobrase” (translated: “Humility”) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro M. Z. tiene 44 años de edad. el es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales están bajo su cuidado y manutención. Don Félix es mecánico automotriz. desde hace 26 años, pues su papa fue quien le enseño este trabajo, por lo que esta es su actividad económica, y hace 20 años inició con un negocio de manera independiente, ha podido seguir con su comercio gracias a la ayuda de Fundación León 2000. Félix necesita este préstamo para invertir en su capital de trabajo y poder comprar equipos automotrices como taladros, esmeril y prensa. Su deseo es tener un taller más grande y acondicionado con equipos modernos y de alta tecnología.
texts.en:
Señor Félix Pedro M. Z. is 44, married, and has two children who still depend on him economically. Don Félix has been an automotive mechanic for 26 years. His father was the one who taught him this work. Twenty years ago, he opened his own business independently. He has been able to keep it going thanks to the help of Fundación León 2000. Félix needs this loan to invest in working capital so he can buy equipment like drills, files, and a press. His dream is to have a larger shop that is fixed up with modern and high-tech equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret E. is 47 years old. She is married and mother of four children and lives with her family at Mankessim in Central Region of Ghana.

She has traded in metal and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils etc. for the past five years. She requests a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of metal and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family.

Margaret is a member of a community group called Good Shepherd Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of metal, plastic and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La señora Blanca Pérez, tiene 44 años de edad, nació en Managua y reside en el barrio José Isaías Gomes, es madre soltera de una hija de 16 años de edad, la cual estudia y ayuda a su madre en los oficio del hogar. Doña Blanca trabaja en el Consejo Suprema Electoral Nacional, se desempaña como analista estadístico, cuenta con diecisiete años de experiencia laboral, ella inicio como asistente estadística. Sus metas es terminar de construir su casa y escalar jerárquicamente en la institución a la que trabaja y que le permita obtener mejores ingresos. El crédito que esta solicitando es para poner cerámica a un cuarto a una casa que tiene en el barrio de Hialeah, ya que en estos momentos esta en casa de su mama ya que la tiene enferma y necesita de sus cuidados. Este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic que es de mucho beneficio para llevar a cabo sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Blanca Pérez is 44 years old, was born in Managua, and lives in the José Isaías Gomes neighborhood. She is a single mother with a 16-year-old daughter, who is in school and helps her with the housework. Blanca works for the Consejo Suprema Electoral Nacional (the National Election Supreme Council), where she serves as a statistical analyst. She has 16 years of work experience, beginning as a statistical assistant. Her goals are to finish building her house and to climb the hierarchy at the institute where she works, since that would provide her with a better income. Blanca will use the loan she is requesting to install a tile floor in a room in her house in the Hialeah neighborhood. Blanca is currently living at her mother’s house, since her mother is ill and needs her care. This is Blanca’s fourth loan with Kiva partner Afodenic, and it will be very useful for carrying out her projects.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for installing a tile floor in her house

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Ana Margarita L. Martínez tiene la edad de 27 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ana tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Ana tiene poco de tener este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que nació con el objetivo de apoyar los gastos de su familia ella es una mujer muy luchadora, y siempre le ha gustado trabajar de una manera humilde. Los propósitos de Ana son de aumentar su inventario y así tener las reservas necesarias de los productos que son mas solicitados. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas. El deseo de Doña Ana es obtener la mejor calidad de comida entre sus clientes, y establecer un restaurante en donde genere ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Margarita L. Martínez is 27 and single. Doña Ana has one son and goes to school. She makes a living by selling food. She has done this for more than 5 years. She hasn't had this business very long, but it's important to point out that she created it with the objective of supporting her family. She is a very hard-working woman, and she has always liked to work in a humble manner. Ana's goals are to increase her inventory so she can have the necessary reserves of her most requested products. The financing requested will go towards working capital so she can buy rice, beans, sugar, and fruits. Doña Ana's dream is to make the best quality food for her customers and to establish a restaurant that will generate profits for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladis Feysi

texts.es: La señora Gladis Q. tiene la edad de 35 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, casada y con tres hijos de 5,14 y 17 años de  edad, los tres estudian para poder ser unos profesionales y mejorar el nivel de vida. Su esposo vende ambulante pana, verduras y refrescos, desde hace dieciocho años doña Gladis vende ambulante pan, refresco el cual lo hace mediante una jabalina con su caballo, el cual hace mas fácil el acarreo y las ventas. Con este crédito es el sexto ciclo en Afodenic que va invertir en comprar  materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda, también quiere comprar un  horno donde elabora sus ricos panes para poder seguir incrementando sus ventas, como captar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Ms. Gladis Q. is 35 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neiborhood of Managua. She is married and has three children ages 5, 14, and 17. All three are students who hope to become professionals and improve their place in life. Gladis’ husband hawks corduroy, vegetables, and drinks and Gladis has traveled the streets selling bread and drinks, which she makes with a javelin with her horse, for 18 years. This is her 6th loan with Aodenic and she plans to invest it in the purchase of construction materials to make improvements to her house. She also wants to buy an oven to bake her delicious breads in so she can continue increasing her sales and get new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de contruccion para hacer mejoras a la vivienda

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margine Raquel

texts.es:
Margine Raquel R. M. tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Margine tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Margine es la venta de bisutería.
Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Margine inicio este negocio por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de su casa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera en la que puede ofrecer sus productos. Doña Margine dice tener los propósitos de incrementar su inventario para competir fuertemente. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo efectuara la compra de collares, pulseras, cadenas aretes de plata y oro laminado. Los sueños de Margine son de establecerse en una tienda y así  proporcionarle este negocio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Margine Raquel R. M. is 35, single, and has 2 children. She makes a living by selling imitation jewelry. She has done this for more than 4 years. She started this business to cover her home's expenses. She works as a street vendor since this is the only way she has of offering her products. Doña Margine's goal is to increase her inventory to be able to compete strongly. The financing requested will go towards working capital so she can purchase necklaces, bracelets, chains, and earrings of silver and gold laminate. Her dreams are to establish a store and to leave her business to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Helene, a 46-year-old married woman. She and her husband have five children of the following ages: 26, 19, 18, 12 and 12. This family lives currently in Nyarugenge district, Gitega sector in Kigali City, the capital of Rwanda. 

M. Helene is an entrepreneur who operates her business in Kigali City where she owns a stationery shop and sells photocopier service. Her husband does not produce any kind of income.

Helene is seeking her first loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company and it will be repaid within 12 months.

Helene has a full time worker to help her to run her business smoothly. She seems to have a great deal of experience in this business because she has been doing the same business since 2003. She starts her daily work at 7:30 a.m. and finishes at 7:30 p.m. She used to produce the monthly profit approximately $185. With this loan She intends to expand her business and will reinvest the increased profits in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adjaratou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gbegnyedji. Son mari est un revendeur au grand marché de Lomé, l’activité qu’elle exerce dans son quartier et qui  lui permet d’aider son époux dans les charges du foyer est le commerce de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé. Elle veut se réapprovisionner  c’est  pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 25 charbons de bois et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This is a women who is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the Gbegnyedji district. Her husband is a retailer at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The business which she has in her district, and which allows her to help her husband cover household expenses, is commerce in charcoal. She gets her supplies inland, in the city of Sokodé. She wants to resupply herself, and thus, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES that will enable her to buy 25 sacks of charcoal and to cover the transportation costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
La Señora Cándida de 48 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con el Señor Dionisio de 51 años de edad quien trabaja como albañil y con quien tuvo 5 hijos: José de 27 años quien trabaja en albañilería con su padre, Nancy de 25 años quien es docente, Juana de 24 años quien se encuentra trabajando en España, Enrique de 19 años  y Juan de 12 años de edad quien está cursando el sexto grado de la Educación Básica 
Comenzó su actividad en el año 2006, con  mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy cuenta con una despensa muy surtida.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para un nuevo salón comercial debido a que el lugar donde funciona actualmente su negocio ya le resulta pequeño.
La misma  espera terminar su nuevo local y con ello aumentar sus mercaderías y así sus ventas, incrementando sus ingresos para su bienestar y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Cándida is a 48 year old vendor, married to 51 year old Dionisio who works as a bricklayer and with whom she has 5 children: 27 year old Jose who works in brick work with his father, 25 year old Nancy who is a school teacher, 24 year old Juana who is working in Spain, 19 year old Enrique and 12 year old Juan who is in 6th grade of primary school. She began her business in 2006. With great effort and help from the entire family, she was able to be successful and today has a well-stocked convenience store. She is seeking a loan to buy construction materials for a new commercial room because the place where she currently has her business is too small for her business. She hopes to be able to finish her new locale and increase her merchandise and subsequently her sales, thereby increasing her income for her and her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new commercial room for her business

loans.name: Alma Lucia

texts.es: Alma Lucia C. M. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Lucia tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de es un taller de carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Alma inicio este negocio por su familia ya que anteriormente el negocio estaba a cargo de su Papa y fue el quien le enseño este negocio y como necesitaba un medio de supervivencia decide hacerse a cargo del negocio. El propósito de Alma es mantener activo este negocio y además es lo único que les podría dejar a sus hijos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que su inversión será destinada para la compra de materia prima como madera, pintura, brocha, pega, lija entre otros. Los sueños de Doña Alma es seguir trabajando con Fundación León 2000 ya que es por medio de esta que recibe la ayuda de las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Alma Lucia C. M. is 53 years old and married. She has 2 children, and has had a carpentry shop for 5 years. Alma began this business because of her family as the business was originally run by her father and it was he who taught her this business. As she needed a way of earning a living she decided to take over the business. Alma plans to continue this business and she plans to leave it to her children. The financing will be used for working capital to invest in buying materials such as wood, paint, paintbrushes, glue, sandpaper and more. Alma dreams of continuing to work with the Fundación León 2000 because it is through this organization she receives help fellow women entrepreneur organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Joselyne who is 24 years old and married. She and her husband have one child of 9 months, and she takes care of two orphans, 16 and 18 years old. This family currently lives in Gasabo, a district of Kigali City, the capital of Rwanda. 

M. Joselyne is an entrepreneur who operates her business in Kigali City where she owns a retail shop selling different kinds of merchandise. Her husband produces a regular income of $240 per month.

Joselyne is seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company of 500,000 Rwf to be repaid within 8 months. She has been running the same business since 2007 and has no employees. She does her daily work from 6:00 to 9:30 p.m. She earns a monthly profit of approximately $55.

With this loan Joselyne intends to expand her business and, from the increased profits, she will buy a house and have more savings.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Koffivi Edem

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce comme activité la vente de matériaux de construction, actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée, voulant se réapprovisionner, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de serrures, un demi carton de marteau et burin et divers matériaux de construction.
Il n’est pas marié , il a 02 personnes à sa charge.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman whose work involves selling construction materials. Currently, part of his stock is exhausted. Wanting to stock up again, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy two boxes of locks, a half-box of hammers and chisels, and various construction supplies. He is not married. He has two people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Greetings from Gerard N.. 25 years old and single with no dependents, he currently lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur is a productive young man who owns a shop selling different kinds of merchandises but mostly his store is made up of vessels. Gerard is requesting his first loan worth 500000Rwf from Vision Finance Company and will be paid back within12 months.
