Gerard had been working in the same activity since early 2008; he has one full-time employee to help him in this business. He starts his daily business at 6h00’AM to 20h00’PM and used to earn 182 USD. With the loan from Vision Finance Company, N. intends to buy more stock of merchandises, and with the increased profit he will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Buy more store of marchandises

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de Dieu U.! He is 28 years old and is single and no dependents. He lives in the Gasabo district of the city of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Jean de Dieu owns a shop where he sells a variety of items in retail. He is seeking his first loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwf from Kiva lenders, but it is his second with Vision Finance Company to be paid back in 12 months. His first loan was in the amount of 300,000 Rwf.

He started his shop six years ago and has two full-time employees to help him run his business. He opens for business at 6 a.m. and closes at 10 p.m.

He used to earn a monthly profit of approximately $110. With this loan, he intends to expand his business, and expects increased profits from this investment. He will reinvest these in his business with the goal of acquiring more savings.

loans.use: To expand his retail shop business

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal tiene 36 años, está casado con Nancy de de 31 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años, ambos van a la escuela. Cristóbal posee un terreno de 3 has. en el cual cultiva  todos tipo de hortalizas (lechugas, acelga, perejil, locote, tomate, entre otros); además el mismo se encarga de repartir sus productos a diferentes puntos del país.
Cristóbal es un sacrificado hombre que se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas, mientras que su esposa se encarga de criar y educar a sus hijos. Cristóbal empieza con sus actividades desde muy temprano todos los días de lunes a lunes oficio que aprendió de sus padre desde muy pequeño, está muy orgulloso de su trabajo por que cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, además el negocio le genera muy buenos resultados.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como: semillas, insecticidas, químicos, media sombra, etc. que son empleados en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 36 years old and married to 31 year old Nancy. The couple has 2 children ages 11 and 8, both attend school. Cristóbal owns 3 hectares of land where he grows all kinds of crops (lettuce, chard, parsley, peppers, tomato and more); in addition he himself is in charge of distributing the products to different parts of the country. Cristóbal is a self-sacrificing man who grows and sells crops, while his wife is in charge of raising and educating their children. Cristóbal begins his work very early every day, 7 days a week. He learned this work from his father as a small boy. He is very proud of his work because he can count on the support of his family, in addition the business generates good income for him. He is seeking a loan to buy items such as: seeds, insecticides, chemicals, landscaping fabric, etc. which are used in growing the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to raise crops

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar Baji is a widow who has resided in a city named Kasur, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. The city of Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats. Parveenbaji operates a clothes-sewing business because this is the only craft she knows. Through this work she is able to send her two sons to school.

She is applying for a loan to start a cloth-selling business because sewing clothes is very time-intensive work and requires lots of hard work.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

- Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

- Zarina Baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

- Riffat Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy chairs, a mirror, and scissors for her salon.

- Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

- Razia Begum Baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Greetings from Bernadette N., a 31-year-old married mother of two children of five and seven years old. Bernadette lives with her family in the Gasabo District of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Bernadette owns a shop selling different kinds of products, both consumable and non-consumable, while her husband does not earn any kind of income. She has been in the same business for six years and employs two people. Her daily work starts at 6am and finishes at 11pm. Bernadette is seeking her second loan worth 600,000 RWF from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company and will be paid in 12 months. Her first loan was valued at 521,075 RWF. with her first loan Bernadette has earned approximately $145 USD monthly profit. With the new loan she intends to buy another house in which she will be storing merchandise, and with the profits from the loan she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: To buy a house

loans.name: Irshad Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is married to S. A. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan (famous for its sweetmeats) for the past 15 years. She prepares wooden items, such as trays, which people buy to decorate their homes. Irshad baji learned this art from her mother and has worked in this business for five years. Her husband works in the clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from different cities (Multan and Lahore) and sells to his native city, Kasur. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s business.

Irshad baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Zubaida baji, Humaira baji, Fozia baji and Shabana baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Salma Qamar Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is the wife of Q. A., who owns a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 14 years. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat. Salma baji is a very hardworking lady and a very sensitive soul. She can’t bear to see her family in trouble. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband, who sells clothes in his native city of Kasur and buys from Multan and Lahore. These two cities are famous for their varieties. Salma baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business. 

She is the group leader of six other women from her area. Rafia baji, Nusrat baji, Shahnaz baji, Zubaida baji, Shahida baji, and Bable baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en concubinato con el señor Cándido, tienen 2 hijos aun menores de edad y uno en camino.
Vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Ita, tiene casa propia, hasta hace poco tiempo vivían en casa de su madre, pero gracias al fruto de su trabajo como  vendedora de tabacos  consiguió construir 2 piezas y un baño. 
La actividad de comerciante lo heredó de su madre quien también se dedicaba a esa actividad, la elaboración de los tabacos las realiza en su domicilio y por las mañanas los vende en el mercado municipal de la ciudad municipal de la ciudad al por mayor y menor. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de más fardos de materia prima debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 25 years old and lives with a man named Cándido. They have 2 young children, one who can already walk. She lives in an area very close to the center of the city of Ita. She now has her own house, recently having lived in the house of her mother. However, thanks to the fruits of her labor as a seller of tobacco, she was able to construct two rooms and a bathroom. She inherited this type of work from her mother who also worked performing the same job. The tobacco production is done at her house and she sells the products during the mornings at the local market in the city. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more bundles of raw materials because she has a lot of incoming orders.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for tobacco production

loans.name: Shumaila Pervaiz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shumaila baji and her husband P. A. live in a city famous for its sweetmeat named Kasur, Pakistan. Her husband has worked in a business selling bed sheets for 4 years and has a good number of customers. Shumaila baji helps him by selling bed sheets in the community. She is applying for a loan to buy more bed sheets from the city, Lahore to earn a good income.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Fozia baji, Amra baji, Shamshad baji and Bashiran baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 31 años de edad, viven en concubinato con la señora María, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su domicilio está situado en una compañía muy concurrida de la ciudad de Itá.
Se dedica a la confección de trajes para particulares y para agentes policiales hace más de 10 años.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una maquina recta, la cual le servirá para agilizar la confección de sus trajes, actualmente su actividad origina fuentes de trabajo a un empleado fijo y a otras personas fuera de su empresa que realizan la terminación de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 years old and lives with a woman named María. They have 2 children who attend school. Their home is located in a very crowded part of the city of Ita. He has been working as a suit tailor for individuals and for policemen for over 10 years. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase a sewing machine, which he will use to speed up the production of the suits. Actually, his work is creating job opportunities for another employee and for others outside his company who can carry out the completion of his garments.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Maqboolan Maqsood Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan baji and her husband M. A. own a two room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, where they have been living with their family for the past 14 years. For the past 5 years, her husband has run a business selling ladies clothes. Maqboolan baji also operates a business, sewing clothes, to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy garments for her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Abida baji, Bilquis baji, Sana baji and Sabra baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ladies garments to sell

loans.name: Adele

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Adele. Adele is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in the Gasabo district in Kigali, city capital of Rwanda.

M. Adele is an entrepreneur and for the past ten years has run a business selling cabbages near Kimironko market in Gasabo district, while her husband earns a monthly income of 350 USD. She has two regular full time employees to help her to run her business smoothly. Adele works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. She currently earns a monthly profit of approximately 275 USD. Adele is seeking her first loan worth 500000Rwf from Vision Finance Company to be paid in 8 months. with the loan, Adele hopes to increase her store of cabbages and from the increased profits she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 39 años, vive en pareja con Celia de 28 años, están juntos hace como diez años y tienen un hijo de 8 años que va la escuela. Isidro comenta que proviene de una familia muy humilde, que desde muy temprano le ayudaba a su padre en el campo, razón por la cual no pudo terminar sus estudios. Aún así se siente afortunado por que cuenta con su pareja quien le ayuda con la venta de huevos, leche, gallinas y otras aves que el mismo cría en su pequeña granja. Isidro también se dedica al cultivo de tomate, locote, caña de azúcar, etc. Comenta que está muy agradecido con lo que tiene porque gracias a su dedicación y el apoyo de su familia puede tener una vida digna y así darle una vida mejor a su hijo.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima e insumos como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, productos químicos, etc. debido a que quiere ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isidro is 39 years old and lives with his partner Celia, 28. They have been together for 10 years and have an 8-year-old son who is in school. Isidro tells us that he comes from a very humble family and from a very early age he helped his father in the field, which is why he was never able to finish his studies. However, he feels fortunate because he has Celia, who helps him sell eggs, milk, hens and other birds that they raise themselves on their small farm. Isidro also dedicates himself to cultivating tomatoes, peppers, sugar cane and other crops. He tells us that he is very grateful because thanks to his dedication and the support of his family he can have a worthy life and offer a better one to his son. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more raw materials such as seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, chemicals, etc. because he wants to expand his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming raw materials such as seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
En 2007, cette jeune femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de mèche et de tissages qu’elle vend en détail. Sa clientèle est constituée en majorité de coiffeuse. Elle est seule à faire ce commerce dans son quartier ce qui est un avantage pour elle. Elle veut agrandir son activité et  sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de nouveaux modèles de mèches et de tissages.
Elle est célibataire, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
In 2007, this young woman got started in the commerce of hair extensions and weaves that she sells retail. Her customers are composed of mostly hairdressers. She is the only one having this business in her district, and it's an advantage for her. She wants to expand her business and is therefore requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy new models of hair extensions and weaves. She is unmarried, and this work enables her to support herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Nasreen Javed Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is married to J. I., who owns a two-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past ten years. Nasreen baji is a hardworking lady who performs her duties very efficiently. She rises early and gets her two sons ready for school, then prepares breakfast for her family, and afterwards cleans the entire house. She fulfills all her family's wishes regarding care and health. Her husband has run a garment-selling business for the past six years, and Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business.

Nasreen baji is the leader of a group of six other women from her locality. Parveen baji, Shazia baji, Mumtaz baji, Salma baji and Sardaran baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Mahwish baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa de 46 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con la Sr. Jorge  de 43 años de edad quien trabaja como empleado en el Hospital Nacional de Itauguá  y con quien tuvo 3 hijos: Ramón de 28 años, Marilyn de 17 años, quien  se encuentra cursando el tercer año técnico en informática, y Marcos de 15 años quien cursa el primer año de la Media.
María Teresa cuenta con un copetín que hoy día reúne a una cantidad interesante de clientes.
Comenta que abrió su negocio hace un poco más de un año  ya que  los ingresos de su marido no alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos.
  Con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy en día cuenta con un copetín donde la misma trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno eléctrico en donde podrá hornear todo tipo de alimentos, además de surtir mejor su negocio en cuanto a bebidas y otros alimentos en General.
texts.en:
María Teresa is a 46 years old businesswoman and is married to 43 year old Jorge who works as an employee in the Itauguá National Hospital and with whom she has 3 children: 28 year old Ramon, 17 year old Marilyn who is finishing 3rd year of computer studies, and 15 year old Marcos who is completing his first year in media studies. María Teresa has a small snack bar where a number of interesting clients gather daily. She opened her business a little over a year ago as her husband’s income didn’t completely cover the household expenses and the children’s schooling expenses. With great effort and help from the entire family she has able to be successful and today she has her snack bar where she works with the objective of improving the quality of life for her family. She seeks a loan to buy an electric stove where she will be able to make all kinds of dishes, in addition to stock her business with beverages and food items in general.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an electric stove and merchandise such as meat, soda pop, beer, and more

loans.name: Dorothée

texts.en:
Greetings from K. Dorothée who is 42 years old and married. She and her husband have four children and two orphans aged 6 and 12. The family is currently living in Gasabo district in Kigali City, capital of Rwanda.

K. Dorothée is an entrepreneur and owns shop in Kimironko district selling leather handbags. Her husband produces a wage of $515 per month.

Dorothée is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to be paid within 8 months. She has no employees and has been doing the same business since 2004. Dorothée opens her shop from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Before the loan, she was earning a monthly profit of approximately $220. With the loan from Vision Finance Company, K. will expand her business and, from the increased profits, she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El Sr. Nicolás de 43 años de edad es comerciante y está casado con la Sra Mirta de 34 años de edad, tuvieron 4 hijos: Ana quien es la mayor de 14 años, Liza de 12 años, Rossana de 11  años y Richard de 9 años de edad.
Todos sus hijos siguen  sus estudios gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres quienes trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar.
Nicolás posee una despensa que funciona en su propio domicilio y que hoy día le genera muy buenas ganancias.
Comenzó su actividad en el año 2004, sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles, porque necesitaba  capital de trabajo, y con muchos hijos lo fue aún más.
 Con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante y hoy cuenta con un negocio bien surtido.
  
El Sr. Nicolás solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio con  la compra de lácteos, carne, fideo, cerveza, gaseosa, embutidos, verduras, y otros.
Al tener mayor número de mercaderías piensa que su clientela aumentará, sus ingresos consecuentemente también y por lo tanto podrá obtener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él como para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolás is a 43 years old businessman and is married to 34 year old Mirta and they have 4 children: 14 year old Ana, 12 year old Liza, 11 year old Rossana, and 9 year old Richard. All of his children ar ein school thanks to the efforts of their parents who work day after day to help their family get ahead, as they did not have the opportunity to study. Nicolás owns a store located in his home and today it generates very good earnings. He began his business in 2004. It was difficult at first because he needed working capital, and with many children even more so. With great effort and the help of his family he was able to be successful and today he has a well-stocked business. Nicolás is seeking a loan to invest in buying products for his business such as dairy products, meat, noodles, beer, soda pop, canned goods, vegetables, and more. When he has more merchandise he believes his customers will grow, and subsequently his income also thereby enabling him to be able to have a better quality of life for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products, meat, noodles, beer, soda pop, canned goods, vegetables,  etc.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida tiene 48 años de edad, tiene una sola  hija quien vive con ella la cual es empleada en un supermercado y le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Ella vive en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Itá, en donde posee una despensa hace mas de 16 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y amigos de: carne, carbón, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de dichas mercaderías, a modo a aumentar su inventario y de esa manera sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 48 years old, has one daughter who lives with her and who is employed in a supermarket and assists her with the household expenses. She lives in a well-populated neighborhood of Ita city, where she has owned a convenience store for over 16 years. Her neighbors and friends buy meat, charcoal, sugar, tea, beverages, and other basic needs products. The loan she seeks will be used to buy the aforementioned merchandise thereby increasing her inventory and in this way also her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beverages and other merchandise.

loans.name: Nabet Eufemio

texts.es: El Señor Nabet Eufemio Rodríguez O. tiene la edad de 32 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Nabet tiene 2 hijos y todos asisten a escuela. La actividad económica es la compra y venta de repuestos de bicicletas. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Nabet inicio este negocio reparando bicicletas y poco a poco le gusto este tipo de negocio. Los propósitos de Nabet son de proporcionarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio para que ellos se encuentren satisfechos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de repuestos como: llantas, asientos entre otros. Los sueños de Nabet son de terminar de remodelar su vivienda y que sus hijos desempeñen una profesión.
texts.en:
Nabet Eufemio Rodríguez O. is 32 years old married man. He has two children who attend school. He buys and sells bicycle parts. He has been dedicated to this business for more than 3 years. He bagan repairing bicycles and little by little got to like this type of work very much. His purpose now is to provide his clients with the best service so that they will be completely satisfied with his work. This financing will be used to invest in replacement parts such as tires and bicycle seats, among others. His dream is to finish remodeling his home and that his children complete professional schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts and supplies for his repair service.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Esperance, 28 years old and married with two children, 9 and 7 years old. She lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. Her husband produces a monthly income of $550.

Esperance owns a jewelry shop in Nyarugenge town. She starts the business at 8:00 a.m. daily and closes at 7:30 p.m. She has worked in the same business since 2007 and now has two full-time employees to help her in that business.

Esperance is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company which will be paid back within 8 months. Before the loan, Esperance earned a monthly profit of approximately $455. With the loan from Vision Finance Company, Esperance will buy more jewels and from the increased profits she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra del Socorro M. A. tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Sandra tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Sandra es la venta de discos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Sandra inicio por que observo que muchos clientes buscaban la manera de conseguir su película favorita, y fue así como le agrado la idea de facilitarles a sus clientes estos productos. Los propósitos de Sandra son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital compra para la inversión de su negocio para la compra de discos, compra de DVD portátiles para mostrar sus películas. El deseo de Sandra es darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro M. A. is a single, 42-year-old, single mother of 6 children, all of whom are employed. Her business is the sale of DVDs, a business she's been dedicated to for over 6 years. She began her work having observed than many customers would look to the way of obtaining their favorite films and this gave her the idea of providing them. Her aims now are to provide the best quality of products so that her customers will be completely satisfied. These funds will be used to invest in inventory for her store as well as in the purchase of portable DVD players to show her films. Sandra also hopes to improve her dwelling as she has always struggled to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Michel, 40 years old of age, married with two children, 9 and 6 years old and no orphans. They currently live in Nyarugenge district, Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

N. Michel owns a plot in Nyabugogo market where he sells clothes. He is seeking his first loan worth 300,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to be paid back in 8 months.

Michel had been doing the same business for four years and has one employee to help him to run his business. Michel works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Before the loan, he earned $180 as monthly profit; with the loan, Michel intends to expand his business and reinvest the increased profit.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Comité Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Divino Niño Jesús, se conformó en fecha 05 de noviembre del 2008., gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. Castorina A., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso del 1° ciclo, pasó por varios inconvenientes, ya que la Directora de Finanzas en aquel entonces sufrió un grave accidente en donde perdió la vida, pero el grupo gracias a su trabajo solidario logro salir adelante y seguir trabajando con el programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 430.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de ropas, venta de lencerías, venta de remedios naturales, venta de perfumes, venta de cosméticos, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carbón, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The Divine Baby Jesus Women's Committee was formed on 5 November 2008 thanks to the efforts of the current general director, Mrs. Castorina A., who is involved in the elaboration and sale of prepared meals. She made contact with the advisor during a weekly meeting taking place in the area to gather information regarding the work of the Committee of Entrepreneur Women. Once she was informed about the program, she managed to gather together 18 women who are now happily working together in a second cycle. The group suffered major obstacles during the first cycle because the financial director at that time was victim of a serious accident that cost her her life. However, the group stuck together and was able to continue working with the program. Each participant withdraws on average 430,000 guaraní which are used for various activities such as: sale of prepared meals, sale of notions, sale of basic foodstuffs (rice, sugar, pasta, dairy products, bakery good, herbs, etc.) sale of clothing and lingerie, sale of natural remedies, sale of perfume and cosmetics, fruits and vegetables, charcoal, etc. All of the members take part in fund-raising activities and help each other to reach the common objectives which they have within the group and with the Paraguaya Foundation. They actively participate in the weekly meetings and have impeccable cooperative work skills.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the general store (rice, sugar, herbs, dairy products, bakery goods, soft drinks,etc.), to purchase ingredients for preparing meals, to purchase clothing and sewing supplies, to purchase lingerie and natural home remedy ingredients, to purchase fruits and vegetables, meats, pefumes,cosmetics, charcoal, manicure and pedicure supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mirna De La Cruz

texts.es: Mirna de la Cruz García tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Mirna tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Mirna es la venta de tortilla y mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio. Doña Mirna es una mujer muy trabajadora y además esta muy contenta con su trabajo ya que no ha sido fácil mantener sus negocios, por la mañana elabora las tortillas y mas tarde recorre las calles para venderlas, y los fines de semana visita a sus amigas para ofrecer productos de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas entre otros. Los propósitos de Mirna son de mantener ambos negocio le han ayudado para salir adelante con su familia. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así invertir en sus 2 fuentes de ingresos y comprar maíz, leña, cal, cosméticos, cremas y perfumes. Los deseos de Mirna son de seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que el día de mañana tengan un futuro lleno de estudios.
texts.en:
Mirna de la Cruz García is a 42-year-old, single, mother of three school-age children. For the past 5 years she has sold tortillas and miscellany. She is a hard-working woman who is happy to have succeeded in her work despite difficulties. She makes her tortillas in the morning and spends the afternoon going around town selling them. On week-ends, she visits her friends offering for sale cosmetics, perfumes, and beauty creams, among other items. Her aims are to maintain both her businesses which have allowed her to support her family. She seeks financing to buy corn, fire wood, lime, cosmetics, beauty creams and perfumes thereby investing in both her sources of income. Mirna's hopes are to continue to help her children so that their future can include a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Mukhtayaran Aslam Masih Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran baji is a very sensible and hardworking lady. She runs a business sewing clothes, which she handles and manages very successfully. Due to the economic conditions in Pakistan, she sews clothes so that she can save income for a rainy day. Mukhtayaran baji's husband runs a business selling bed sheets. For the past three years, he has bough sheets from Lahore and sold them in his native city of Vehari. Mukhtayaran baji is applying for a loan to buy bed sheets for her husband’s business.

Mukhtayaran baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Nasreen akhtar baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naziran baji wants a loan to buy items (such as creams, cosmetics and a hairdryer machine) for her parlor. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her dressmaking business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia B. G. tiene 46 años, su estado civil es soltera.  La actividad económica de Rosa es venta de tortillas, frijoles cocidos y una pulpería. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Rosa es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora y le gusta su trabajo, además con estos créditos es que ella ha podido ir creciendo poco a poco con su negocio. Los propósitos de Rosa son de mejorar la economía de su negocio ya si proporcionar más ingresos para su familia. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña y además invertir un poco más en su pulpería. Los sueños de Rosa son de seguir adelante con este negocio para que sus hijos puedan optar a un buen porvernir.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia B. G. is 46 years old and single. For the past 32 years she has sold tortillas and cooked beans, and has run a general grocery store. Rosa is a cheerful, hard-working woman who enjoys her work. Besides, these credits have allowed her and her business to grow little by little. Her aim is to improve her financial situation thereby providing increased income for her family. The financing is destined to increase her inventory through the purchase of corn, fire wood and other items to stock her store. Her dreams are to continue to progress with her business so that her children can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bashiran Anayat Masih Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and her relatives. She doesn’t feel shy of being called a seamstress. 

Her husband runs a business selling bed sheets which he buys from Lahore and sells in his native city, Vehari. They both have a wish to renovate their house and decorate it. Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy bed sheets to increase the profit of her husband’s business.

Bashiran baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Shakeela begum baji wants a loan to buy items (taps [faucets], pipes) for her sanitary supplies business.

Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Naseem khanum baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

loans.use: To buy bed sheets for her husband to sell

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Ashiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a very determined and responsible lady. She cares for her family a lot and never sees them in trouble. She tries to fulfill all the wishes of her three children with her embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells to the clothes shops and earns income.

Her husband has a poultry business. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy chicken feed for her husband’s poultry.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Sonia baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

Kalsoom akhtar baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her husband's poultry business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur, Abena D., 40, takes care of her six children. All her children are pursuing education at the primary and junior high school levels. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, who is a driver, and her children in their own house in Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Abena is a food vendor and sells rice and stew to support her husband in providing for the family. She has been in business for four years. Abena is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding soft drinks and meat pies to supplement her income. Her food is highly patronized because of its good quality and taste. She also wants to procure fresh rice in bulk.

She is a member of a community trust group called “Ahotefo” (translates to "righteous"). Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh rice in bulk

loans.name: Razia Amanuel Masih Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of A. M. and resides in a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business. He has three years of experience in this business. He buys clothes from Lahore, a city famous for its varieties, and sells in his native city of Vehari. Razia baji operates an embroidery business, preparing embroidered dresses to order to earn income. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her area. Asifa baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Irshad baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for sewing clothes. Sarafeen baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Florienne

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Florienne, a 44-year-old widow with two children and two orphans she takes care of by herself. The children's ages are 17, 12, 15 and 11. She lives the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the city capital of Rwanda.

U. owns a shop where she sells many kinds of consumable merchandises in her neighborhood. She is seeking her first loan worth 300000Rwf from Vision Finance Company to be paid within 8 months. This entrepreneur has been doing the same business for 12 years and has one full-time employee to help her in this business. Florienne starts working at 7:30 a.m. until 8 p.m. and she earned $365 in monthly profit before the loan. With the loan, Ms. U. wants to increase her merchandise, expand her business and have more savings with the increased profit.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel F. is a forty-two-year-old father of four children: two boys and two girls. All his children are currently in primary and junior high schools. He lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities. 

Daniel trades in textiles and secondhand clothes. He buys textiles and all kinds of secondhand clothes, most especially jeans, in the city of Accra, and sells in the market square in his community. He says he sells in a small shed in the market area.

Daniel has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to increase his working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and jeans. He believes the loan assistance would enable him to upgrade his inventory and, eventually, make very good profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and used clothes

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is forty-two years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Currently, three of them are pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with all zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and help provide for the children's fees. She is a fishmonger and sells all kinds of fried and smoked fishes. She sells through "hawking" (door-to-door sales). She procures her goods from big time fishmongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Kate, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

Kate believes this loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Ahotefo ("righteous") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure fried and smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Shazia Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a group leader of four ladies who belong to her community. They all are very hardworking ladies. They are applying for a loan for different works but have one motto, to increase their profit, because economic condition of Pakistan is getting worse day by day and it's difficult for a single person to meet the house expenses. So they all also handle their own businesses to share the financial burdens of their husbands.

Shazia baji is applying for a loan to buy electric supplies such as wires, switchboards and switches for her husband's electric shop. Mubeen baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Rehana baji and Nasreen Akhtar baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for sewing clothes. Asia baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies for electric shop.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to two kids who are pursuing education in primary school. Yaa is hard working and resourceful to her family. She is a food vendor and sells donuts and meat pies. She also is engaged in the sale of cassava, yam and palm fruits. She believes selling multiple products will enable her to meet her household expenditure demands. She has been in business for 10 years.

Yaa wants to use the loan to procure flour, sugar, oil for her pastry and also to buy more cassava and yams to sell. She is a member of a Trust Bank group Mo din mmo ("hard work") where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, oil, cassava and yams in bulk.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet S. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are currently studying in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the eastern region of Ghana. Janet works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver. She sells fresh eggs and clothing materials. She buys her stock of eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She distributes the eggs to coffee sellers, food vendors and canteen operators. Janet has been in business for four years.

Janet wants a loan to buy fresh eggs on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost due to frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

Janet is a member of the community group called Nyame Asem ("God’s word") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is thirty-one years old. She is married and blessed with three kids. Currently, they are all pursuing education in primary school. Grace lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard as a resourceful mother to support her family and help provide for the kids' school fees. She operates a cold store and sells assorted fishes. She procures her stock of fish from big-time fishmongers at the fishing harbor who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Grace, most of her customers are food vendors and individual households in her community.

Grace believes this loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually to help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Mo din mmo ("hard work") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure assorted fishes in bulk.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a 50-year-old woman who is still married and the mother of three children: two boys and a girl. They are pursuing education in primary school. Ama’s husband is a retired educator. She lives with the family in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Ama trades in textiles fabrics and second-hand clothes. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes, most especially, skirts, blouses and ladies slippers, from the city of Accra, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she sells in a small shed in the market area. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and ladies slippers. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually, make very good profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur, Abena A., 43, takes care of her four kids. All of her children are pursuing education at the primary and junior high school levels. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, who is a driver, and her children in their own house in Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Abena is a food vendor and sells rice and stew to support her husband in providing for the family. She has been in business for four years now.

Abena is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding soft drinks and meat pies to supplement her income. Her food is highly patronized because of its good quality and taste. She also wants to procure fresh rice in bulk .

She is a member of a community trust group called “Nyame asem” (translates to "God’s word"). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh rice in bulk

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Kuña Aty, se conformó en fecha 29 D. enero del 2.009, gracias a que la Directora General , la Sra. Juliana B. D. S. ,quien es artesana, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya informándose con respecto al programa y  D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya pasando al 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio D. crédito retirado por cada integrante es D. 470.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. bebidas, venta D. carbón, venta D. mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta D. ropas , venta D. miel, venta D. tabaco, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y trabajan en equipo demostrando espíritu D. compañerismo y solidaridad.
texts.en:
The group of women called Kuña Aty formed on January 29, 2009 thanks to the Director General, Juliana B. D. S., who is an artisan. She approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn about their Committee of Entrepreneuring Women program and the kind of work it involves. Once informed about the program, she assembled a group of 17 women. Already in their 2nd loan cycle, they have found that they work well together within the program.
The average loan per member is 470,000 guaranís. The money will be used in various activities, including the sale of beverages, coal, grocery items (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba tea, etc.), clothing, honey, tobacco, etc.
They all work to generate income and they help each other to achieve their common goals and those of Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in weekly meetings and work as a team, demonstrating a spirit of friendship and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items (rice, sugar, yerba tea, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
S. Julienne est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au sud du Bénin. Julienne est mariée et mère de cinq enfants tous majeurs. C’est depuis son enfance que Julienne mène avec sa mère l'activité de vente de galette d’arachide. Mais Julienne s’est installée à son propre compte après son mariage dans la même activité. C’est dans les villages  environnants de Cotonou que  Julienne voyage pour acheter les galettes d’arachide. Julienne a bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de son activité. Vue l’importance de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître, Julienne sollicite son cinquième crédit pour renforcer son capital. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
S. Julienne was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of five children, all of age. Since her childhood, she has, along with her mother, been selling peanut galettes. After her marriage, Julienne got situated in the same work and on her own. She travels through the villages surrounding Cotonou to buy peanut galettes. She has benefited from four ALIDÉ loans for increasing her business volume. Given the importance of her ever-growing customer base, she's requesting her fifth loan to bolster her capital. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 baskets peanut galettes

loans.name: Adizatou

texts.fr:
K. Adizatou est née vers 1966 à Djougou au Nord du Bénin dans le Département de la Donga. Adizatou est mariée et mère de six enfants. Mais seulement trois enfants sont encore à sa charge. C’est depuis quatre ans que Adizatou s'est installée à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Adizatou vend du sucre en poudre qu’elle attache en sachet de un kilogramme. Adizatou vend aussi la bouillie de maïs accompagnée de beignets faits à base de farine de blé et du sucre. La clientèle de Adizatou s’est accrût, c’est pourquoi Adizatou sollicite de crédit pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Adizatou was born around 1966 in Djougou, in northern Benin in Donga County. She is married and the mother of six children. But only three of them are still in their care. Four years ago, she got situated in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells granulated sugar she packages into 1-kg bags. She also sells cornmeal porridge served with beignets made of wheat flour and sugar. Her customers have increased in number. This is why she's requesting a loan, so as to respond better to the demands of his customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 50-kg sacks of sugar and five 50-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 17 de enero del 2009,gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas, la Sra. Daniela R. D., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, contactó con la asesora ,para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 480.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de frutas y verduras, venta de carne, venta de tortas de miel, etc.
El grupo Renacer es un excelente grupo, que trabaja en forma solidaria, todas las integrantes asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para el bien común del grupo.
texts.en:
The Renacer (Rebirth) Women's Committee was formed on January 17,2009, thanks to the current Director of Finance, Señora Daniela R. D., who is engaged in producing and selling meals. She contacted the Adviser in order to find out about the process used by the Emprendedoras (Enterprising) Women's Committee. With that advice, she managed to bring together 16 women who are now working harmoniously in their second cycle as a solidarity group within the program. The average loan taken out by each participant is 480,000 Guaranís, which will be used for different activities such as: selling meals, or notions, or supplies for the pantry (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba tea, etc.), selling fruits and vegetables, or meat, or selling Torta de Miel (honey cake), etc. The Renacer Group is an excellent group who are working together. All of the members attend the weekly meetings and take part in activities for the common good of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise or supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Michèle Victorine

texts.fr:
T. Michèle Victorine est née le 23 mars 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Michèle Victorine est mariée à MOHAMED Kémal. Michèle Victorine est mère de cinq enfants, tous à la charge de son mari et elle. Michèle Victorine est Coiffeuse de profession. Michèle Victorine a son atelier de coiffure dans la zone des Ambassades et mène à côté de l'atelier la vente des cartes de recharge téléphonique dans une petite cabine téléphonique. Michèle Victorine a déjà bénéficié de trois créditsq pour son activité de téléphonie. Michèle Victorine sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer cette activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Michèle Victorine was born on March 23, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married to MOHAMED Kémal and is the mother of five children, who are all supported by her and her husband. Michèle Victorine is a hairdresser by profession. She has her own salon in the embassy row area and manages the sale of mobile phone recharge cards in a small phone booth next to her shop. She has already benefited from three loans for her telephone business. She's requesting a fourth loan for it. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone recharge cards wholesale

loans.name: Amélia De Jesus

texts.pt:
Amelia nasceu em inhambane tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e mae de dois filhos o primeiro de  6 e  o segundo  de 3 aninhos. O mais velho vai a escola e o novo ao centro infantil.

Quando seu pai e transferido para trabalhar em namaacha ma vila nafronteira de swazilandia leva sua familia junto com ela pois ela ainda era bebe e não podia ficar distante dos seus progenitores. Apois atingir os 6 anos ela inicia com os seus estudos e consegue fazer o curso de professorado durante 2 anos e  e afectada em goba estaçao uma vila a 50km de distancia de namaacha,no mesmo ano esta fica gravida do seu namorado este que se encontrava a estudar na capital. A vida fica muito dificil para amelia pois tinha que cuidar da gravidez sozinha e custear os estudos do seu namorado o que não foi facil, mas ela consegue superar todas as barreiras quando aproxima se ao BIM solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt para compra de um terreno, reembolsou cem nenhum problema. Numa conversa com seus colegas soube da existencia da hkluvuku e aproxima se solicitando um emprestimo para dar inicio da sua obra, amelia trabalha das 7h as 12h auferindo um valor de 7.557.00mt por mês consegue poupar 2.000.00mt mensalmente porque conta com ajuda do seu esposo este que já esta empregado, responsabiliza se pela sua mae enviando lhes uma sexta basica no valor de 1.000.00mt


Este e o segundo emprestimo de amelia na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.o primeiro emprestimo foi usado para comprar material de construçao. Estes 8.000.00mt seram usados para o mesma finalidade, com ajuda do seu esposo esta ciente que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto. Tem como objectivo concluir a sua residencia e dar continuidade dos seus estudos.
texts.en:
Amelia was born in Inhambane and is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, the first is 6, and the second is 3 years old. The oldest goes to school, and the youngest is in day care. When her father was transferred to work in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, he took his family with him. Of course she was only a baby and could not stay far from her parents. After she was 6 she began her schooling. She was able to take a teaching course for 2 years then was stationed in Goba, a town 50 km from Namaacha. In that same year she became pregnant with her boyfriend who was studying in the capital. Life became very difficult for Amelia since she had to care for her pregnancy and pay for the schooling of her boyfriend, which was not easy. She was able to overcome all of those obstacles when she approached BIM to solicit a loan for 20,000MT to purchase some land. She was able to pay it off without any problems. In a conversation with her friends she came to know about the existence of Hluvuku, and she requested a loan to begin her work. Amelia works from 7:00am until 12:00pm earning 7,557MT per month. She is able to save 2,000MT monthly and she counts on the help of her husband who is still working. She is responsible for her mother as well and sends her an amount of 1,000MT. This is Amelia's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan was used to purchase construction materials. This loan of 8,000MT will be used for the same purpose. With the help from her spouse she hopes to pay off the loan before maturity. She has a goal to finish her home and continue with her studies.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
G. Françoise est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Françoise est mariée à FALOLA Raphël menuisier de profession. Françoise vendait des divers. Depuis six ans, Françoise livre du vin de palme et des œufs dans les restaurants de Cotonou parce que cette activité lui est plus rentable. Françoise a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Actuellement, Françoise sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcement son fonds de roulement afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Françoise was born around 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married to FALOLA Raphël, a cabinet maker by profession. Françoise used to sell various goods. For six years, she has been delivering palm wine and eggs to Cotonou restaurants because this business is profitable for her. She has already had three ALIDÉ loans on her business account. Currently, she's requesting a fourth loan to boost her working capital in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy in bulk some eggs and five 50-liter drums of palm wine

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr:
D. Adjara est née vers 1955 dans la Commune de Bassila dans le Département de la Donga au Nord du Bénin. Adjarra est veuve depuis trois ans. Adjarra est mère de cinq enfants tous majeurs. Adjarra s’est installée à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin depuis vingt ans. Adjarra vend les carottes, choux, salades, poivron, persille, concombre, etc. Adjarra a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Adjarra veut pouvoir répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Adjarra sollicite son troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Adjara was born around 1955 in the town of Bassila, in Donga County in northern Benin. She has been a widow for three years, and she is the mother of five children, all of age. Twenty years ago, Adjara got situated in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells carrots, cabbage, salads bell peppers, parsley, cucumbers, etc. She has already benefited from two loans from ALIDÉ for developing her business. She wants to be able to respond to the strong demand of her customers. This is why she's requesting her third loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carrots, cabbage, salads, bell peppers, parsley, cucumbers

loans.name: Zulaikhan Muhammad Yunas Group

texts.en:
Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy scrap for scrap business. 

Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy items (chairs, mirrors, and scissors) for salon. 

Another Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

Zulaikhan baji is the group leader of these three ladies. They all lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan.  Zulaikhan baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Saldivar Poty, se conformó en fecha 22 de marzo del 2007, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Ma. Esther S., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artículos de limpieza, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, pasó por algunos inconvenientes, ya que la hija de la Directora General estuvo internada, y otra de las integrantes estuvo en cama muy enferma, respondiendo sin ningún problema al compromiso aceptado, de esta manera el grupo gracias a su trabajo solidario logró salir adelante y seguir trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  735.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comidas,  venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa(arroz,  azúcar, fideos, lacteos,panificados,yerba,etc),venta de ropas ,venta de lencerías, venta de cosméticos, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de crochet, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee by the name of Saldivar Poty was formed on 22 March 2007. This is thanks to the fact that the current Director General, Maria Esther S., who makes and sells cleaning products, contacted the advisor in a weekly meeting that she was conducting in the neighborhood, so that she (Esther) could learn about the type of work the Enterprising Women’s Committee was doing. Once she was informed about the program, she was able to get together 15 women who are now working very well in their 8th loan cycle, in a mutually supportive manner. During the loan cycles, the group has passed through some difficult times. The Director General’s daughter was very ill and admitted to the hospital. Another of the members was very ill and bedridden for a while. Because the group was very supportive, it accepted responsibility and responded without any trouble; it was able to pull through and continues to work in the program to this day. The average loan size per member is 735.00 PYG, which will be used for different activities, such as: food sales, sewing notions sales, grocery sales (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, breads, herbs, etc.), clothing sales, lingerie sales, cosmetics sales, fruit and vegetable sales, cleaning products sales, crochet sales, etc. All of the members work to raise funds and they help each other so that they can achieve the goals they all have in common as a group in the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in weekly meetings and they are impeccably supportive of each other.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery staples (rice, sugar, herbs, dairy products, breads, sodas, etc.), to buy ingredients for foods, clothing, sewing notions, lingerie, fruits and vegetables, perfumes, cosmetics, yarn for crocheting, ingredients for cleaning products, earrings, rings, bracelets, necklace chains, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Mairaj Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Mairaj baji is a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house in this city and has been living in it with her family for 10 years. Mairaj baji is a very caring lady. She cares for her family a lot and gives them true love. Her husband belongs to an animal selling business. He buys buffalos and sells to the customers. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to increase the profit of her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and tables) for her salon. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling

loans.name: Zubaida Muhammad Khalil Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a daily wage laborer. She works with her husband who is a mason by profession. He constructs buildings and she provides the required material to him. They are a very hardworking couple. Zubaida baji is applying for a loan to buy mason tools for her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Kaniz Fatima baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Salma Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is a very responsible and hardworking lady. She pays all her duties in a very effective way. Her family feels proud of her because she prepares good food for them and takes care of their health. Her husband's name is A. S.; he runs an animal selling business. He takes orders from the butchers and earns income. Salma baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to resell.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy woods to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zainab baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Another Zainab baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to resell

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Capiatá en fecha 27 de enero de 2009,gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Nilda C., quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 475.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de ropas ,venta de lencerías, venta  de helados , etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Santa Lucia is the name of the group of women formed in the city of Capiatá on the 27th of January, 2009, thanks to the current General Director, Nilda C., who works making and selling food. By contacting an Assessor through a weekly meeting that she has in the area. To begin the work of the Committee of Enterprising Women she managed to join 16 women who find themselves already in the second cycle of the program, working comfortably together in a supportive way. The credit for each member is 475.000Gs, which is destined for different activities like the sale of food, haberdashery, general goods (rice, sugar, vermicelli, milk, bread, yerba, etc.), the sale of clothing, the sale of lingerie, the sale of ice creams, etc. All of the women do these activities to collect funds, and they help each other mutually to achieve the common objectives that they all have within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Suraiya Abdul Jabbar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a very good human being. She takes care of her family and wants to make everyone happy with her good nature. Her husband manufactures plastic bags and sells to shops to earn an income. She helps him by arranging the material for him. She is applying for a loan to buy plastic beans to expand her husband’s plastic bag making & selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Husna baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Najma baji wants a loan to buy sugarcanes to sell their juice. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy books (religious and syllabus books) for her book shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making & selling plastic bags

loans.name: Armanda

texts.es: Armanda tiene 44 años, es una madre muy emprendedora, vive en su propia casa con su pareja, con la que tiene 5 hijos, a quienes desea darles buenos estudios, motivo por el cual está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, y esporádicamente siembra hortalizas. Sus cerdos son muy solicitados en las ferias dominicales de Tarma y ya cuenta con clientela fija para sus ventas. Por ello trata de alimentar a sus animales hasta que crezcan y estén bien gorditos, cada día se levanta muy temprano para cuidar y alimentar a sus cerdos, a los que cría con mucho cariño,  puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos tendrá el dinero para mantener a su familia. Los 4 años que lleva en este negocio le han dado la experiencia para tener dominio de los alimentos balanceados que debe darles hasta los 6 meses, cuando ya están listos para la venta. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es que al mismo tiempo puede realizar sus labores hogareñas porque cría a sus cerdos en un espacio de su casa. Para más adelante, Armanda espera incrementar el número de sus animales, asimismo quiere renovar el cerco del lugar donde pernoctan sus cerdos. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, y las veces que dispone de tiempo apoya en las labores de la junta directiva de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de alimentos concentrados para el engorde de sus porcinos, y la otra parte para la mano de obra de un albañil que construya el cerco de su establo.
texts.en:
Armanda is 44 years old. She is a very enterprising mother. She lives in her own home with her partner, with whom she has 5 children whom she wants to give good educations. This is the motive for which she is disposed to work arduously. She works raising pigs, and sometimes growing vegetables. Her pigs are in much asked for in the local markets of Tarma, and she already has loyal clients for her sales. Because of this she tries to feed her animals from the time they are born until they are very fat. Each day she gets up very early to care for and feed her pigs, which she raises with much tenderness as she knows that thanks to them she has the money to maintain her family. The 4 years that she has spent in this business has given her the experience to have control over the balanced food that she gives them during 6 months, when they are ready for sale. What she likes best about this activity is that at the same time she is able to work growing vegetables because she raises her pigs in a space of her home. In the future, Armanda hopes to increase the number of her animals, and at the same time she wants to renovate the fence around the place where her pigs are.
